original: ma bkag pa'i sa la 'og nas 'chad pa rnams bya'o //
analyzed: ma bkag pa'i sa la 'og nas 'chad pa rnams bya'o //
translated: Or else, one should again examine the dream. If the deities give permission or do not object, one should do the following on a site that is not prohibited.

original: bkag ba la ni ma yin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: bkag ba la ni ma yin pa kho na'o //
translated: But if they do object, one should not do it.

original: rmi lam bzang na ni nyi ma gnyis pa bzang po'i snga dro'i dus su sa gnon gyi phyag rgya dang / rdo rje'i skyil mo krung bcas te /
analyzed: rmi lam bzang na ni nyi ma gnyis pa bzang po'i snga dro'i dus su sa gnon gyi phyag rgya dang / rdo rje'i skyil mo krung bcas te /
translated: If one has a good dream, on the second day, in the morning, one should make the earth-touching mudra and sit in the vajra posture.

original: rdo rje sems dpa'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pas aom bhu kham zhes pa'i sngags kyis sa gzhi stong pa nyid dang / h'um lam h'um zhes pas rdo rje'i rdul phra rab kyi rang bzhin du bsgoms la /
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pas aom bhu kham zhes pa'i sngags kyis sa gzhi stong pa nyid dang / h'um lam h'um zhes pas rdo rje'i rdul phra rab kyi rang bzhin du bsgoms la /
translated: Endowed with the yoga of Vajrasattva, one meditates on the ground as emptiness with the mantra Oṃ bhūka haṃ, and as having the nature of subtle vajra particles with Huṃ laṃ haṃ.

original: aom me de n'i badzra'i bha ba badzra bandha h'um zhes pas byin gyis brlab po //
analyzed: aom me de n'i badzra'i bha ba badzra bandha h'um zhes pas byin gyis brlab po //
translated: Then one consecrates it with Oṃ medinī vajrī bhava vajrabandha hūṃ.🔽One imagines three Huṃs on a moon in one’s right hand, recites the mantra three times, and presses down with the light rays and tips of the fingers.

original: lag pa g-yas bar zla ba la h'um gsum bsams la lan gsum brjod pa dang / de'i 'od zer dang sor mo'i rtse mos mnan pa dang / de'i sgra rnams kyis bskul ba las sa'i lha mo ser mo lus phyed dam thams cad 'thon pa phyag gnyis na gser gyi bum pa dang /
analyzed: lag pa g-yas bar zla ba la h'um gsum bsams la lan gsum brjod pa dang / de'i 'od zer dang sor mo'i rtse mos mnan pa dang / de'i sgra rnams kyis bskul ba las sa'i lha mo ser mo lus phyed dam thams cad 'thon pa phyag gnyis na gser gyi bum pa dang /
translated: One invokes the yellow goddess Pṛthivī, either half-emerged or fully emerged, with two hands holding a golden vase,

original: mi 'jigs pa can rgyan bzang pos brgyan pa la zhabs bsil dang zhal bsil dang mchod yon sngon du 'gro ba'i me tog la sogs pas mchod de /
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa can rgyan bzang pos brgyan pa la zhabs bsil dang zhal bsil dang mchod yon sngon du 'gro ba'i me tog la sogs pas mchod de /
translated: fearless, adorned with fine ornaments, with a preliminary offering of washing the feet and face and an offering of water for welcoming.

original: skyob pa sangs rgyas thams cad kyis //
analyzed: skyob pa sangs rgyas thams cad kyis //
translated: All the protector buddhas

original: spyod pa'i tshul dang khyad par dang / sa dang pha rol phyin rnams la //
analyzed: spyod pa'i tshul dang khyad par dang / sa dang pha rol phyin rnams la //
translated: The way of conduct, the distinctions, the levels and the perfections,

original: lha mo khyod ni dbang du gyur //🔽skyob pa sh'akya seng ge yis //
analyzed: lha mo khyod ni dbang du gyur // skyob pa sh'akya seng ge yis //
translated: Goddess, you are the one in control.🔽Just as the protector, the Lion of the Shakyas,

original: ji ltar bdud kyi dbung bcom pa //
analyzed: ji ltar bdud kyi dbung bcom pa //
translated: Crushed the forces of Mara,

original: de bzhin bdag gis bdud kyi dpung //
analyzed: de bzhin bdag gis bdud kyi dpung //
translated: In the same way, I will crush the forces of Mara

original: bcom nas gtsug lag khang sogs bgyi //
analyzed: bcom nas gtsug lag khang sogs bgyi //
translated: And build temples and so forth.

original: zhes lan gsum du gsol ba btab pas kyis shig ces gsungs nas de nyid du thim ste sa'i ngo bor gnas par bsam mo //
analyzed: zhes lan gsum du gsol ba btab pas kyis shig ces gsungs nas de nyid du thim ste sa'i ngo bor gnas par bsam mo //
translated: By reciting this supplication three times, the goddess says, “Do so!” and dissolves into you, becoming of the nature of the earth.

original: de nas sa gzhi der bam las byung ba'i 'khor lo dang / bh'um las byung ba'i gzhal yas khang bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas sa gzhi der bam las byung ba'i 'khor lo dang / bh'um las byung ba'i gzhal yas khang bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Then, on that ground, you should meditate on a wheel arisen from a bam and a celestial mansion arisen from a bhum.

original: kha cig tu yam ram bam lam sum rnams yongs su gyur ba las /
analyzed: kha cig tu yam ram bam lam sum rnams yongs su gyur ba las /
translated: Some say that from the complete transformation of yam, ram, bam, lam, and sum

original: rlung dang me dang chu dangs dang ri'i rgyal po ri rab tsam gyi steng du bh'um las byung pa'i rgyal ba'i sa gzhi'o zhes so //
analyzed: rlung dang me dang chu dangs dang ri'i rgyal po ri rab tsam gyi steng du bh'um las byung pa'i rgyal ba'i sa gzhi'o zhes so //
translated: there is wind, fire, water, earth, and Mount Meru, king of mountains, upon which is the ground of the Victor arisen from a bhum.

original: de la gzhal yas khang gi nang du dri'i dkyil 'khor byas la /
analyzed: de la gzhal yas khang gi nang du dri'i dkyil 'khor byas la /
translated: In that, having made a mandala of scent inside the celestial mansion,

original: rang gi snying ga'i sa bon gyi 'od zer rnams kyis dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo dang / phyogs skyong la sogs pa rnams spyan drangs la zhabs @4a * //
analyzed: rang gi snying ga'i sa bon gyi 'od zer rnams kyis dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo dang / phyogs skyong la sogs pa rnams spyan drangs la zhabs @4a * //
translated: one should invite the wheel of the mandala, the directional guardians, and so on with light rays from the seed syllable in one’s heart.

original: bsil dang / zhal bsil dang / mchod yon dang / mchod pa dang gtor ma dbul ba sngon du 'gro bas lce h'um las rdo rjer byas la sbos phor bzung ste /
analyzed: bsil dang / zhal bsil dang / mchod yon dang / mchod pa dang gtor ma dbul ba sngon du 'gro bas lce h'um las rdo rjer byas la sbos phor bzung ste /
translated: Having offered the washing of the feet, washing of the face, the libation, and the offerings and bali, one should hold a conch shell with the vajra-sealed tongue,

original: dril bu dkrol zhing bcom ldan zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: dril bu dkrol zhing bcom ldan zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
translated: ring the bell, and recite “Bhagavat Hevajra with a retinue of 44 deities,

original: nye bar gnas par mdzad pa'i rig sa //
analyzed: nye bar gnas par mdzad pa'i rig sa //
translated: please come to this place and remain.”

original: nyes pa'i bar 'chad par 'gyur ba'i tshigs su bcad pa'i ra ba gnas kyi sgra'i gnas su gtsug lag khang la sogs pa'i sgra bcug pas nye bar gnas pa dang / sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dang / lha dang klu la sogs pa rnams kyis kyang nam mkha' yongs su gang bar bsams la /
analyzed: nyes pa'i bar 'chad par 'gyur ba'i tshigs su bcad pa'i ra ba gnas kyi sgra'i gnas su gtsug lag khang la sogs pa'i sgra bcug pas nye bar gnas pa dang / sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dang / lha dang klu la sogs pa rnams kyis kyang nam mkha' yongs su gang bar bsams la /
translated: One should imagine that the sky is completely filled with Buddhas, Bodhisattvas, gods, nagas, and so forth.

original: 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rnam par rgyal ba la sogs pa'i bum pa'am /
analyzed: 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rnam par rgyal ba la sogs pa'i bum pa'am /
translated: One should place the victorious vase and so forth that will be explained,

original: yon bdag gi dbang gis de dag med na gzhan gyi yang nang du nya gson bcug pa rnams rim pa bzhin du gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: yon bdag gi dbang gis de dag med na gzhan gyi yang nang du nya gson bcug pa rnams rim pa bzhin du gzhag par bya'o //
translated: or if they are not available due to the power of the patron, other vases with live fish inside, in order.

original: las byed pa rnams bgegs mthar byed la sogs pa las thams cad pa'i lha'i rnam par sprul te /
analyzed: las byed pa rnams bgegs mthar byed la sogs pa las thams cad pa'i lha'i rnam par sprul te /
translated: The ritualists emanate in the aspect of all the deities of the Karma family such as Vighnantaka.

original: de dag gis khung bu gru bzhi pa rgyar khru do pa zabs su de'i phyed pa'i dong brko bar bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gis khung bu gru bzhi pa rgyar khru do pa zabs su de'i phyed pa'i dong brko bar bya'o //
translated: They should dig a square pit two cubits wide and one cubit deep.

original: de'i dbang ldan du zlum po de'i tshad dam de'i phyed pa yang ngo //
analyzed: de'i dbang ldan du zlum po de'i tshad dam de'i phyed pa yang ngo //
translated: The mandala should be the size of that [square], or half of that.

original: de gnyis ka sa dang ba'i lci bas byug par bya'o //🔽de nas khung bu gru bzhi par 'chad par 'gyur ba'i mchod yon gyi sngags nyid kyis mchod yon gyi snod nas mchod yon nas rim pa bzhin du rnam par rgyal ba la sogs pa'i bum pa rnams kyis chu blugs pas /
analyzed: de gnyis ka sa dang ba'i lci bas byug par bya'o // de nas khung bu gru bzhi par 'chad par 'gyur ba'i mchod yon gyi sngags nyid kyis mchod yon gyi snod nas mchod yon nas rim pa bzhin du rnam par rgyal ba la sogs pa'i bum pa rnams kyis chu blugs pas /
translated: Both of those [squares] should be smeared with cow dung.🔽Then, with the mantra of the libation that will be explained, one should fill the square pit with water from the victorious vase, etc.,

original: ji ltar gru bzhi pa bkang nas de'i rgyun gyis zlum po dgad bar bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar gru bzhi pa bkang nas de'i rgyun gyis zlum po dgad bar bya'o //
translated: up to the brim with the stream [of water]. With that [water], one should draw a line around the circle.

original: de'i rjes su nya lcibs dang nya gson bcug la chu g-yas su 'khyil bar bltas la /
analyzed: de'i rjes su nya lcibs dang nya gson bcug la chu g-yas su 'khyil bar bltas la /
translated: After that, having placed oyster shells and live fish, one should look at the water swirling to the right.

original: shing 'o ma can gyi 'dab ma bcug nas /
analyzed: shing 'o ma can gyi 'dab ma bcug nas /
translated: Having placed leaves of a milky tree,

original: bdag nyid dz'am las skyes pa'i rdo rje dang / dz'am las dz'am gu li sor mo /
analyzed: bdag nyid dz'am las skyes pa'i rdo rje dang / dz'am las dz'am gu li sor mo /
translated: one should visualize oneself as Vajrasattva born from a JA or a JA-marked gulikā finger[-breadth].

original: rtsa ba dang g-yas pa dang g-yon pa'i zhal gsum ser ba dang / gnag pa dang / dkar ba /
analyzed: rtsa ba dang g-yas pa dang g-yon pa'i zhal gsum ser ba dang / gnag pa dang / dkar ba /
translated: His three faces are yellow, black, and white,

original: gdengs ka bdun pa /
analyzed: gdengs ka bdun pa /
translated: and he has seven hoods.

original: rin po che'i cod pan can /
analyzed: rin po che'i cod pan can /
translated: He has a jeweled crown.

original: phyag drug gi g-yas pa gnyis kyis rdo rje dang mda' dang / cig shos dag gis gzhu dang zhags pa dang bcas pa'i sdigs mdzub 'dzin pa /
analyzed: phyag drug gi g-yas pa gnyis kyis rdo rje dang mda' dang / cig shos dag gis gzhu dang zhags pa dang bcas pa'i sdigs mdzub 'dzin pa /
translated: Of his six arms, the two right hands hold a vajra and an arrow, and the two left hands hold a bow and a threatening gesture with a lasso.

original: rang snang gi thabs la 'khyud pa /
analyzed: rang snang gi thabs la 'khyud pa /
translated: He embraces his natural manifestation of method.

original: na bza' sna tshogs dang sbrul gyis brgyan pa /
analyzed: na bza' sna tshogs dang sbrul gyis brgyan pa /
translated: He is adorned with various garments and snakes.

original: sna tshogs padma dang nyi ma'i gdan la bzhugs pa /
analyzed: sna tshogs padma dang nyi ma'i gdan la bzhugs pa /
translated: He sits on a multicolored lotus and sun seat.

original: nyi ma'i 'od can du bsgoms te /
analyzed: nyi ma'i 'od can du bsgoms te /
translated: He is imagined to have the radiance of the sun.

original: pad skong la na lnga byas la dbang chen gyi bar du bltas pas /
analyzed: pad skong la na lnga byas la dbang chen gyi bar du bltas pas /
translated: Having performed the five-part lotus dance, up to the great power,

original: sa gzhi sna tshogs rdo rje'i rang bzhin du bsam mo //
analyzed: sa gzhi sna tshogs rdo rje'i rang bzhin du bsam mo //
translated: the ground is imagined to be the nature of a multicolored vajra cross.

original: ltad mo pa'i mi rnams so rtsi dang me tog gi phreng @4b ba dang ; tsandan la sogs pas tshim par bya'o //
analyzed: ltad mo pa'i mi rnams so rtsi dang me tog gi phreng @4b ba dang ; tsandan la sogs pas tshim par bya'o //
translated: The spectators are satisfied with betel nut, flower garlands, sandalwood, and so on.

original: bsrung ba'i don du dbang po la sogs ba phyogs skyong ba bcu 'khor dang bu dang chung ma dang bcas ba dbang ldan du bsams la /
analyzed: bsrung ba'i don du dbang po la sogs ba phyogs skyong ba bcu 'khor dang bu dang chung ma dang bcas ba dbang ldan du bsams la /
translated: For the purpose of protection, Indra and so on, the ten direction protectors with retinues, sons, and wives, are imagined in the northeast.

original: de rnams kyi steng du 'og nas 'chad par 'gyur ba'i phur pa bcu la las thams cad pa'i sngags kyis brgya rtsa brgyad du bsngags pa dang ; don grub rnams aom gha gha zhes pa la sogs pa'i sngags kyis bsrung ba'i don du gdab par bya'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi steng du 'og nas 'chad par 'gyur ba'i phur pa bcu la las thams cad pa'i sngags kyis brgya rtsa brgyad du bsngags pa dang ; don grub rnams aom gha gha zhes pa la sogs pa'i sngags kyis bsrung ba'i don du gdab par bya'o //
translated: On top of those, one should recite the mantra of all activities one hundred and eight times over the ten stakes that will be explained below, and one should plant the stakes of Amoghasiddhi with the mantra “Oṃ gha gha” and so on for the purpose of protection.

original: de nas bgegs dang bral ba'i bsam bas sa bdag dang klu brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas bgegs dang bral ba'i bsam bas sa bdag dang klu brtag par bya'o //
translated: Then, thinking that one is free from obstacles, one should examine the lords of the ground and the nāgas.

original: de yang sa gang dang gtsug lag khang la sogs pa bya ba nye 'khor dang bcas pa de gru bzhir bcal la /
analyzed: de yang sa gang dang gtsug lag khang la sogs pa bya ba nye 'khor dang bcas pa de gru bzhir bcal la /
translated: Moreover, the site of the maṇḍala, such as a temple, and so on, together with the surrounding area, should be divided into four parts.

original: sa de'i nang gi phyogs su sa bdag klu nyal ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid des par bzung ste sa 'dul bya'o //
analyzed: sa de'i nang gi phyogs su sa bdag klu nyal ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid des par bzung ste sa 'dul bya'o //
translated: In the direction of the inside of that site, one should apprehend the characteristics of the sleeping lords of the ground, nāgas, and so on, and tame the site.

original: de la nyi ma rgyu ba'i ston zla ra ba la sogs pa zla ba gsum rim pa bzhin /
analyzed: de la nyi ma rgyu ba'i ston zla ra ba la sogs pa zla ba gsum rim pa bzhin /
translated: In that [site], the three months of the first autumn month, and so on, in which the sun moves, are, respectively,

original: shar dang lho dang nub dang byang phyogs su mgo bstan cing lho la sogs par kha phyogs te /
analyzed: shar dang lho dang nub dang byang phyogs su mgo bstan cing lho la sogs par kha phyogs te /
translated: the east, south, west, and north, with the head indicated, and the south, and so on, are the directions of the face.

original: sa de'i nang du sa bdag klu nyal lo zhes grags so //
analyzed: sa de'i nang du sa bdag klu nyal lo zhes grags so //
translated: In that place, the nāga who is the owner of the ground is said to be sleeping.

original: de brtags nas rdo rje khu tshur gyis thig skud bzung ste //
analyzed: de brtags nas rdo rje khu tshur gyis thig skud bzung ste //
translated: Having examined that, one should hold the chalk line with a vajra fist.

original: sgrub pa'i grogs dang bcas pa g-yas skor gyis bgrod pas me dang rlung du gnas te /
analyzed: sgrub pa'i grogs dang bcas pa g-yas skor gyis bgrod pas me dang rlung du gnas te /
translated: Together with the companions of the practice, one should proceed clockwise and stand in the southeast.

original: shar dang nub dang byad dang lho'i phyogs su thig btab nas /
analyzed: shar dang nub dang byad dang lho'i phyogs su thig btab nas /
translated: Having laid down the chalk line in the east, west, north, and south,

original: nyi ma 'char ba nas brtsams la klu'i mtshan las khru gang do ba'i mtshams kyi char g-yas skor du rtsig rmang brko bar bya'o //
analyzed: nyi ma 'char ba nas brtsams la klu'i mtshan las khru gang do ba'i mtshams kyi char g-yas skor du rtsig rmang brko bar bya'o //
translated: beginning from sunrise, one should dig the foundation trench in the direction of the nāga's head, one cubit away from the nāga's sign, proceeding clockwise.

original: mthong ba'i thad kar yang zhes pa ni kha cig go //
analyzed: mthong ba'i thad kar yang zhes pa ni kha cig go //
translated: Some say in the direction of the sight.

original: gang gi phyir mgo la brkos na pha dang bu la sogs ba nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir mgo la brkos na pha dang bu la sogs ba nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because if one digs at the head, father, son, and so forth will be harmed.

original: rgyab kyi char ni bdag nyid nyams pa'am yul 'pho ba'o //
analyzed: rgyab kyi char ni bdag nyid nyams pa'am yul 'pho ba'o //
translated: In the back, oneself will be harmed or the country will be destroyed.

original: mjug mar ni ba lang dang ma he la sogs pa nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mjug mar ni ba lang dang ma he la sogs pa nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the tail, cows, buffaloes, and so forth will be harmed.

original: sa de la rdo yod na rlung 'byung ngo ;
analyzed: sa de la rdo yod na rlung 'byung ngo ;
translated: If there is stone in that ground, wind will occur.

original: / rus pa yod na zug gzer ro //
analyzed: / rus pa yod na zug gzer ro //
translated: If there are bones, there will be pain.

original: gyo dum yod na lkugs pa nyid do //
analyzed: gyo dum yod na lkugs pa nyid do //
translated: If there are potsherds, there will be dumbness.

original: phub ma dang sol ba yong na rims so //
analyzed: phub ma dang sol ba yong na rims so //
translated: If there are ashes, there will be fever.

original: skra dang rtsva dang shing la sogs pa yod na nye bar 'tshe ba phra mo'o zhes pas /
analyzed: skra dang rtsva dang shing la sogs pa yod na nye bar 'tshe ba phra mo'o zhes pas /
translated: If there are hair, grass, wood, and so forth, there will be minor harm.

original: sdong dum dang rtsva dang grog sbur dang / keng rus dang sol ba la sogs pa bsal la /
analyzed: sdong dum dang rtsva dang grog sbur dang / keng rus dang sol ba la sogs pa bsal la /
translated: Therefore, having removed stumps, grass, ants, skeletons, ashes, and so forth,

original: sa dang me dang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dang / gnas de'i bdag po dang / phyogs skyong dang 'jig rten skyong ba dang zhing skyong rnams zhi ba'i sbyin sreg gis tshim par byas te sa'i bdag po dang yon bdag gi zhi ba bya'o //
analyzed: sa dang me dang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dang / gnas de'i bdag po dang / phyogs skyong dang 'jig rten skyong ba dang zhing skyong rnams zhi ba'i sbyin sreg gis tshim par byas te sa'i bdag po dang yon bdag gi zhi ba bya'o //
translated: one should satisfy the earth, fire, the Tathāgatas, the lords of that place, the guardians of the directions, the guardians of the world, and the guardians of the field with a peace-offering, and one should perform the peace rite for the lord of the land and the patron.

original: phyi nas gtor ma yang dbul lo //
analyzed: phyi nas gtor ma yang dbul lo //
translated: Afterwards, one should also offer a bali.

original: cho ga phyi ma rnams su yang ngo //🔽nus pa ji lta bas dga' ston dang / @5a * //
analyzed: cho ga phyi ma rnams su yang ngo // nus pa ji lta bas dga' ston dang / @5a * //
translated: [One should do so] also in the subsequent rites.

original: dge 'dun gyi ston mo bya'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi ston mo bya'o //
translated: One should perform a festival and a feast for the saṅgha according to one’s ability.

original: bla ma la yon dbul lo //
analyzed: bla ma la yon dbul lo //
translated: One should offer a gift to the guru.

original: bzo bo dang las byed pa rnams kyang mnyes par bya'o zhes pa /
analyzed: bzo bo dang las byed pa rnams kyang mnyes par bya'o zhes pa /
translated: One should also please the craftsmen and the workers.

original: gtsug lag khang dang / mchod rten dang / gtsang khang phyur bu dang / khang bzangs dang / dgon gnas rnams kyi mchod yon gyi cho ga'o //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang dang / mchod rten dang / gtsang khang phyur bu dang / khang bzangs dang / dgon gnas rnams kyi mchod yon gyi cho ga'o //
translated: The rite of worship and service for temples, stūpas, shrines, palaces, and monasteries.

original: rdzing dang rdzing bu dang khron pa la sogs pa byed pa la gtor ma dang mchod yon la sogs pa sngon du 'gro bas de ma thag pa bzhin du mchod yon byas la aom bam badzra ba ru na h'um zhes bas rdo rje chu bdag gi gzugs can
analyzed: rdzing dang rdzing bu dang khron pa la sogs pa byed pa la gtor ma dang mchod yon la sogs pa sngon du 'gro bas de ma thag pa bzhin du mchod yon byas la aom bam badzra ba ru na h'um zhes bas rdo rje chu bdag gi gzugs can
translated: The rite of worship and service for ponds, pools, wells, and so forth, is preceded by the bali offering and the rite of worship and service, as follows: Having made the rite of worship and service, one should visualize the form of Vajra Varuṇa with the mantra Oṃ vaṃ vajra-varuṇa hūṃ.

original: rnams par snang mdzad bsams la /
analyzed: rnams par snang mdzad bsams la /
translated: One should visualize Vairocana.

original: de yongs su gyur pa las klu rigs brgyad kyi bdud rtsi'i chus gang ba /
analyzed: de yongs su gyur pa las klu rigs brgyad kyi bdud rtsi'i chus gang ba /
translated: That completely transforms into a pond filled with the nectar of the eight classes of nāgas.

original: aom badzra satva sa ma ya stvam zhes brjod cing /
analyzed: aom badzra satva sa ma ya stvam zhes brjod cing /
translated: Reciting Oṃ vajra-sattva samaya-sattva,

original: dbang chen gyi gting la thug par yan lag brgyad dang ldan pa'i chus gang bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: dbang chen gyi gting la thug par yan lag brgyad dang ldan pa'i chus gang bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: one should visualize it filled with water possessing the eight qualities down to the bottom of the great ocean.

original: zhes pa rdzing la sogs pa'i mchod yon gyi cho ga'o //
analyzed: zhes pa rdzing la sogs pa'i mchod yon gyi cho ga'o //
translated: This is the rite of worship and service for ponds and so forth.

original: sku gzugs dang pu sti la sogs pa byed pa la ni gtor ma dang mchod pa sngon du 'gro bas /
analyzed: sku gzugs dang pu sti la sogs pa byed pa la ni gtor ma dang mchod pa sngon du 'gro bas /
translated: In the case of making images, books, and so forth, having first made offerings and a torma,

original: bzo bo rnams byed par 'gyur ba'i lha'i rigs kyi bdag po'i gzugs su dang / yig mkhan rnams snang ba mtha' yas kyi ngo bor te /
analyzed: bzo bo rnams byed par 'gyur ba'i lha'i rigs kyi bdag po'i gzugs su dang / yig mkhan rnams snang ba mtha' yas kyi ngo bor te /
translated: the artists should visualize themselves as the form of the lord of the family of the deity that they are making, and the scribes should visualize themselves as the essence of Amitābha.🔽At their hearts are their individual seed syllables, and at their hearts, throats, and heads are hūṃ, āḥ, and oṃ, respectively, abiding in vajras, lotuses, and wheels.

original: snying gar rang rang gi sa bon dang / snying ga dang mgrin ba dang / mgo bo rnams la rim pa bzhin rdo rje dang padma dang 'khor lo rnams la gnas pa'i h'um a'a: aom rnams dang / g-yon ba dang cig shos kyi lag pa dag la zla ba dang rdo rje ngag dang ldan par skad cig gis bsams la /
analyzed: snying gar rang rang gi sa bon dang / snying ga dang mgrin ba dang / mgo bo rnams la rim pa bzhin rdo rje dang padma dang 'khor lo rnams la gnas pa'i h'um a'a: aom rnams dang / g-yon ba dang cig shos kyi lag pa dag la zla ba dang rdo rje ngag dang ldan par skad cig gis bsams la /
translated: On their left and right hands are moon and vajra, and they are endowed with speech.

original: snying ga la sogs par reg cing h'um a'a: aom zhes brjod pas byin gyis brlabs nas /
analyzed: snying ga la sogs par reg cing h'um a'a: aom zhes brjod pas byin gyis brlabs nas /
translated: Having blessed them by touching their hearts and so forth and saying hūṃ, āḥ, and oṃ,

original: shing dang 'jim pa dang rdo dang ras la sogs pa'i rdzas gtsang ma rnams stod pa nyid du lhag par mos nas skad cig gis snying ga'i sa bon gyis byed par 'gyur ba'i lha'i gzugs su bsams la ;
analyzed: shing dang 'jim pa dang rdo dang ras la sogs pa'i rdzas gtsang ma rnams stod pa nyid du lhag par mos nas skad cig gis snying ga'i sa bon gyis byed par 'gyur ba'i lha'i gzugs su bsams la ;
translated: Having imagined that the pure substances such as wood, clay, stone, cloth, and so on, are the very best, one should imagine them instantly to be the divine form that is to be created by the seed syllable at the heart.

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes pa la sogs pa nas /🔽nye bar gnas par mdzad pa'i rigs //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes pa la sogs pa nas / nye bar gnas par mdzad pa'i rigs //
translated: One should recite the verse beginning, “The Blessed One, the Lord of the Body, Speech, and Mind of all Tathagatas,”🔽and ending with,

original: zhes pa'i bar du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar du brjod par bya'o //
translated: “Please be present in this divine form.”

original: shog bu ni yi ge dh'i: bsgoms pa'i 'od zer gyis spyan drangs pa'i gsung rdo rje yi ge'i rnam par gyur par bsgom mo //
analyzed: shog bu ni yi ge dh'i: bsgoms pa'i 'od zer gyis spyan drangs pa'i gsung rdo rje yi ge'i rnam par gyur par bsgom mo //
translated: The paper is the syllable dhiḥ. One should imagine that the light rays emitted from the meditation on the syllable dhiḥ invite the Speech Vajra in the form of syllables.

original: rang nyid kyis kyang aom badzra satva h'um zhes pa dang / aom a'a: bighn'anta kri ta h'um zhes lan nyi shu rtsa gcig tu bsngags pa'i rir la sogs pa dang / smyu gu shes rab ye shes kyi bdag nyid du dang / snag tsha yang rdo rje'i rdul par rab yong sa su gyur pa las ye shes kyi bdud rtsi'i rnam par bsam zhing /
analyzed: rang nyid kyis kyang aom badzra satva h'um zhes pa dang / aom a'a: bighn'anta kri ta h'um zhes lan nyi shu rtsa gcig tu bsngags pa'i rir la sogs pa dang / smyu gu shes rab ye shes kyi bdag nyid du dang / snag tsha yang rdo rje'i rdul par rab yong sa su gyur pa las ye shes kyi bdud rtsi'i rnam par bsam zhing /
translated: One should also recite the mantra of Vajrasattva twenty-one times, namely, Oṃ vajrasattva hūṃ, and the mantra of Acala, namely, Oṃ āḥ viganāntakṛta hūṃ.🔽The pen is the nature of wisdom-knowledge, and the ink is the nature of vajra dust, which becomes the form of wisdom nectar.

original: yang aom dh'i: shu ti smram ti bi tsa ya sarba aa dzny'a na pa da la aa pa ha ri nam hr'i: sv'a h'a zhes pas @5b smyu gu dang snag tsha la bsngags la de rnams la gtad do //
analyzed: yang aom dh'i: shu ti smram ti bi tsa ya sarba aa dzny'a na pa da la aa pa ha ri nam hr'i: sv'a h'a zhes pas @5b smyu gu dang snag tsha la bsngags la de rnams la gtad do //
translated: Also, with the mantra Oṃ dhiḥ śukra smara vicaya sarva-ajñāna pada la aparihāṇi hriḥ svāhā, one should consecrate the pen and ink.

original: yi ge brgya bas brtan par bya'o //
analyzed: yi ge brgya bas brtan par bya'o //
translated: One should stabilize them with the hundred-syllable mantra.

original: bzo bo mnyes pa dang dge 'dun la ston mo la sogs pa bya'o //
analyzed: bzo bo mnyes pa dang dge 'dun la ston mo la sogs pa bya'o //
translated: One should please the artist and give a feast for the saṅgha and so forth.

original: thams cad du yang 'dir sgom ba'i lha gshegs su gsol bar bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad du yang 'dir sgom ba'i lha gshegs su gsol bar bya'o //
translated: In all cases, here one should request the deity of meditation to depart.

original: zhig pa dang gas pa'i gtsug lag khang la sogs pa lhar 'dus bya bar 'dod pas gtor ma dang mchod pa la sogs pa byas te /
analyzed: zhig pa dang gas pa'i gtsug lag khang la sogs pa lhar 'dus bya bar 'dod pas gtor ma dang mchod pa la sogs pa byas te /
translated: One should make offerings, such as bali and worship, to the temples and so forth that have been destroyed or damaged, with the desire to assemble the deities.

original: rab gnas kyi tshe bzhugs su gsol ba'i lha rnams gshegs su gsol la /
analyzed: rab gnas kyi tshe bzhugs su gsol ba'i lha rnams gshegs su gsol la /
translated: At the time of the consecration, one should request the invited deities to depart.

original: de kho na bzhin du 'dus bya ba la sogs pa bya'o //
analyzed: de kho na bzhin du 'dus bya ba la sogs pa bya'o //
translated: One should perform the assembly and so forth just as before.

original: sku gzugs la sogs pa'i mchod yon gyi cho ga'o //
analyzed: sku gzugs la sogs pa'i mchod yon gyi cho ga'o //
translated: This is the rite of offering water and so forth to the images and so forth.

original: 'dir 'chad bzhin pa'i cho ga rnams su ji ltar rigs par /
analyzed: 'dir 'chad bzhin pa'i cho ga rnams su ji ltar rigs par /
translated: In these rites that are being explained, one should do as is appropriate.

original: gser dngul rdo dang zangs dang shing //🔽sar byas nya phyis dung dang ni //
analyzed: gser dngul rdo dang zangs dang shing // sar byas nya phyis dung dang ni //
translated: Gold, silver, stone, copper, wood,🔽clay, mother-of-pearl, conch,🔽leaves, foot-washing water,

original: 'dab ma'i skyong bu zhabs bsil dang / bsang gtor zhal bsil mchod yon snod //
analyzed: 'dab ma'i skyong bu zhabs bsil dang / bsang gtor zhal bsil mchod yon snod //
translated: rinsing water, offering water vessels,

original: de dang snod gzhan du nas dang 'o ma dang / me tog dkar po dang / ku sha dang / til dang / 'bras yos dang / dri dkar po'i chu bdud rtsi dang bcas pa rnams blugs la /
analyzed: de dang snod gzhan du nas dang 'o ma dang / me tog dkar po dang / ku sha dang / til dang / 'bras yos dang / dri dkar po'i chu bdud rtsi dang bcas pa rnams blugs la /
translated: and in other vessels rice, milk, white flowers, kuśa grass, sesame seeds, parched flour, and white scented water with amṛta are poured.

original: aom a'a: h'um zhes pa'i sngags dang / rang gi rigs kyi bdag po'i sngags dang / bdud rtsi 'khyil pa'i sngags kyis lan bdun nam /
analyzed: aom a'a: h'um zhes pa'i sngags dang / rang gi rigs kyi bdag po'i sngags dang / bdud rtsi 'khyil pa'i sngags kyis lan bdun nam /
translated: seven or one hundred and eight times,

original: brgya rtsa brgyad du bsngags te zhi ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: brgya rtsa brgyad du bsngags te zhi ba'i don du'o //
translated: for the sake of pacification.🔽For the sake of increase, one should eat sesame, yogurt, blue flowers,

original: rgyas pa'i don du til dang zho dang me tog seng po dang / ku sha dang / dri ser po'i chu bdud rtsi dang bcas pa blugs la de ltar bzas par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyas pa'i don du til dang zho dang me tog seng po dang / ku sha dang / dri ser po'i chu bdud rtsi dang bcas pa blugs la de ltar bzas par bya'o //
translated: kusha grass, and water with yellow fragrance and nectar, having consecrated it in that way.🔽 Then, to the left of oneself, one should place a vessel for the welcome offering,

original: de nas rang gi g-yon logs su mchod yon gyi snod dang / zhabs bsil gyi snod dang / bsang gtor dang zhal bsil gyi snod gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas rang gi g-yon logs su mchod yon gyi snod dang / zhabs bsil gyi snod dang / bsang gtor dang zhal bsil gyi snod gzhag par bya'o //
translated: a vessel for the foot-washing, and a vessel for the sprinkling and rinsing water.

original: de rnams kyi mdun du bzed zhal gyi snod stong pa gsum yang ngo //
analyzed: de rnams kyi mdun du bzed zhal gyi snod stong pa gsum yang ngo //
translated: In front of those, three empty vessels for receiving are also [placed].

original: de la khu tshur g-yas pa'i mthe bong dang / mdzub mo'i skam bas zhabs bsil gyi snod kyi chu dang me tog 'gying ba'i tshul gyis ser mo rnams bskor zhing blangs la 'chad par 'gyur ba'i sngags kyis mdzub mo dang gung mo dang srin lag dang /
analyzed: de la khu tshur g-yas pa'i mthe bong dang / mdzub mo'i skam bas zhabs bsil gyi snod kyi chu dang me tog 'gying ba'i tshul gyis ser mo rnams bskor zhing blangs la 'chad par 'gyur ba'i sngags kyis mdzub mo dang gung mo dang srin lag dang /
translated: With the right fist, the thumb and index finger pick up the water from the foot-washing vessel and the flower, and with the gesture of pride, the fingers are circled and the water is taken up.

original: mthe'u chung rnams rin gyis dgrol zhing snod du lan gsum dbul lo //
analyzed: mthe'u chung rnams rin gyis dgrol zhing snod du lan gsum dbul lo //
translated: With the mantra to be explained, the index, middle, ring, and pinky fingers are released and the water is offered to the vessel three times.

original: snod gnyis ba'i chu lag pa g-yas par bzung ba'i ku sha'i chun po'i rtse mos blangs te bzed zhal gyi snod gnyis par lan gsum bsang gtor bya'o //
analyzed: snod gnyis ba'i chu lag pa g-yas par bzung ba'i ku sha'i chun po'i rtse mos blangs te bzed zhal gyi snod gnyis par lan gsum bsang gtor bya'o //
translated: The water from the second vessel is taken up with the tip of the bundle of kuśa grass held in the right hand and is sprinkled three times in the second vessel.

original: las thams cad pa'i bum ba'i chus bsang gtor bya ba la yang de ltar ro //
analyzed: las thams cad pa'i bum ba'i chus bsang gtor bya ba la yang de ltar ro //
translated: The sprinkling with the water of the vase of all activity is also done in that way.

original: snod gnyis pa nyid kyi chu g-yas pa'i khu tshur gyi mthe bong dang / mdzub mo'i skam pas @6a * //
analyzed: snod gnyis pa nyid kyi chu g-yas pa'i khu tshur gyi mthe bong dang / mdzub mo'i skam pas @6a * //
translated: The water from the second vessel is held with the thumb and index finger of the right fist.

original: me tog bzung la /
analyzed: me tog bzung la /
translated: The flower is held.

original: zhal bsil gyi ched du bzed zhal gnyis pa de nyid du 'chad par 'gyur ba'i sngags brjod cing /
analyzed: zhal bsil gyi ched du bzed zhal gnyis pa de nyid du 'chad par 'gyur ba'i sngags brjod cing /
translated: For the mouth washing, recite the mantra that will be explained and pour it into the very same vessel with two openings.

original: kha 'og tu phyogs pa'i khu tshur gyi mthe chung dang srin lag dang gung mo dang mdzub mo rnams rim gyis dgrol zhing lan gsum du dbul lo //
analyzed: kha 'og tu phyogs pa'i khu tshur gyi mthe chung dang srin lag dang gung mo dang mdzub mo rnams rim gyis dgrol zhing lan gsum du dbul lo //
translated: With the fist turned downward, release the little finger, ring finger, middle finger, and forefinger in sequence and offer three times.

original: gsum pa mchod yon gyi snod kyi chu la sogs pa snyim pas bzung la /
analyzed: gsum pa mchod yon gyi snod kyi chu la sogs pa snyim pas bzung la /
translated: For the third, hold the water for the offering water vessel in the cupped hands.

original: aom a'a: hr'i: pra ba ra satk'a ram aargham pra t'i tstsha h'um sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom a'a: hr'i: pra ba ra satk'a ram aargham pra t'i tstsha h'um sv'a h'a /
translated: Recite oṃ āḥ hrīḥ pravara satkarma arghaṃ pratīccha hūṃ svāhā.

original: zhes brjod cing bzed zhal gyi snod gsum par rdo rje thal mo phye bas lan gsum dbul lo //
analyzed: zhes brjod cing bzed zhal gyi snod gsum par rdo rje thal mo phye bas lan gsum dbul lo //
translated: Open the vajra-folded palms and offer three times into the third vessel for the mouth washing.

original: gong gi zhabs bsil dang / bsang gtor dang / zhal bsil gsum ni aargham gyi sgra dor nas rim pa bzhin du p'a dyam dang ; proksha nam dang / aanydza ma nam zhes pa bcug pas dbul lo //
analyzed: gong gi zhabs bsil dang / bsang gtor dang / zhal bsil gsum ni aargham gyi sgra dor nas rim pa bzhin du p'a dyam dang ; proksha nam dang / aanydza ma nam zhes pa bcug pas dbul lo //
translated: For the above three—foot washing, sprinkling, and mouth washing—omit the word arghaṃ and insert pādyam, prokṣaṇam, and aṅgamam, respectively, and offer.

original: zhabs bsil dang / bsang gtor dang / mchod yon sbyin pa'i rim pas 'di ni phal cher las mthong ngo //
analyzed: zhabs bsil dang / bsang gtor dang / mchod yon sbyin pa'i rim pas 'di ni phal cher las mthong ngo //
translated: The sequence of offering water for the feet, sprinkling water, and offering water for drinking is seen in most [rituals].

original: kha cig tu ni gzhan du'o //
analyzed: kha cig tu ni gzhan du'o //
translated: In some [rituals], it is different.

original: bsang gtor ni ji ltar rigs pa'o //🔽kha cig tu ni dang po mchod yon dbul lo //
analyzed: bsang gtor ni ji ltar rigs pa'o // kha cig tu ni dang po mchod yon dbul lo //
translated: Sprinkling water is [done] as appropriate.🔽In some [rituals], first offer water for drinking.

original: kha cig tu ni mchod yon dbul ba kho na'o //
analyzed: kha cig tu ni mchod yon dbul ba kho na'o //
translated: In some [rituals], only offer water for drinking.

original: skabs ji lta bar ji ltar 'os par bya'o //
analyzed: skabs ji lta bar ji ltar 'os par bya'o //
translated: [Do it] as appropriate to the occasion.

original: de la zhabs bsil gyi chu ni lha rnams kyi zhabs bkru ba'i phyir dbul bar bsam mo //
analyzed: de la zhabs bsil gyi chu ni lha rnams kyi zhabs bkru ba'i phyir dbul bar bsam mo //
translated: For that, imagine that you offer water for the feet for the sake of washing the feet of the deities.

original: bsang gtor ni sku thams cad la'o //🔽zhal bsil ni phyag gam zhal du'o //
analyzed: bsang gtor ni sku thams cad la'o // zhal bsil ni phyag gam zhal du'o //
translated: Sprinkling water is [done] for the entire body.🔽Water for the mouth is [offered] to the hands or face.

original: mchod yon ni mdun nam dbu la'o //
analyzed: mchod yon ni mdun nam dbu la'o //
translated: Water for drinking is [offered] in front or on the head.

original: me tog ni dbu la'o ;
analyzed: me tog ni dbu la'o ;
translated: Flowers are [offered] on the head.

original: / bdug spos dang mar me ni mdun du'o //
analyzed: / bdug spos dang mar me ni mdun du'o //
translated: Incense and lamps are [offered] in front.

original: lha bshos ni mdun nam phyag gam zhal du'o //
analyzed: lha bshos ni mdun nam phyag gam zhal du'o //
translated: Food offerings are [offered] in front, to the hands, or to the face.

original: dri ni thugs kar ro //
analyzed: dri ni thugs kar ro //
translated: Scent is [offered] to the heart.

original: de lta bu ni cho ga thams cad du'o //
analyzed: de lta bu ni cho ga thams cad du'o //
translated: This is for all rituals.

original: mchod yon la sogs pa dbul ba'i mtshan nyid kyi cho ga'o //
analyzed: mchod yon la sogs pa dbul ba'i mtshan nyid kyi cho ga'o //
translated: This is the rite for the characteristics of offering water for the feet and so forth.

original: de nas gtsug lag khang la sogs pa rdzogs pa'i rab tu gnas pa'am /
analyzed: de nas gtsug lag khang la sogs pa rdzogs pa'i rab tu gnas pa'am /
translated: Then, for the sake of the consecration of the completion of the temple and so forth,

original: dbang bskur ba'i don du gsol ba btab par gyur pas sam /
analyzed: dbang bskur ba'i don du gsol ba btab par gyur pas sam /
translated: or for the sake of the conferral of initiation,

original: rang ngam gzhan gyi dngos grub sgrub pa la sogs pa don du gnyer bas sam /
analyzed: rang ngam gzhan gyi dngos grub sgrub pa la sogs pa don du gnyer bas sam /
translated: or for the sake of the accomplishment of one's own or another's spiritual power, and so forth,

original: sems can gyi don chen po mthong bas sam /
analyzed: sems can gyi don chen po mthong bas sam /
translated: or by seeing the great benefit for sentient beings,🔽or even by the urging of others,

original: gzhan gyis bskul bas kyang rung ste dkyil 'khor bri ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan gyis bskul bas kyang rung ste dkyil 'khor bri ba'i phyir /
translated: one should draw the mandala for the sake of the path of omniscience.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i lam shes pas //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i lam shes pas //
translated: One who knows the path of omniscience

original: sngon du bsnyen pa'i tshogs bsags shing //
analyzed: sngon du bsnyen pa'i tshogs bsags shing //
translated: should first accumulate the requisites of service,

original: bgegs ni rnam par nyams byed bya //
analyzed: bgegs ni rnam par nyams byed bya //
translated: and should weaken the obstructors.

original: bsnyen pa med pas dngos grub med //
analyzed: bsnyen pa med pas dngos grub med //
translated: Without service, there is no spiritual power.

original: de phyir rim gnyis de nyid rig //
analyzed: de phyir rim gnyis de nyid rig //
translated: Therefore, one who knows reality should

original: dben par yang dag gnas nas ni //
analyzed: dben par yang dag gnas nas ni //
translated: dwell in solitude and

original: lha yi 'khor lo bsgom par bya //
analyzed: lha yi 'khor lo bsgom par bya //
translated: meditate on the circle of deities.

original: skyon de yi gsang sngags bzla //
analyzed: skyon de yi gsang sngags bzla //
translated: One should recite the mantra of that deity.

original: 'khor lo'i gtso bo'i 'bum @6b bzlas shing //
analyzed: 'khor lo'i gtso bo'i 'bum @6b bzlas shing //
translated: One should recite the hundred thousand [mantras] of the principal deity of the circle,

original: yang na rang gi lhag lha'i 'bum //
analyzed: yang na rang gi lhag lha'i 'bum //
translated: or the hundred thousand [mantras] of one's own special deity,

original: dkyil 'khor pa yi khri yin te //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor pa yi khri yin te //
translated: and the ten thousand [mantras] of the circle deities.

original: 'di ni sngon du bsnyen par brjod //
analyzed: 'di ni sngon du bsnyen par brjod //
translated: This is said to be the preliminary service.

original: de yang bskyed pa dang rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i lha rnams kyi bsgom pa'i rim pa dang sngags dag gzhan du tshul bzhin du rgyas par gsal bar byas pas 'dir ma spros so //
analyzed: de yang bskyed pa dang rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i lha rnams kyi bsgom pa'i rim pa dang sngags dag gzhan du tshul bzhin du rgyas par gsal bar byas pas 'dir ma spros so //
translated: Moreover, the stages of meditation and the mantras of the deities of the creation and completion stages have been clearly and extensively set forth elsewhere, so I will not elaborate on them here.

original: 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rdul tshon gyi dkyil 'khor mang po rnams kyi so so'i dbyibs dang sku mdog dang / zhal dang phyag dang mtshan ma dang sngags tsam brjod kyang gzhung mang bar 'gyur bas nyung du la mos pa rnams mi 'jug par dogs pas dbyibs la sogs pa tsam yang 'dir ma bstan no ;
analyzed: 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rdul tshon gyi dkyil 'khor mang po rnams kyi so so'i dbyibs dang sku mdog dang / zhal dang phyag dang mtshan ma dang sngags tsam brjod kyang gzhung mang bar 'gyur bas nyung du la mos pa rnams mi 'jug par dogs pas dbyibs la sogs pa tsam yang 'dir ma bstan no ;
translated: Even if I were to mention just the shapes, colors, faces, hands, emblems, and mantras of the many maṇḍalas of colored powders that will be explained, the text would become too long, and those who are interested in brevity might not engage in it, so I have not taught even just the shapes and so forth here.

original: / kho bo cag gis rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor gyi phreng bar ni dbang po rnon po'i blo ngor byas te dkyil 'khor gyi lha bsgom pa'i rim pa dang / snying po bsdus pa brjod pa ni nges par bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: / kho bo cag gis rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor gyi phreng bar ni dbang po rnon po'i blo ngor byas te dkyil 'khor gyi lha bsgom pa'i rim pa dang / snying po bsdus pa brjod pa ni nges par bsgom par bya'o //

translated: for the sake of the maṇḍala.🔽Please grant it to me.”

original: zhes lan gsum gsol ba btab ste de dag gis rmi lam la sogs par byin pa'am /
analyzed: zhes lan gsum gsol ba btab ste de dag gis rmi lam la sogs par byin pa'am /
translated: Having made this request three times, if they grant it in a dream, and so on,

original: ma bkag par rig nas nyi ma gzhan gyi snga dro la nam mkha'i dkyil na bzhugs pa'i dpal rdo rje 'chang la sogs pa rnams la yid kyis gsol ba btab la rjes su gnang ba zhus te /
analyzed: ma bkag par rig nas nyi ma gzhan gyi snga dro la nam mkha'i dkyil na bzhugs pa'i dpal rdo rje 'chang la sogs pa rnams la yid kyis gsol ba btab la rjes su gnang ba zhus te /
translated: Having understood that without obstructing it, one should supplicate mentally in the early morning of another day to Śrī Vajradhara and so forth residing in the center of the sky, and request permission.

original: nyi ma'i gung la srung ba'i 'khor lo dang bgegs la phur bus btab pa bsgoms pas sam ;
analyzed: nyi ma'i gung la srung ba'i 'khor lo dang bgegs la phur bus btab pa bsgoms pas sam ;
translated: At noon, one should expel obstructors by meditating on the protection wheel and the kīla of obstructors,

original: drag po'i sbyin sreg gis bgegs bskrad par bya'o //
analyzed: drag po'i sbyin sreg gis bgegs bskrad par bya'o //
translated: or by a wrathful burnt offering.

original: sbyin sreg gi phyogs la slob ma bsrung ba'i don du phyi dro'i tshe /
analyzed: sbyin sreg gi phyogs la slob ma bsrung ba'i don du phyi dro'i tshe /
translated: In the case of a burnt offering, in the evening for the purpose of protecting the disciples,🔽one should perform a pacifying burnt offering in the hearth located in the southeast.

original: me mtshams na gnas pa'i thab khung du zhi ba'i sbyin sreg byas las de yang aom a'a: bighn'anta kri ta h'um zhes pa la sogs pa las thams cad pa'i sngags bzlas pa'i yungs kar dang / chu dang thal ba rnams kyis bsang ngo //
analyzed: me mtshams na gnas pa'i thab khung du zhi ba'i sbyin sreg byas las de yang aom a'a: bighn'anta kri ta h'um zhes pa la sogs pa las thams cad pa'i sngags bzlas pa'i yungs kar dang / chu dang thal ba rnams kyis bsang ngo //
translated: One should purify that with mustard seeds, water, and ash, which are enchanted with the mantra of all activities, “Oṃ āḥ viśva kṛta haḥ.”

original: de nas sa der rdo rje skyil krung bcas te /
analyzed: de nas sa der rdo rje skyil krung bcas te /
translated: Then, sitting in the vajra posture on that ground,

original: sa'i lha mo mchod par 'gyur ba'i gzugs can bsgoms la /
analyzed: sa'i lha mo mchod par 'gyur ba'i gzugs can bsgoms la /
translated: one should meditate on the earth goddess in the form of one who is to be worshipped.

original: zhabs bsil dang / zhal bsil dang / mchod yon dang / mchod pa sngon du 'gro bas /
analyzed: zhabs bsil dang / zhal bsil dang / mchod yon dang / mchod pa sngon du 'gro bas /
translated: Having first made the foot-washing, the face-washing, the libation, and the offerings,

original: aom tshur spyon zhes pa la sogs pas sam /
analyzed: aom tshur spyon zhes pa la sogs pas sam /
translated: with Om, come here! and so forth,

original: skyob pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan gsum du gsol ba btab pas de ltar gyis shig ces brjod pa can yid kyis bteg la nam mkha' la bzhugs su gsol lo //🔽de nas sa de bgegs med par rig nas gtor ma byin te sngar bzhin du sa bdag klu'i mtshan gyi char mgrin pa nub tsam mam /
analyzed: skyob pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan gsum du gsol ba btab pas de ltar gyis shig ces brjod pa can yid kyis bteg la nam mkha' la bzhugs su gsol lo // de nas sa de bgegs med par rig nas gtor ma byin te sngar bzhin du sa bdag klu'i mtshan gyi char mgrin pa nub tsam mam /
translated: or with The protector! and so forth, one invites them with the mental recitation of Do so! and one requests them to dwell in the sky.

original: chu la thug pa'am /
analyzed: chu la thug pa'am /
translated: Then, having ascertained that the ground is free of obstacles, one gives the sacrificial cake, and as before, one digs down to the level of the throat, or to the level of the water,

original: rdo la thug pa'am /
analyzed: rdo la thug pa'am /
translated: or to the level of the stone,

original: dngos grub dman pa dang 'bring dang mchog gi dbye bas pus mo'am dku'am lte ba tsam du brko bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: dngos grub dman pa dang 'bring dang mchog gi dbye bas pus mo'am dku'am lte ba tsam du brko bar bya ba'o //
translated: or to the level of the knee, or the armpit, or the navel, according to the division of the lesser, middling, and greater powers.

original: sa rko ba'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: sa rko ba'i cho ga'o //
translated: This is the rite of digging the ground.

original: de nas / rdo bar bcas na rlung chen po //
analyzed: de nas / rdo bar bcas na rlung chen po //
translated: If there is a stone, there is a great wind.

original: rus par bcas na zug gzer 'byung //🔽gyo dum dang bcas lkugs pa nyid //
analyzed: rus par bcas na zug gzer 'byung // gyo dum dang bcas lkugs pa nyid //
translated: If there is bone, there is pain.🔽If there is gravel, there is dumbness.

original: phub ma sol ba ldan na rims//
analyzed: phub ma sol ba ldan na rims//
translated: If there is chaff or charcoal, there is consumption.

original: skra dang rtsa ba shing sogs bcas //
analyzed: skra dang rtsa ba shing sogs bcas //
translated: With hair, roots, wood, and so forth.

original: nye bar 'tshe ba phra mo 'byung //
analyzed: nye bar 'tshe ba phra mo 'byung //
translated: The harm will be slight.

original: zhes shes par bya ste /
analyzed: zhes shes par bya ste /
translated: One should understand it in this way.

original: thal ba dang sol ba dang skra dang phub ma dang rdo ba dang dus pa dang gyo dum dang so phag dang shing du ma la sogs pa bsal la /
analyzed: thal ba dang sol ba dang skra dang phub ma dang rdo ba dang dus pa dang gyo dum dang so phag dang shing du ma la sogs pa bsal la /
translated: One should remove ashes, charcoal, hair, chaff, stones, potsherds, bricks, wood, and so forth.

original: sa de nyid dri bzang po'i chu dang sbyar bas dong dgang ngo //
analyzed: sa de nyid dri bzang po'i chu dang sbyar bas dong dgang ngo //
translated: That very ground should be filled with a hole with water mixed with fragrant substances.

original: ma khengs na gzhan gyis kyang ngo //
analyzed: ma khengs na gzhan gyis kyang ngo //
translated: If it is not filled, it should be filled with another.

original: @8b de nas yi ge h'um dang las thams cad pa'i sngags bzlas pa'i dri bzang po'i chus gtor zhing brdungs la /
analyzed: @8b de nas yi ge h'um dang las thams cad pa'i sngags bzlas pa'i dri bzang po'i chus gtor zhing brdungs la /
translated: Then, having sprinkled and beaten with fragrant water, while reciting the syllable HŪṀ and the all-activity mantra,

original: khru phyed tsam du mtho zhing mnyam la cung zad rus sbal gyi rgyab ltar mtho ba dang / shar dang byang gi mtshams yid tsam dma' bar bya'o //🔽gzhan yang / sa sel nyes pa thams cad ni //
analyzed: khru phyed tsam du mtho zhing mnyam la cung zad rus sbal gyi rgyab ltar mtho ba dang / shar dang byang gi mtshams yid tsam dma' bar bya'o // gzhan yang / sa sel nyes pa thams cad ni //
translated: it should be made level, slightly elevated, like the back of a tortoise, and slightly lower at the northeast corner.🔽Moreover,

original: gal te 'byung bar mi nus na //
analyzed: gal te 'byung bar mi nus na //
translated: if it is not possible to remove all the faults of the ground,

original: lag pas reg la sngags bzlas bya //
analyzed: lag pas reg la sngags bzlas bya //
translated: one should touch it with one's hand and recite the mantra.

original: de nyid dag pa mchog tu 'gyur //
analyzed: de nyid dag pa mchog tu 'gyur //
translated: That very [ground] will become the supreme purity.

original: khang bzangs brag steng ba glang lhas //
analyzed: khang bzangs brag steng ba glang lhas //
translated: On a terrace, a rock, a cow pen,

original: gtsug lag khang sogs chu 'gram mam //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang sogs chu 'gram mam //
translated: a temple, and so forth, on a river bank,

original: sngon dus byas pa'i gnas dag tu //
analyzed: sngon dus byas pa'i gnas dag tu //
translated: or in a place where it was done before,

original: ma brkos na yang dag pa yin //
analyzed: ma brkos na yang dag pa yin //
translated: if it is not dug up, it is pure.

original: der ni bdud rtsi 'khyil pa 'ba' zhig gis sdang ba rnams bsal zhing //
analyzed: der ni bdud rtsi 'khyil pa 'ba' zhig gis sdang ba rnams bsal zhing //
translated: There, only Amṛtakuṇḍali should remove the hostility,

original: yungs kar dang chu dang thal ba la bzlas la gtor bar bya'o //
analyzed: yungs kar dang chu dang thal ba la bzlas la gtor bar bya'o //
translated: and one should scatter mustard seed, water, and ashes, while reciting [the mantra].

original: sa 'di dang brkos shing brdungs pa la shar gyi phyogs nas brtsams te ba'i rnam lnga la de bzlas pas byug cing dri'i chus kyang gtor la /
analyzed: sa 'di dang brkos shing brdungs pa la shar gyi phyogs nas brtsams te ba'i rnam lnga la de bzlas pas byug cing dri'i chus kyang gtor la /
translated: Having begun in the eastern direction, one should smear this ground, dug up and beaten, with the five products of the cow, while reciting [the mantra], and also sprinkle it with scented water.

original: aom bhu: kham zhes brjod phas nam mkhar ro //
analyzed: aom bhu: kham zhes brjod phas nam mkhar ro //
translated: By saying oṃ bhūḥ kham, [the ground] is in space.

original: de nas h'um lam h'um zhes brjod pas rdo rje'i rang bzhin du bsgoms te /
analyzed: de nas h'um lam h'um zhes brjod pas rdo rje'i rang bzhin du bsgoms te /
translated: Then, by saying hūṃ laṃ hūṃ, it is meditated as having the nature of a vajra.

original: aom me di n'i badzr'i bha ba badzra bandha h'um zhes pa dang / aom ha na ha na badzra kro dha h'um phat ces pa dang / aom a'a: h'um shodha ya sho dha ya raksha raksha h'um h'um phat ces pas bsngags shing lag pas reg ste byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
analyzed: aom me di n'i badzr'i bha ba badzra bandha h'um zhes pa dang / aom ha na ha na badzra kro dha h'um phat ces pa dang / aom a'a: h'um shodha ya sho dha ya raksha raksha h'um h'um phat ces pas bsngags shing lag pas reg ste byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
translated: One should touch it with one's hand, consecrate it, and recite the mantras.

original: sa de'i dbus su ji ltar 'os par rin po che lnga dang sman lnga dang ; 'bru lnga la las thams cad ba bzlas pa bcug ste /
analyzed: sa de'i dbus su ji ltar 'os par rin po che lnga dang sman lnga dang ; 'bru lnga la las thams cad ba bzlas pa bcug ste /
translated: In the middle of that ground, in a suitable place, one should place the five jewels, the five medicines, and the five grains, which have been empowered by the mantra of all activities.

original: de bzlas pa'i dri'i chus byugs par nam mkha' la gnas pa'i sa'i lha mo la gtor ma dang zhal bsil la sogs pa phul te bstims la /
analyzed: de bzlas pa'i dri'i chus byugs par nam mkha' la gnas pa'i sa'i lha mo la gtor ma dang zhal bsil la sogs pa phul te bstims la /
translated: One should anoint it with water empowered by that mantra, and offer a sacrificial cake, water for welcoming, and so forth to the goddess of the ground who resides in the sky, and dissolve her.

original: aom a'a: h'um zhes brjod cing lag pa pad skor gyi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: aom a'a: h'um zhes brjod cing lag pa pad skor gyi phyag rgya'o //
translated: One should say Om A: Hum! and make the mudra of the lotus-whirling.

original: yi ge brgya ba yang brjod par bya'o ;
analyzed: yi ge brgya ba yang brjod par bya'o ;
translated: One should also recite the hundred-syllable mantra.

original: ; sna tshogs pa stong pa nyid dang ro gcig pa'o //
analyzed: ; sna tshogs pa stong pa nyid dang ro gcig pa'o //
translated: It is the oneness of the diversity and emptiness.

original: zhes bstan par mos pas sa de nyid kyi rang bzhin du rnam par dag par mos par bya ba ni bla na med pa'i rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bstan par mos pas sa de nyid kyi rang bzhin du rnam par dag par mos par bya ba ni bla na med pa'i rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: Imagine that the place is purified in its nature as the very ground of that bhumi.

original: de nas 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rim pas shar la sogs pa'i phyogs nges bar byas te dkyil 'khor gyi gnas de rgyar ji ltar 'dod par phub pa'i sgo bzhi pa'i gzhal yas khang gi dbus su chud pa /🔽phyogs bzhir rta babs dang dra ba'i khor yug gis bskor ba thams cad du rgyan sna tshogs dang / me tog gi phreng ba dang / dril bu dang ldan pa /
analyzed: de nas 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rim pas shar la sogs pa'i phyogs nges bar byas te dkyil 'khor gyi gnas de rgyar ji ltar 'dod par phub pa'i sgo bzhi pa'i gzhal yas khang gi dbus su chud pa / phyogs bzhir rta babs dang dra ba'i khor yug gis bskor ba thams cad du rgyan sna tshogs dang / me tog gi phreng ba dang / dril bu dang ldan pa /
translated: Then, having ascertained the directions such as east in the order to be explained, in the center of that place of the mandala, which is as wide as you wish, is the celestial mansion with four doors.🔽It is surrounded by a fence and a latticed enclosure, completely surrounded by various ornaments, garlands of flowers, and bells.

original: tog dam pa dang / bla res sbras pa'o //🔽de ltar sa sbyang @9a * //
analyzed: tog dam pa dang / bla res sbras pa'o // de ltar sa sbyang @9a * //

original: ba'i chog rnam pa gsum yin no //
analyzed: ba'i chog rnam pa gsum yin no //
translated: Thus, there are three parts to the purification of the ground.

original: der dkyil 'khor gyi sa'i dbus su me tog gcal du bkram par 'dug la rdo rje dang dril bu bzung ste 'dri bar 'gyur ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi rnal 'byor dang ldan pas /
analyzed: der dkyil 'khor gyi sa'i dbus su me tog gcal du bkram par 'dug la rdo rje dang dril bu bzung ste 'dri bar 'gyur ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi rnal 'byor dang ldan pas /
translated: In the center of the maṇḍala ground, having scattered flowers, holding the vajra and the bell, endowed with the yoga of the maṇḍala to be drawn,

original: srung ba'i 'khor lo la sogs pas bgegs bsal te /
analyzed: srung ba'i 'khor lo la sogs pas bgegs bsal te /
translated: one should clear away obstructors with the protection wheel, and so on.

original: spos phor bzung la lce h'um las skyes pa'i rdo rjer byas nas /🔽ma lus phyogs na bzhugs pa yi //
analyzed: spos phor bzung la lce h'um las skyes pa'i rdo rjer byas nas / ma lus phyogs na bzhugs pa yi //
translated: Holding the incense burner, having made one’s tongue a vajra born from hūṃ,🔽one should invite the buddhas, and so on, with the following:🔽All buddhas dwelling in the ten directions

original: sangs rgyas rnams ni bdag la dgongs //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams ni bdag la dgongs //
translated: should consider me.

original: bdag ni rdo rje che ge yis //
analyzed: bdag ni rdo rje che ge yis //
translated: I, the vajra master so and so,

original: 'dir ni dkyil 'khor bri bar bgyi //
analyzed: 'dir ni dkyil 'khor bri bar bgyi //
translated: will draw the maṇḍala here.

original: sangs rgyas la sogs kun byon 'tshal //
analyzed: sangs rgyas la sogs kun byon 'tshal //
translated: I request all buddhas and so on

original: dngos grub 'di ni yang dag stsol //🔽zhes sangs rgyas la sogs pa rnams la snyan gsan zhing mchod la /
analyzed: dngos grub 'di ni yang dag stsol //🔽zhes sangs rgyas la sogs pa rnams la snyan gsan zhing mchod la /

analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa nam mkha' la bzhugs pa dang / shar la sogs pa'i gnas su slob ma rdo rje dang / rdo rje dril bu 'dzin pa ci ltar rigs par rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pa bzhi rnams kyis sam /
translated: The four disciples, holding vajra and bell, endowed with the yoga of Vairochana, etc., should be placed in the directions beginning with the east, holding vajra and bell, and abiding in the sky, or else,

analyzed: slob ma gcig nyid rim pa bzhin de dang der song bas kyang /
translated: a single disciple should go to each place in turn.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa kun zhi ba /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa kun zhi ba /
translated: The request: All tathagatas are peaceful,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa kun gyi gnas //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa kun gyi gnas //
translated: the abode of all tathagatas,

original: chos kun bdag med pa yi mchog //
analyzed: chos kun bdag med pa yi mchog //
translated: the supreme selflessness of all phenomena,

original: dkyil 'khor dam pa bshad du gsol //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor dam pa bshad du gsol //
translated: please explain the sacred mandala.

original: mtshan nyid thams cad yang dag rdzogs //
analyzed: mtshan nyid thams cad yang dag rdzogs //

analyzed: mtshan nyid min pa thams cad spangs // kun du bzang po sku yi mchog //
translated: all non-characteristics are abandoned,🔽the supreme body of Samantabhadra,

original: dkyil 'khor dam pa bshad du gsol //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor dam pa bshad du gsol //
translated: please explain the sacred mandala.

analyzed: zhi ba'i chos mchog las byung ba //

translated: the supreme speech of Samantabhadra,🔽please explain the sacred mandala.🔽 The reply: All minds are completely pure,🔽the supreme mind of Samantabhadra,🔽the supreme mind of all buddhas,🔽please explain the sacred mandala.🔽 The request: All phenomena are completely pure,🔽the supreme phenomena of Samantabhadra,🔽the supreme phenomena of all buddhas,🔽please explain the sacred mandala.🔽 The reply: All entities are completely pure,🔽the supreme entity of Samantabhadra,🔽the supreme entity of all buddhas,

analyzed: kun du bzang po gsung gi mchog //

original: dkyil 'khor dam pa bshad du gsol //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor dam pa bshad du gsol //
translated: Please explain the sacred mandala.

original: sems can kun gyi sems chen po //
analyzed: sems can kun gyi sems chen po //
translated: The great mind of all sentient beings,

original: rang bzhin dag cing dri ma med //
analyzed: rang bzhin dag cing dri ma med //
translated: Pure by nature, stainless,

original: kun bzang thugs mchog kha lo sgyur //
analyzed: kun bzang thugs mchog kha lo sgyur //
translated: The supreme mind of Samantabhadra, the guide,

original: dkyil 'khor dam pa bshad du gsol //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor dam pa bshad du gsol //
translated: Please explain the sacred mandala.

original: zhes pa'i tshigs su bcad pa bzhi re re so so nas bdag nyid la gsol ba 'debs su gzhug go //
analyzed: zhes pa'i tshigs su bcad pa bzhi re re so so nas bdag nyid la gsol ba 'debs su gzhug go //
translated: Each of these four verses should be recited by the disciples themselves as a request.

original: rigs lnga dang ldan pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa kun gyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: rigs lnga dang ldan pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa kun gyi rang bzhin no //
translated: Since it possesses the five families, it is the nature of all tathāgatas.

original: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa zhi ba chen po'i ting nge 'dzin 'byung bas zhi ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa zhi ba chen po'i ting nge 'dzin 'byung bas zhi ba'o //
translated: Since the samādhi of great peace such as Vairocana arises, it is peace.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad gnas pas na gnas so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad gnas pas na gnas so //
translated: Since it is the abode of all tathāgatas, it is the abode.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa rnams kyi rang bzhin med pa nyid kyi ngo bos ni chos kun bdag med pa'i mchog go //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa rnams kyi rang bzhin med pa nyid kyi ngo bos ni chos kun bdag med pa'i mchog go //
translated: The naturelessness of the foundations of mindfulness and so on is the supreme selflessness of all phenomena.

original: stong pa dang snying rje dbyer med pa bde ba chen po'i snying po @9b len pa gsal bar byed pa'i phyir rdul tshon gyi dkyil 'khor yang dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: stong pa dang snying rje dbyer med pa bde ba chen po'i snying po @9b len pa gsal bar byed pa'i phyir rdul tshon gyi dkyil 'khor yang dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: It is a mandala because it illuminates the taking of the essence of great bliss, which is the inseparability of emptiness and compassion.

original: gru bzhi pa nyid la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: gru bzhi pa nyid la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa rdzogs pa'o //
translated: It is complete because it has the characteristics of being square and so forth.

original: phra ba dang sbom pa'i nyes pa dang bral bas na spangs pa'o //
analyzed: phra ba dang sbom pa'i nyes pa dang bral bas na spangs pa'o //
translated: It is abandoned because it is free from the faults of being too small or too large.

original: sku'i mchog sku rdo rje'i rang bzhin 'di la yod pas na sku'i mchog go //
analyzed: sku'i mchog sku rdo rje'i rang bzhin 'di la yod pas na sku'i mchog go //
translated: It is the supreme body because it has the nature of the vajra body.

original: dkar po'i chos kyi ngo bor gsal bar byung bas chos mchog las 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: dkar po'i chos kyi ngo bor gsal bar byung bas chos mchog las 'byung ba'o //
translated: It is arisen from the supreme dharma because it has arisen as the essence of the virtuous dharmas.

original: de lta bur gyur pa'i ye shes kyi ched du spyod pa gang yin pa de sbyong bar byed pas na ye shes spyod pa rnam sbyong mdzad do //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa'i ye shes kyi ched du spyod pa gang yin pa de sbyong bar byed pas na ye shes spyod pa rnam sbyong mdzad do //
translated: It is the purifier of the conduct of wisdom because it purifies the conduct that is for the sake of that kind of wisdom.

original: de gsal bar mdzad pa po nyid kyis gsung rdo rje'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de gsal bar mdzad pa po nyid kyis gsung rdo rje'i rang bzhin no //
translated: It is the nature of the vajra speech because it is the very illuminator of that.

original: chos thams cad kyi ngo bor spro bas na sems chen po'o ;
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi ngo bor spro bas na sems chen po'o ;
translated: It is the great mind because it is the emanation of the essence of all dharmas.

original: / don dam par kun brtags thams cad dang bral bas thugs rdo rje'i rang bzhin ni rang bzhin dag cing dri ma med do //
analyzed: / don dam par kun brtags thams cad dang bral bas thugs rdo rje'i rang bzhin ni rang bzhin dag cing dri ma med do //
translated: The nature of the mind-vajra is pure and stainless, because ultimately it is free from all the imagined.

original: 'dul bar 'os pa 'dul ba na kha lo sgyur ba ste bshad du gsol zhes de ltar mngon du byed cing ngo //
analyzed: 'dul bar 'os pa 'dul ba na kha lo sgyur ba ste bshad du gsol zhes de ltar mngon du byed cing ngo //
translated: When those who are suitable to be disciplined are disciplined, he is the charioteer.

original: dngos su gsol ba 'debs pa po med na bsam gtan gyis kyang de ltar bya ste 'di ltar man ngag go //
analyzed: dngos su gsol ba 'debs pa po med na bsam gtan gyis kyang de ltar bya ste 'di ltar man ngag go //
translated: If there is no one who actually makes the request, then one should do it oneself with meditative concentration.

original: de nas dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo la sogs pa spro ba la sogs sngon du 'gro bas bsgoms pa'i dkyil 'khor rdo rje khu tshur gnyis kyi mdzub mo gnyis brkyang la rtse mo sbyar ba 'og tu phyogs par spyi por bzung zhing h'um badzra au tishtha zhes brjod
analyzed: de nas dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo la sogs pa spro ba la sogs sngon du 'gro bas bsgoms pa'i dkyil 'khor rdo rje khu tshur gnyis kyi mdzub mo gnyis brkyang la rtse mo sbyar ba 'og tu phyogs par spyi por bzung zhing h'um badzra au tishtha zhes brjod
translated: Then, preceded by the emanation of the mandala wheel and so forth, hold the vajra fists at the crown with the two index fingers extended and touching at the tip, facing down, and recite “huṃ vajro’ṣṇīṣa.”

original: cing nam mkha' la bteg ste /
analyzed: cing nam mkha' la bteg ste /
translated: Lift it up into the sky.

original: de nas skyil krung bshig la langs te /
analyzed: de nas skyil krung bshig la langs te /
translated: Then, break the cross-legged position and stand up.

original: kha shar du phyogs pas mnyam pa'i rkang stabs byas la /
analyzed: kha shar du phyogs pas mnyam pa'i rkang stabs byas la /
translated: With the face turned to the east, take an even step.

original: mgo bor thal mo sbyar bas de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la phyag byas nas /
analyzed: mgo bor thal mo sbyar bas de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la phyag byas nas /
translated: Having bowed to the Tathagatas with palms joined over the head,

original: sems can ma rig pa'i mun par song zhing bdud kyis byin gyis brlabs pa rnams la mngon par bltas la /
analyzed: sems can ma rig pa'i mun par song zhing bdud kyis byin gyis brlabs pa rnams la mngon par bltas la /
translated: one should look upon those sentient beings who have entered the darkness of ignorance and are empowered by Mara.

original: bdud bsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bdud bsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to dispel Mara,

original: skad cig gis mchod par 'gyur ba'i rdo rje h'um mdzad sku khro bo'i cha byad can /
analyzed: skad cig gis mchod par 'gyur ba'i rdo rje h'um mdzad sku khro bo'i cha byad can /
translated: one should instantly become Vajra Humkara, with a wrathful form,

original: smin ma gnyer zhing mche ba gtsigs pa /
analyzed: smin ma gnyer zhing mche ba gtsigs pa /
translated: frowning and baring fangs,

original: shin tu khros pa'i cha byad kyis g-yon pa la sogs pa dan ldan pas yi ge mas mig g-yas pa nyi mar byas pa dang / yi ge tas mig g-yon pa zla bar byas pa dang / yi ge h'um gis mig 'bras gnyis dus mtha'i me ltar byas pa'i rdo rje'i blta ba'i phyogs thams cad du 'gro ba la blta ba dang /
analyzed: shin tu khros pa'i cha byad kyis g-yon pa la sogs pa dan ldan pas yi ge mas mig g-yas pa nyi mar byas pa dang / yi ge tas mig g-yon pa zla bar byas pa dang / yi ge h'um gis mig 'bras gnyis dus mtha'i me ltar byas pa'i rdo rje'i blta ba'i phyogs thams cad du 'gro ba la blta ba dang /
translated: with a very wrathful appearance, holding a banner in the left hand, and so on, with the syllable ma making the right eye into the sun, the syllable ta making the left eye into the moon, and the syllable hum making the two eyeballs like the fire at the end of time, with a vajra gaze looking in all directions.

original: nga rgyal bskyed par byas te /
analyzed: nga rgyal bskyed par byas te /
translated: One should generate pride,

original: nga ni rang nyid rdo rje can //
analyzed: nga ni rang nyid rdo rje can //
translated: thinking, I am the very Vajra Holder.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' rang nyid dang // nga ni sangs rgyas rgyal po che //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' rang nyid dang // nga ni sangs rgyas rgyal po che //
translated: I am Vajrasattva himself, and I am the king of the buddhas.

original: nga ni stobs can rdo rje can//
analyzed: nga ni stobs can rdo rje can//
translated: I am the powerful one with the vajra.

original: @10a * // pa ni rnal 'byor dbang phyug rgyal //🔽phyag na rdo rje ston pa nga //
analyzed: @10a * // pa ni rnal 'byor dbang phyug rgyal // phyag na rdo rje ston pa nga //
translated: I am the lord of yogins, the victor.🔽I am Vajrapāṇi, the teacher.

original: bdag po rdo rje bdag po ste //
analyzed: bdag po rdo rje bdag po ste //
translated: I am the lord, the vajra lord,

original: byin gyis brlabs pa mi 'dor ro //
analyzed: byin gyis brlabs pa mi 'dor ro //
translated: and I do not abandon the consecration.

original: zhes so // de nas rkang pa'i mthil du rdo rje 'bar ba bsgom zhing skabs ji ltar bgyi ba dang bcas pa'i bang skor byed cing /
analyzed: zhes so // de nas rkang pa'i mthil du rdo rje 'bar ba bsgom zhing skabs ji ltar bgyi ba dang bcas pa'i bang skor byed cing /
translated: Then, visualizing a blazing vajra on the soles of the feet, one should circumambulate clockwise, doing whatever is appropriate.

original: rdo rje gsor nas dril bu dkrol zhing rdo rje'i rkang stabs nyid kyis dbang ldan gyi phyogs su phyin la de nas brtsams te slob ma dang lhan cig g-yas skor du dkyil 'khor gyis gzhir rdo rje'i rkang stabs kyis gar byed cing //🔽mig gnyis lag gnyis de bzhin dku //
analyzed: rdo rje gsor nas dril bu dkrol zhing rdo rje'i rkang stabs nyid kyis dbang ldan gyi phyogs su phyin la de nas brtsams te slob ma dang lhan cig g-yas skor du dkyil 'khor gyis gzhir rdo rje'i rkang stabs kyis gar byed cing // mig gnyis lag gnyis de bzhin dku //
translated: Having waved the vajra and rung the bell, one should go to the northeast corner with the vajra step. Then, beginning from there, one should dance with the vajra step on the ground of the maṇḍala, circling to the right together with the disciples.🔽The two eyes, the two hands, and likewise the two hips,

original: rkang pa gzhogs su g-yas su bskor //
analyzed: rkang pa gzhogs su g-yas su bskor //
translated: the two feet, and the two shoulders,🔽should be turned to the right.

original: pheg rdob sbyor bas dgyer bar bya //
analyzed: pheg rdob sbyor bas dgyer bar bya //
translated: One should dance with the performance of claps.

original: slar yang g-yon du de bzhin no //🔽de nas rgyug pa'i gar byed nas //
analyzed: slar yang g-yon du de bzhin no // de nas rgyug pa'i gar byed nas //
translated: Again, to the left, in the same way.🔽Then, having danced the running dance,

original: de nas g-yo zhing gar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas g-yo zhing gar bya'o //
translated: then one should dance with swaying movements.

original: myur du pheg rdob de bzhin du //
analyzed: myur du pheg rdob de bzhin du //
translated: Quickly beating the time, in the same way,

original: gar byed 'khor lo 'drar bskor zhing //
analyzed: gar byed 'khor lo 'drar bskor zhing //
translated: dancing, one should roll like a wheel.

original: gang su dag lha dang / lha ma yin dang / gnod sbyin dang / srin po dang / yi dags dang ; sha za dang / brjod byed dang / 'byung po dang / mkha' 'gro dang / mkha' 'gro ma dang / grib gnon rgan po dang /
analyzed: gang su dag lha dang / lha ma yin dang / gnod sbyin dang / srin po dang / yi dags dang ; sha za dang / brjod byed dang / 'byung po dang / mkha' 'gro dang / mkha' 'gro ma dang / grib gnon rgan po dang /
translated: Whoever they may be, gods, demigods, yakṣas, rākṣasas, pretas, piśācas, pūtanas, bhūtas, ḍākas, ḍākinīs, old grahas,

original: grib gnon rgan mo dang / g-yog dang 'khor dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi 'am ci dang / rigs sngags 'chang grub pa khyed rnams dengs shig /
analyzed: grib gnon rgan mo dang / g-yog dang 'khor dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi 'am ci dang / rigs sngags 'chang grub pa khyed rnams dengs shig /
translated: old grahas, servants, retinue, garuḍas, kinnaras, and accomplished mantra adepts, you should all go away.

original: sa'i phyogs 'dir bdag rdo rje slob dpon che ge mo zhes pas sems can thams cad kyis bla na med pa'i ye shes thob par bya ba'i phyir dang / slob ma che ge mo zhes bya ba'i mngon par byang chub pa rdzogs par bya ba'i don du dpal che ge mo zhes pa'i dkyil 'khor chen po bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: sa'i phyogs 'dir bdag rdo rje slob dpon che ge mo zhes pas sems can thams cad kyis bla na med pa'i ye shes thob par bya ba'i phyir dang / slob ma che ge mo zhes bya ba'i mngon par byang chub pa rdzogs par bya ba'i don du dpal che ge mo zhes pa'i dkyil 'khor chen po bri bar bya'o //
translated: In this place, I, the vajra master named so-and-so, will draw the great mandala of the glorious so-and-so in order that all sentient beings may attain unsurpassed wisdom and in order to perfect the manifest enlightenment of the disciple named so-and-so.

original: de'i phyir rdo rje 'chang chen po'i bka' 'di thos nas myur du dengs shig /
analyzed: de'i phyir rdo rje 'chang chen po'i bka' 'di thos nas myur du dengs shig /
translated: Therefore, having heard this command of Great Vajradhara, quickly depart.

original: gang dag mi 'gro ba de'i mgo bo bdag gis h'um mdzad kyi rdo rje 'bar ba gsal zhing rab tu gsal ba'i ye shes kyi rdo rje chen po 'dis rnam pa brgyar dags par bya'o zhes pa'am /
analyzed: gang dag mi 'gro ba de'i mgo bo bdag gis h'um mdzad kyi rdo rje 'bar ba gsal zhing rab tu gsal ba'i ye shes kyi rdo rje chen po 'dis rnam pa brgyar dags par bya'o zhes pa'am /
translated: Those who do not leave, their heads will be shattered into a hundred pieces by this blazing, very clear, great vajra of the wisdom of the blazing vajra Humkara.

original: lus ngag yid la gnas pa yi //
analyzed: lus ngag yid la gnas pa yi //
translated: Abiding in body, speech, and mind,

original: bgegs kyi tshogs kun yang dag nyon //
analyzed: bgegs kyi tshogs kun yang dag nyon //
translated: all hosts of obstructors, listen well!

original: nga ni dpal ldan rdo rje 'chang //
analyzed: nga ni dpal ldan rdo rje 'chang //
translated: I am the glorious Vajradhara,

original: bka' yi 'khor lo sbyor ba po //
analyzed: bka' yi 'khor lo sbyor ba po //
translated: the one who turns the wheel of command.

original: rdo rje 'bar ba'i gzugs kyis ni //
analyzed: rdo rje 'bar ba'i gzugs kyis ni //
translated: With the form of the blazing vajra,

original: lus gsum las byung dags bya ste //
analyzed: lus gsum las byung dags bya ste //
translated: and say three times:

original: gal te kha cig bdag la 'das //
analyzed: gal te kha cig bdag la 'das //
translated: “If someone has offended me,

original: 'dir ni 'jig 'gyur gzhan du min //
analyzed: 'dir ni 'jig 'gyur gzhan du min //
translated: may he be destroyed here, not elsewhere.”

original: zhes lan gsum brjod cing khro bo dpag tu med pa spros pas bgegs rnams bsal @10b bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhes lan gsum brjod cing khro bo dpag tu med pa spros pas bgegs rnams bsal @10b bar bya'o //
translated: Having said this, one should dispel the obstructors by emanating countless wrathful ones.

original: dkyil 'khor gyis gzhi yang dbang chen gyi gting gi bar du h'um la byung ba'i rdo rje'i rang bzhin du byin gyis brlab bo //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyis gzhi yang dbang chen gyi gting gi bar du h'um la byung ba'i rdo rje'i rang bzhin du byin gyis brlab bo //
translated: One should also bless the ground of the maṇḍala as far as the bottom of the great water maṇḍala as the nature of a vajra arisen from hūṃ.

original: 'dir bskor ba'i dus su sgro so sor bdag nyid g-yon du gnas pa'i slob mas dril bu'i nang du rdo re gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir bskor ba'i dus su sgro so sor bdag nyid g-yon du gnas pa'i slob mas dril bu'i nang du rdo re gzhug par bya'o //
translated: Here, at the time of circumambulation, the disciple who is on one’s left should place the vajra in the bell.

original: de'i rdo rje yang bdag nyid kyi dril bur ro//
analyzed: de'i rdo rje yang bdag nyid kyi dril bur ro//
translated: One’s vajra should also be placed in one’s bell.

original: de ltar mdun dang g-yas dang rgyab tu yang ngo //
analyzed: de ltar mdun dang g-yas dang rgyab tu yang ngo //
translated: In the same way, in front and to the right and left.

original: de la h'um las skyes pa'i rdo rje rtse gcig pa rkang mthil du bsams nas /
analyzed: de la h'um las skyes pa'i rdo rje rtse gcig pa rkang mthil du bsams nas /
