translated: There, having imagined a single-tined vajra arisen from hūṃ at the soles of the feet,

original: rkang mthil des rdo rje de sa la bri zhing gar gyis bskor bar bya'o //
analyzed: rkang mthil des rdo rje de sa la bri zhing gar gyis bskor bar bya'o //
translated: one should draw that vajra on the ground with those soles and dance.

original: de nas de bzhin du rtse gsum pa'o //
analyzed: de nas de bzhin du rtse gsum pa'o //
translated: Then, in the same way, the three-pointed one.

original: de nas de bzhin du rtse lnga pa'o //
analyzed: de nas de bzhin du rtse lnga pa'o //
translated: Then, in the same way, the five-pointed one.

original: de nas sna tshogs rdo rje yang de bzhin du ste 'on kyang phyir log nas bskor zhing rjes dgod do //
analyzed: de nas sna tshogs rdo rje yang de bzhin du ste 'on kyang phyir log nas bskor zhing rjes dgod do //
translated: Then, the crossed vajra is also like that, but turning back, it is placed behind.

original: zhi po 'di rnams rdo rjes mtshan pa dang / rdo rje 'dri bas rdo rje'i rkang stabs te so sor g-yas skor du g-yas brkyang la sogs pa rnams byed pas lan re bya'o //
analyzed: zhi po 'di rnams rdo rjes mtshan pa dang / rdo rje 'dri bas rdo rje'i rkang stabs te so sor g-yas skor du g-yas brkyang la sogs pa rnams byed pas lan re bya'o //
translated: These peaceful ones are marked with vajras, and with vajra steps, one should do them individually, turning to the right, with right leg extended, and so on.

original: de nas g-yon pa'i byin pa bskum nas mtho lnga'i bar du rkang pa g-yas pa 'gying pa dang bcas pas drang por brkyang pa ni g-yas brkyang ngo //
analyzed: de nas g-yon pa'i byin pa bskum nas mtho lnga'i bar du rkang pa g-yas pa 'gying pa dang bcas pas drang por brkyang pa ni g-yas brkyang ngo //
translated: Then, bending the left leg, extending the right leg straight up to five cubits with swaying, is the right leg extended.

original: byin pa g-yas pa bskum nas g-yon pa de bzhin du byas pa ni g-yon brkyang ngo //
analyzed: byin pa g-yas pa bskum nas g-yon pa de bzhin du byas pa ni g-yon brkyang ngo //
translated: Bending the right leg, doing the same with the left, is the left leg extended.

original: sor nyi shu rtsa drug gi rgyar brkyang ba'i sor mo logs su bstan cing /
analyzed: sor nyi shu rtsa drug gi rgyar brkyang ba'i sor mo logs su bstan cing /
translated: Extending the fingers twenty-six finger-widths apart, with the fingers facing outward,

original: pus mo gnyis drang por byas pa ni sa ga'o //
analyzed: pus mo gnyis drang por byas pa ni sa ga'o //
translated: and straightening the two knees, is the squatting position.

original: sa ga'i rkang stabs nyid bar du khru do ba ngang pa'i gshog pa ltar byas pa ni zlum po'i rkang stabs so //
analyzed: sa ga'i rkang stabs nyid bar du khru do ba ngang pa'i gshog pa ltar byas pa ni zlum po'i rkang stabs so //
translated: The gait of a goose, with the feet a cubit apart, is the round gait.

original: rkang pa gnyis kyi sor mo phan tshun sbyar ba ni mnyam pa'i rkang stabs so //
analyzed: rkang pa gnyis kyi sor mo phan tshun sbyar ba ni mnyam pa'i rkang stabs so //
translated: The even gait is with the toes of both feet interlaced.

original: lnga po 'di rnams byed pa na re re byed cing bskor ba lan re rdzogs par bya'o zhes pa ni kha cig go //
analyzed: lnga po 'di rnams byed pa na re re byed cing bskor ba lan re rdzogs par bya'o zhes pa ni kha cig go //
translated: Some say that when doing these five, one should do each and complete the circling once.

original: re re byed cing bskor ba lan gsum mo zhes pa ni gzhan dag go //
analyzed: re re byed cing bskor ba lan gsum mo zhes pa ni gzhan dag go //
translated: Others say that one should do each and circle three times.

original: 'dir nges pa cung zad med do zhes pa kha cig go //
analyzed: 'dir nges pa cung zad med do zhes pa kha cig go //
translated: Some say that there is no certainty here.

original: rting pa gnyis kyi bar du sor mo bzhi byas shing rkang pa g-yon pa drang por byas te 'gying ba dang bcas pas g-yas pa mtho gang gi bar du logs su bstan cing yangs pa can gyi sgrol ma'i zhabs ltar byas pa ni skyes pa'i rkang stabs so
analyzed: rting pa gnyis kyi bar du sor mo bzhi byas shing rkang pa g-yon pa drang por byas te 'gying ba dang bcas pas g-yas pa mtho gang gi bar du logs su bstan cing yangs pa can gyi sgrol ma'i zhabs ltar byas pa ni skyes pa'i rkang stabs so
translated: The male gait is with four fingers between the heels, the left foot straight, and the right foot turned out to the side a cubit, with a sway, like the foot of the Tara of Vaishali.

original: // de kho na zhin du g-yas pa drang zhing g-yon pa logs su bstan pa ni skyes pa'i rkang stabs kyi zla'o //
analyzed: // de kho na zhin du g-yas pa drang zhing g-yon pa logs su bstan pa ni skyes pa'i rkang stabs kyi zla'o //
translated: The opposite of that is the male step.

original: mnyam pa'i rkang stabs byas te mtho gsum gyi bar du rkang pa g-yas pa g-yon pa'i mdun du bzhag pa ni rnam par gtsigs pa'i @11a * //
analyzed: mnyam pa'i rkang stabs byas te mtho gsum gyi bar du rkang pa g-yas pa g-yon pa'i mdun du bzhag pa ni rnam par gtsigs pa'i @11a * //
translated: The equal step is to place the right foot in front of the left foot, raised three inches.

original: rkang stabs so //
analyzed: rkang stabs so //
translated: This is the angry step.

original: de kho na bzhin du g-yas pa drang por byas te /🔽g-yon pa g-yas pa'i mdun du mtho gsum gyi bar du bzhag pa ni rnam par gtsigs pa'i rkang stabs kyi zla'o //🔽'dug nas kyang rkang ba'i mthil gnyis kha sbyor ba ni kha sbyor gyi rkang stabs so //
analyzed: de kho na bzhin du g-yas pa drang por byas te / g-yon pa g-yas pa'i mdun du mtho gsum gyi bar du bzhag pa ni rnam par gtsigs pa'i rkang stabs kyi zla'o // 'dug nas kyang rkang ba'i mthil gnyis kha sbyor ba ni kha sbyor gyi rkang stabs so //
translated: The opposite of that is the angry step of the female.🔽Sitting, the soles of the feet are joined together. This is the joined step.

original: rkang pa g-yas pas rkang pa g-yon pa mnan pa ni rus sbal gyi rkang stabs so //
analyzed: rkang pa g-yas pas rkang pa g-yon pa mnan pa ni rus sbal gyi rkang stabs so //
translated: The right foot is placed on top of the left foot. This is the tortoise step.

original: rkang pa gcig bteg ste rkang pa gcig bskor ba ni rkang gcig go //
analyzed: rkang pa gcig bteg ste rkang pa gcig bskor ba ni rkang gcig go //
translated: One foot is raised and the other foot is turned. This is the single foot step.

original: rkang stabs bdun po 'di dang bud pa'i dra ba ni gnas nges pa med par bya'o //
analyzed: rkang stabs bdun po 'di dang bud pa'i dra ba ni gnas nges pa med par bya'o //
translated: These seven steps and the spider web should be done without a fixed location.

original: g-yas nga dang g-yon pa dag gis kun nas lus g-yo ba ni bung pa'i dra ba'o//
analyzed: g-yas nga dang g-yon pa dag gis kun nas lus g-yo ba ni bung pa'i dra ba'o//
translated: The shaking of the body with the right and left is the spider web.

original: g-yas brkyang ba la sogs pa bcu gsum po 'di dag byed pa na ji ltar rigs par rgya mtsho'i rlabs dang / ri bo 'degs pa dang / rol ba'i bskyod pa dang / khro bo'i bskyod pa dang / gom pa bgrod pa dang / tshul bzhi dang /
analyzed: g-yas brkyang ba la sogs pa bcu gsum po 'di dag byed pa na ji ltar rigs par rgya mtsho'i rlabs dang / ri bo 'degs pa dang / rol ba'i bskyod pa dang / khro bo'i bskyod pa dang / gom pa bgrod pa dang / tshul bzhi dang /
translated: When doing these thirteen, such as the right leg extended, one should shake the body as appropriate, with the ocean wave, the mountain lifted, the shaking of play, the shaking of wrath, the stride of a step, the four modes,

original: bsnun pa la sogs pa kun nas bskyod pa dgu dang / rdo rje bsgreng ba la sogs pa drug dang / ral gri la sogs pa'i tshul bcu gsum bya'o //
analyzed: bsnun pa la sogs pa kun nas bskyod pa dgu dang / rdo rje bsgreng ba la sogs pa drug dang / ral gri la sogs pa'i tshul bcu gsum bya'o //
translated: the nine shakings, such as the thrust, the six, such as the raised vajra, and the thirteen modes, such as the sword.

original: de nas g-yas brkyang gi gar byas la kha lhor phyogs te /
analyzed: de nas g-yas brkyang gi gar byas la kha lhor phyogs te /
translated: Then, having performed the dance of the right leg extended, face south.

original: snying gar g-yon pa'i sdigs mdzub bsgrengs nas gzhogs g-yon du sa la 'gyel ba ltar byas te /
analyzed: snying gar g-yon pa'i sdigs mdzub bsgrengs nas gzhogs g-yon du sa la 'gyel ba ltar byas te /
translated: Having raised the left threatening gesture to the heart, one should fall to the ground as if fainting to the left.

original: nam mkhar blta zhing rdo rje dang bcas pa'i lag pa g-yas pas bdud thams cad la bsnun no //
analyzed: nam mkhar blta zhing rdo rje dang bcas pa'i lag pa g-yas pas bdud thams cad la bsnun no //
translated: Looking at the sky, one should strike all the māras with the right hand together with the vajra.

original: bsnun pa'i kun du bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: bsnun pa'i kun du bskyod pa'o //
translated: This is the shaking of the striking.

original: pad skor sngon du 'gro bas gar byed la rdo rje blangs te g-yon pa'i sdigs mdzub kyis bsdigs shing /
analyzed: pad skor sngon du 'gro bas gar byed la rdo rje blangs te g-yon pa'i sdigs mdzub kyis bsdigs shing /
translated: Having performed the lotus roll beforehand, one should dance, take up the vajra, threaten with the left threatening gesture,

original: g-yas rdo rje dang bcas pas dbyug pa'i phyag rgya bsgrengs la mnyam pa'i rkang stabs kyis gnas te /
analyzed: g-yas rdo rje dang bcas pas dbyug pa'i phyag rgya bsgrengs la mnyam pa'i rkang stabs kyis gnas te /
translated: and, with the right hand together with the vajra, extend the club mudra, and stand with the feet together.

original: 'gying pa dang bcas pa'i rdo rje rkang stabs kyis rkang ba g-yas pa bskum la /
analyzed: 'gying pa dang bcas pa'i rdo rje rkang stabs kyis rkang ba g-yas pa bskum la /
translated: With a proud vajra step, one should bend the right leg

original: g-yon pa mtho phyed dang gsum du bzhag ste brtan par byas nas rkang pa gnyis gshog par gnas so //
analyzed: g-yon pa mtho phyed dang gsum du bzhag ste brtan par byas nas rkang pa gnyis gshog par gnas so //
translated: and place the left leg at a distance of one and a half cubits, stabilize it, and stand with the two legs like wings.

original: de nas pus mo g-yas pa bskum la dbyug pa'i phyag rgya steng du brkyang ste /
analyzed: de nas pus mo g-yas pa bskum la dbyug pa'i phyag rgya steng du brkyang ste /
translated: Then, bending the right knee, one should extend the club mudra upward,

original: g-yon pa'i sdigs mdzub kyis bsdigs shing /
analyzed: g-yon pa'i sdigs mdzub kyis bsdigs shing /
translated: threatening with the left threatening gesture,🔽and

original: lto ba g-yon pa smad la mig g-yon pa btsums te bskor zhing dkyil 'khor la bltas nas khro gnyer bya'o //
analyzed: lto ba g-yon pa smad la mig g-yon pa btsums te bskor zhing dkyil 'khor la bltas nas khro gnyer bya'o //
translated: With the left eye closed, one should look at the maṇḍala, turning to the left, with a frown.

original: 'di ni 'dar bar byed pa'i kun du bskyod pa ste dku g-yas pa'i char bsdu'o //🔽de bzhin du rdo rje bslangs nas mnyam pa'i rkang stabs kyis gnas te rkang ba mnyam par mtho phyed dang gsum du brkyang nas rkang pa gnyis @11b zur gsum du byas te mdun du lag pa brdabs nas dbyug pa'i phyag rgya 'phyar zhing sdigs mdzub nu ma g-yon
analyzed: 'di ni 'dar bar byed pa'i kun du bskyod pa ste dku g-yas pa'i char bsdu'o // de bzhin du rdo rje bslangs nas mnyam pa'i rkang stabs kyis gnas te rkang ba mnyam par mtho phyed dang gsum du brkyang nas rkang pa gnyis @11b zur gsum du byas te mdun du lag pa brdabs nas dbyug pa'i phyag rgya 'phyar zhing sdigs mdzub nu ma g-yon
translated: This is the shaking that causes trembling, to be gathered into the right side.

original: par bzhag ste blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: par bzhag ste blta bar bya'o //
translated: In the same way, having raised the vajra, one should stand with the feet together, the two feet extended to a height of one and a half cubits, the two feet in a triangular position, and clap the hands in front, holding up the staff mudra, and place the threatening forefinger on the left breast and look.

original: 'di ni skrag par byed pa'i kun du bskyod pa ste dku g-yon pa'i phyogs su bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni skrag par byed pa'i kun du bskyod pa ste dku g-yon pa'i phyogs su bsdu ba'o //
translated: This is the shaking that causes fear, to be gathered into the left side.

original: de bzhin du rdo rje bslang ba'i phyag rgya bcas nas mnyam pa'i rkang stabs kyis gnas te dbyug pa'i phyag rgya phyar la /
analyzed: de bzhin du rdo rje bslang ba'i phyag rgya bcas nas mnyam pa'i rkang stabs kyis gnas te dbyug pa'i phyag rgya phyar la /
translated: In the same way, having made the mudra of raising the vajra, one should stand with the feet together, holding up the staff mudra,

original: mig g-yas pa btsums te mig g-yon pas nu mar sdigs mdzub btsugs la blta'o //
analyzed: mig g-yas pa btsums te mig g-yon pas nu mar sdigs mdzub btsugs la blta'o //
translated: Closing the right eye, one should look with the left eye, pointing at the breast with the index finger.

original: g-yon pa rdo rje'i rkang stabs byas te pus mo g-yas pa bskum la rkang ba bteg ste khro ba dang bcas pas /
analyzed: g-yon pa rdo rje'i rkang stabs byas te pus mo g-yas pa bskum la rkang ba bteg ste khro ba dang bcas pas /
translated: Having made the left leg the vajra leg, one should raise the right knee and the foot, and, with anger,

original: cig car g-yon phyogs su 'khor lo bzhin du bskor ro //
analyzed: cig car g-yon phyogs su 'khor lo bzhin du bskor ro //
translated: turn to the left all at once, like a wheel.

original: yang rkang ba de bskum la g-yon brkyang phyed pa gzhag par bya ste rkang pa gnyis gshog par gnas pa brtan par byas nas gnas so //
analyzed: yang rkang ba de bskum la g-yon brkyang phyed pa gzhag par bya ste rkang pa gnyis gshog par gnas pa brtan par byas nas gnas so //
translated: Again, having bent that foot, one should place the left extended half, and, having made the two feet firm, like wings, one should stand.

original: 'di ni yang dag par dkrugs pa'i kun du bskyod pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni yang dag par dkrugs pa'i kun du bskyod pa ste /
translated: This is the complete shaking of the correct shaking.

original: rdo rje gar gyi sbyor bas dku g-yas pa'i char bsdu'o //
analyzed: rdo rje gar gyi sbyor bas dku g-yas pa'i char bsdu'o //
translated: By the yoga of vajra dance, one should gather at the right side of the hip.

original: de bzhin du rdo rje bslangs nas mnyam pa'i rkang stabs kyis gnas te dbyug pa'i phyag rgya 'phyar la mig g-yon pa nu mar sdigs mdzub la blta'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rdo rje bslangs nas mnyam pa'i rkang stabs kyis gnas te dbyug pa'i phyag rgya 'phyar la mig g-yon pa nu mar sdigs mdzub la blta'o //
translated: Likewise, having raised the vajra, one should stand with the legs together, and, having raised the staff mudra, one should look with the left eye, pointing at the breast with the index finger.

original: bus mo g-yon pa bskum ste g-yas pa rdo rje'i rkang stabs su byas nas g-yon pa bteg pa dang dus gcig tu g-yas phyogs su bskor te de nas gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: bus mo g-yon pa bskum ste g-yas pa rdo rje'i rkang stabs su byas nas g-yon pa bteg pa dang dus gcig tu g-yas phyogs su bskor te de nas gzhag par bya'o //
translated: The left knee is bent and the right foot is in the vajra posture, the left is raised, and at the same time one turns to the right and then places it down.

original: bzhag pa'i rkang ba bskum zhing gru gsum du byas la g-yas pa gshog pa'i rnam par byas te g-yas brkyang du bzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: bzhag pa'i rkang ba bskum zhing gru gsum du byas la g-yas pa gshog pa'i rnam par byas te g-yas brkyang du bzhag par bya'o //
translated: The placed foot is bent and made into a triangle, and the right one is made into a wing and placed in the extended posture.

original: rnam par rmongs byed kyi kun du bskyod pa ste gar byed cing dku g-yon pa'i phyogs su bsdu'o //
analyzed: rnam par rmongs byed kyi kun du bskyod pa ste gar byed cing dku g-yon pa'i phyogs su bsdu'o //
translated: The mudra of the confused movement is dancing and gathering to the left side of the hip.

original: 'di nyid rkang pa g-yon pas bskor bas slar mdun du lag pa sa la brdab ste slar dbyug pa'i phyag rgya bsgreng bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid rkang pa g-yon pas bskor bas slar mdun du lag pa sa la brdab ste slar dbyug pa'i phyag rgya bsgreng bar bya'o //
translated: This itself is turned by the left foot, and again in front the hand is clapped and again the mudra of the stick is extended.

original: 'di ni khyad par du myur ba'i kun du bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni khyad par du myur ba'i kun du bskyod pa'o //
translated: This is the special quick movement.

original: rmongs par byed pa'i lta stangs nyid kha gdangs pa'i kun du bskyod pa ste /
analyzed: rmongs par byed pa'i lta stangs nyid kha gdangs pa'i kun du bskyod pa ste /
translated: The mudra of the confused gaze is the movement of the open mouth.

original: 'on kyang kha gdangs nas lce dril phu dkrol bzhin du byas te 'khor lo bzhin bskor bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang kha gdangs nas lce dril phu dkrol bzhin du byas te 'khor lo bzhin bskor bar bya'o //
translated: However, one should do it with the mouth open, the tongue extended, and the lips vibrating, and one should do it while turning like a wheel.🔽Similarly, having raised the vajra, one should make a triangle with the two feet about a cubit apart, and one should blow.

original: de bzhin du rdo rje bslangs nas rkang pa gnyis mtho gad tsam gyi bar du byas te gru gsum bya zhing bus mo g-yas bcud zad bskum la bus mo g-yon pa dang gsus pa dang / nu ma g-yon pa'i cha smad de /
analyzed: de bzhin du rdo rje bslangs nas rkang pa gnyis mtho gad tsam gyi bar du byas te gru gsum bya zhing bus mo g-yas bcud zad bskum la bus mo g-yon pa dang gsus pa dang / nu ma g-yon pa'i cha smad de /
translated: Having bent the right knee, one should point the left knee, the belly, and the left breast,

original: nu mar sdigs mdzub bya zhing dbyug ba lan gnyis bsgreng la de ma @12a * //
analyzed: nu mar sdigs mdzub bya zhing dbyug ba lan gnyis bsgreng la de ma @12a * //
translated: and one should point to the breast with the index finger, and one should raise the stick twice.🔽Immediately after that, one should look at the stick and turn the face.

original: thag tu dbyug pa la blta zhing gdong bskor ba ni k'a li k'i la zhes pa'i kun du bskyod pa ste dku g-yas pa'i char ba sdu'o //
analyzed: thag tu dbyug pa la blta zhing gdong bskor ba ni k'a li k'i la zhes pa'i kun du bskyod pa ste dku g-yas pa'i char ba sdu'o //
translated: This is called the “Kālikā dance.”

original: de nyid ni k'i li k'i li chen po yin te gang gi tshe dbyug pa la blta bar gnas pa g-yas pa'i dpung ba'i phyogs nas rang gi rgyab tu khyer zhing mig g-yon pa btsums te khros shing rkang pa rnam par rkyong bar byed pa'i tshe'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni k'i li k'i li chen po yin te gang gi tshe dbyug pa la blta bar gnas pa g-yas pa'i dpung ba'i phyogs nas rang gi rgyab tu khyer zhing mig g-yon pa btsums te khros shing rkang pa rnam par rkyong bar byed pa'i tshe'o //
translated: That itself is the great Kali Kali, when, standing looking at the stick, one carries it from the side of the right arm to one's back, closing the left eye, angry, and stretching out the leg.

original: bsdu ba ni snga ma bzhin no //🔽g-yon pa dkur byas te g-yas pa rdo rje snying gar bsgreng pa ni rdo rje bsgreng pa'o //🔽g-yon pa'i rdo rje khu tshur gyi mdzub mo bsgrengs pas snying gar sdigs mdzub byed cing /
analyzed: bsdu ba ni snga ma bzhin no // g-yon pa dkur byas te g-yas pa rdo rje snying gar bsgreng pa ni rdo rje bsgreng pa'o // g-yon pa'i rdo rje khu tshur gyi mdzub mo bsgrengs pas snying gar sdigs mdzub byed cing /
translated: The gathering is as before.🔽Placing the left [hand] on the hip, raising the right vajra to the heart is the raised vajra.🔽With the left vajra fist, the index finger extended, one makes a threatening gesture at the heart.

original: g-yas pa'i rdo rje khu tshur gyis bzung ba'i rdo rje brdeg pa'i tshul du byas pa ni rdo rje 'phen pa'o //
analyzed: g-yas pa'i rdo rje khu tshur gyis bzung ba'i rdo rje brdeg pa'i tshul du byas pa ni rdo rje 'phen pa'o //
translated: With the right vajra fist, holding the vajra, one makes a gesture of striking with it.

original: sor mo bzhi rtse mo bskum pas mthe bod mnan pa ni rdo rje'i khu tshur ro //
analyzed: sor mo bzhi rtse mo bskum pas mthe bod mnan pa ni rdo rje'i khu tshur ro //
translated: With the four fingers [of the right hand] bent at the tips, pressing on the palm is the vajra fist.

original: rdo rje khu tshur las steng dang 'og tu lag pa brkyang pas kha gdangs pa dang sna bug dang 'gram ba dang mig rnams la bsdigs pa'i tshul du byas pa ni rdo rje 'jigs byed do //
analyzed: rdo rje khu tshur las steng dang 'og tu lag pa brkyang pas kha gdangs pa dang sna bug dang 'gram ba dang mig rnams la bsdigs pa'i tshul du byas pa ni rdo rje 'jigs byed do //
translated: The Vajra-fierce one: with the vajra fist, extend the hands above and below, and open the mouth, and touch the nostrils, the cheeks, and the eyes, as if threatening.

original: lag pa g-yas pa'i rdo rje g-yas skor du bskor nas rim gyis sa la rkang ba gnyis 'jog pa ni rdo rje 'khyil ba'i //
analyzed: lag pa g-yas pa'i rdo rje g-yas skor du bskor nas rim gyis sa la rkang ba gnyis 'jog pa ni rdo rje 'khyil ba'i //
translated: The Vajra-coiled: with the right hand, circle the vajra to the right, and gradually place the two feet on the ground.

original: lag pa g-yon pa brkyang la de'i mkhrig mar rdo rje dang bcas pa'i lag pa g-yas pa'i mkhrig mar sbyar bas gar byed pa ni rdo rje'i gar ro //
analyzed: lag pa g-yon pa brkyang la de'i mkhrig mar rdo rje dang bcas pa'i lag pa g-yas pa'i mkhrig mar sbyar bas gar byed pa ni rdo rje'i gar ro //
translated: The Vajra-dance: extend the left hand, and with the right hand holding a vajra at the wrist, touch the wrist of the left hand, and dance.

original: rdo rje'i gar sngon du 'gro bas dku gnyis su btsugs te mgo g-yon par smad pa ni bud byed sgyu ma byed pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje'i gar sngon du 'gro bas dku gnyis su btsugs te mgo g-yon par smad pa ni bud byed sgyu ma byed pa'o //
translated: The Vajra-maker of illusions: with the vajra dance as a preliminary, place the two elbows on the hips, and lower the head to the left.

original: dku gnyis su btsugs pa ni rdo rje sgeg mo'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: dku gnyis su btsugs pa ni rdo rje sgeg mo'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: Placing the two elbows on the hips is the mudra of the Vajra-graceful one.

original: rdo rje khu tshur g-yon pa'i sbubs las rdo rje khu tshur g-yas pa phyung nas ral gri'i tshul du bzung ba ni ral gri'i tshul lo //
analyzed: rdo rje khu tshur g-yon pa'i sbubs las rdo rje khu tshur g-yas pa phyung nas ral gri'i tshul du bzung ba ni ral gri'i tshul lo //
translated: The sword gesture is made by drawing out the right vajra fist from the hollow of the left vajra fist and holding it in the manner of a sword.

original: snying gar sdigs mdzub byed cing g-yas pa rdo rje rtse gsum pa kun du brkyang ba ni rdo rje'i tshul lo /🔽rdo rje bsdams pas bzung ba'i gtun shing gis bgegs brdung ba ni gtun shing gi tshul lo //
analyzed: snying gar sdigs mdzub byed cing g-yas pa rdo rje rtse gsum pa kun du brkyang ba ni rdo rje'i tshul lo / rdo rje bsdams pas bzung ba'i gtun shing gis bgegs brdung ba ni gtun shing gi tshul lo //
translated: The vajra gesture is made by pointing the right hand with the three-pronged vajra gesture at the heart.🔽The pestle gesture is made by striking the obstructors with a pestle held by a vajra-binding.

original: thal mo sbyar nas sor mo'i rtse mo phan tshun bsnol ba ni rdo rje thal mo'o //
analyzed: thal mo sbyar nas sor mo'i rtse mo phan tshun bsnol ba ni rdo rje thal mo'o //
translated: The vajra palms are made by joining the palms and crossing the tips of the fingers.

original: de ltar rtsa ba yang dag par bsdams pa rdo rje bsdams pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar rtsa ba yang dag par bsdams pa rdo rje bsdams pa'o //
translated: Thus, the root is the vajra-binding.

original: snying gar rdo rje khu tshur gnyis kyi mthe chung gnyis dang mdzub mo dag rdo rje bsdams pa byas nas 'khor lo bzhin phye ba ni 'khor lo'i tshul lo //
analyzed: snying gar rdo rje khu tshur gnyis kyi mthe chung gnyis dang mdzub mo dag rdo rje bsdams pa byas nas 'khor lo bzhin phye ba ni 'khor lo'i tshul lo //
translated: The wheel gesture is made by forming the vajra-binding with the two little fingers and index fingers of the two vajra fists at the heart and opening them like a wheel.

original: g-yas pa'i rdo rje khu tshur gyi mdzub mo gnyis gung mo dag 'gying ba dang bcas pas brkyang nas steng du bzhag pa ni ba dan gyi tshul lo //
analyzed: g-yas pa'i rdo rje khu tshur gyi mdzub mo gnyis gung mo dag 'gying ba dang bcas pas brkyang nas steng du bzhag pa ni ba dan gyi tshul lo //
translated: The right hand is in a vajra fist, with the two index fingers extended and raised upward with pride, like a banner.

original: thal mo snyim pa kha sbyar te padma bzhin kha phye ba ni padma'i tshul lo //
analyzed: thal mo snyim pa kha sbyar te padma bzhin kha phye ba ni padma'i tshul lo //
translated: The palms are joined together like a lotus, and then opened like a lotus.

original: khu tshur g-yas pa'i nang du @12b mthe bong bcug ste mdzub mo brkyang la lag pa steng du bsgreng pa ni dbyug pa'i tshul lo //
analyzed: khu tshur g-yas pa'i nang du @12b mthe bong bcug ste mdzub mo brkyang la lag pa steng du bsgreng pa ni dbyug pa'i tshul lo //
translated: The right hand is in a fist, with the thumb inserted and the index finger extended, and the hand is raised upward, like a club.

original: g-yas pa'i mdzub mo lcags kyu'i tshul du bzung ba ni lcags kyu'i tshul lo //
analyzed: g-yas pa'i mdzub mo lcags kyu'i tshul du bzung ba ni lcags kyu'i tshul lo //
translated: The right index finger is held like a hook, like a hook.

original: lag pa g-yas pa'i sor mo rnams brkyang la bkug pa ni gdengs ka'i tshul lo //
analyzed: lag pa g-yas pa'i sor mo rnams brkyang la bkug pa ni gdengs ka'i tshul lo //
translated: The fingers of the right hand are extended and bent, like a tongue.

original: lag pa g-yon par gzhu blangs te g-yas bas rgyur rna ba'i bar du drang zhing rlung gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: lag pa g-yon par gzhu blangs te g-yas bas rgyur rna ba'i bar du drang zhing rlung gzung bar bya'o //
translated: The left hand holds a bow, and the right hand draws the arrow up to the ear, holding the wind.

original: 'di ni gzhu'i tshul lo //
analyzed: 'di ni gzhu'i tshul lo //
translated: This is the bow gesture.

original: g-yas pa'i mdzub mo dang gung mo dag gis g-yas phyogs nas mda' drang bar bya ba ni mda' drang ba'i tshul lo //
analyzed: g-yas pa'i mdzub mo dang gung mo dag gis g-yas phyogs nas mda' drang bar bya ba ni mda' drang ba'i tshul lo //
translated: The gesture of straightening the arrow is made with the right index and middle fingers straightening the arrow from the right side.

original: de dag nyid kyis mda' 'phen pa'i tshul du byas pa ni mda' 'phen pa'i tshul lo //
analyzed: de dag nyid kyis mda' 'phen pa'i tshul du byas pa ni mda' 'phen pa'i tshul lo //
translated: The gesture of shooting the arrow is made with those two fingers in the manner of shooting an arrow.

original: bstod pa byed pa'i tshul du snying gar thal mo sbyar ba gzung ba ni phyag 'tshal ba'i tshul lo //
analyzed: bstod pa byed pa'i tshul du snying gar thal mo sbyar ba gzung ba ni phyag 'tshal ba'i tshul lo //
translated: The gesture of homage is made by holding the palms together at the heart in the manner of offering praise.

original: de nas phyag 'tshal ba'i tshul dang pad skor byas nas rdo rje gsor zhing dril bu dkrol la rdo rje'i rkang stabs kyis gar byas nas /
analyzed: de nas phyag 'tshal ba'i tshul dang pad skor byas nas rdo rje gsor zhing dril bu dkrol la rdo rje'i rkang stabs kyis gar byas nas /
translated: Then, having made the gesture of homage and circumambulated the maṇḍala once, one should dance with the vajra steps, shaking the vajra and ringing the bell.

original: dkyil 'khor gyis gzhi'i dbus su zhugs te 'dug la gdan bcu'i tshul byed cing h'um brjod pa sngon du 'gro bas khro bo dpag tu med pa spros pas bgegs rnams bsal zhing dbang chen gyi bar du dkyil 'khor gyis rdo rje'i rang bzhin du bsgom mo //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyis gzhi'i dbus su zhugs te 'dug la gdan bcu'i tshul byed cing h'um brjod pa sngon du 'gro bas khro bo dpag tu med pa spros pas bgegs rnams bsal zhing dbang chen gyi bar du dkyil 'khor gyis rdo rje'i rang bzhin du bsgom mo //
translated: Having entered into the center of the maṇḍala base and sat down, one should make the gesture of the ten seats, and having uttered hūṃ, emanate immeasurable wrathful ones, clear away the obstructors, and meditate on the maṇḍala as the nature of vajras up to the great maṇḍala.

original: de la rdo rje'i skyil krung gis sa gnon gyi phyag rgya bcing ba ni rdo rje'i gdan gyi tshul lo //
analyzed: de la rdo rje'i skyil krung gis sa gnon gyi phyag rgya bcing ba ni rdo rje'i gdan gyi tshul lo //
translated: The vajra posture is to sit cross-legged with the earth-touching mudra.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi phyag rgya bcing ba ni bsam gtan gyi tshul lo //🔽brla g-yas pa dang byin pa'i dbus su rkang pa g-yon pa bzhag nas de'i steng du brla g-yon pa dang byin pa'i dbus su g-yas pa bzhag pa ni rdo rje skyil krung ngo //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi phyag rgya bcing ba ni bsam gtan gyi tshul lo // brla g-yas pa dang byin pa'i dbus su rkang pa g-yon pa bzhag nas de'i steng du brla g-yon pa dang byin pa'i dbus su g-yas pa bzhag pa ni rdo rje skyil krung ngo //
translated: The meditative posture is to sit cross-legged with the meditative mudra.🔽The vajra posture is to place the left foot on the right thigh and the right foot on the left thigh.

original: byin pa g-yas pa byin pa g-yon par bzhag ste bus mo gnyis smad pa ni padma'i gdan no //
analyzed: byin pa g-yas pa byin pa g-yon par bzhag ste bus mo gnyis smad pa ni padma'i gdan no //
translated: The lotus posture is to place the right foot on the left thigh and the left foot on the right thigh.

original: brla g-yon pa'i steng du rkang ba g-yas pa gzhag la g-yon pa brla g-yas pa'i 'og tu gzhag pa ni sems dpa'i skyil krung ngo //
analyzed: brla g-yon pa'i steng du rkang ba g-yas pa gzhag la g-yon pa brla g-yas pa'i 'og tu gzhag pa ni sems dpa'i skyil krung ngo //
translated: The bodhisattva posture is to place the right foot on the left thigh and the left foot on the right thigh.

original: rkang pa g-yon pas skyil krung phyed pa byas te de dang nye bar bus mo g-yas ba steng du drang bar bya ba ni dpa' bo'i 'dug stangs so //
analyzed: rkang pa g-yon pas skyil krung phyed pa byas te de dang nye bar bus mo g-yas ba steng du drang bar bya ba ni dpa' bo'i 'dug stangs so //
translated: The hero's posture is to sit in half-lotus posture with the right foot drawn up and the left foot extended.

original: g-yon pa skyil krung phyed pa byas te de'i steng du pus mo g-yas pa bsnyal la /
analyzed: g-yon pa skyil krung phyed pa byas te de'i steng du pus mo g-yas pa bsnyal la /
translated: The left leg is in half lotus posture, and the right knee is placed on top of it.

original: rkang pa g-yas pa brla g-yon pa'i rtsar gan rkyal du bzhag pa ni dpa' bo'i 'dug stangs so zhes kha cig go //
analyzed: rkang pa g-yas pa brla g-yon pa'i rtsar gan rkyal du bzhag pa ni dpa' bo'i 'dug stangs so zhes kha cig go //
translated: The right foot is placed on the ground next to the left thigh, lying face up. This is the hero posture.

original: stan mthon po la gnas te rkang pa gnyis drang por bzung ba ni bzang po'i 'dug stangs so //
analyzed: stan mthon po la gnas te rkang pa gnyis drang por bzung ba ni bzang po'i 'dug stangs so //
translated: Sitting on a high seat with the two legs straight is the good posture.

original: rkang pa gnyis mtho gang gi bar du stan la bkod la tsog pur gnas @13a * //
analyzed: rkang pa gnyis mtho gang gi bar du stan la bkod la tsog pur gnas @13a * //
translated: The two legs are placed on the seat at a distance of a cubit, and one sits in a squatting position.

original: pa ni tsog bu'i dug stangs so //
analyzed: pa ni tsog bu'i dug stangs so //
translated: This is the squatting posture.

original: rkang pa g-yas pa sems dpa'i skyil krung bcas la 'gying ba dang bcas pas g-yon pa brkyang ba ni rol ba'i 'dug stangs so //
analyzed: rkang pa g-yas pa sems dpa'i skyil krung bcas la 'gying ba dang bcas pas g-yon pa brkyang ba ni rol ba'i 'dug stangs so //
translated: The right leg is in bodhisattva posture, and the left leg is extended with a sense of grace. This is the dancing posture.

original: rkang pa gnyis kha sbyar la 'dug pa ni bkra shis can no //
analyzed: rkang pa gnyis kha sbyar la 'dug pa ni bkra shis can no //
translated: The two legs are placed together. This is the auspicious posture.

original: rdo rje'i rkang stabs la sogs pa 'di rnams ji ltar rigs par rdo rje'i lta stangs gnyis las mdun du blta ba ni mdun du phyogs pa dang / rgyab tu phyir phyogs pa ste lta ba rnam pa gnyis dang / sgeg pa dang / dpa' ba dang /
analyzed: rdo rje'i rkang stabs la sogs pa 'di rnams ji ltar rigs par rdo rje'i lta stangs gnyis las mdun du blta ba ni mdun du phyogs pa dang / rgyab tu phyir phyogs pa ste lta ba rnam pa gnyis dang / sgeg pa dang / dpa' ba dang /
translated: These vajra steps and so on are to be accomplished by means of the two vajra gazes, which are the two gazes, the forward gaze and the backward gaze, as appropriate.🔽And one should accomplish the moods of coquetry, heroism,

original: mi sdug pa dang / drag po dang / bzhad pa dang / 'jigs su rung ba dang / snying rje ba dang / rmad du byung ba dang / zhi ba'i nyams man ngag gi snye mar rnam par phye bar rnams bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: mi sdug pa dang / drag po dang / bzhad pa dang / 'jigs su rung ba dang / snying rje ba dang / rmad du byung ba dang / zhi ba'i nyams man ngag gi snye mar rnam par phye bar rnams bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: ugliness, fierceness, laughter, fearfulness, compassion, wonder, and peace, as distinguished in the Garland of Pith Instructions.

original: rdo rje'i rkang stabs la sogs pa nas rdo rje'i lta ba'i bar gyi stang stabs rnams ni sgyu 'phrul dra ba dang / dpal mchog dang po dang / khro bo rnam par rgyal ba la sogs pa'i rgyud du gsungs pa 'dir che ba rnams bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje'i rkang stabs la sogs pa nas rdo rje'i lta ba'i bar gyi stang stabs rnams ni sgyu 'phrul dra ba dang / dpal mchog dang po dang / khro bo rnam par rgyal ba la sogs pa'i rgyud du gsungs pa 'dir che ba rnams bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: The dance movements from the vajra steps up to the vajra gazes are taught in the Magical Net, the Supreme Original Tantra, the Wrathful Manjushri Tantra, and so on. Here, one should accomplish the great ones among them.

original: yongs su mi shes pas sam mi nus pas sam bya ba bsdus pa la dga' bas sam mi 'dod pas kyang rung ste /
analyzed: yongs su mi shes pas sam mi nus pas sam bya ba bsdus pa la dga' bas sam mi 'dod pas kyang rung ste /
translated: Whether it is due to complete ignorance, or inability, or delight in the collection of activities, or lack of desire,

original: rdo rje'i rkang stabs la sogs pa thams cad dam nyung zad ma bsgrubs na yang skabs su bab pa nyams par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: rdo rje'i rkang stabs la sogs pa thams cad dam nyung zad ma bsgrubs na yang skabs su bab pa nyams par mi 'gyur te /
translated: if one does not accomplish all or some of the vajra postures and so forth, there is no fault in the rite,

original: bgegs bsal ba ni bskor ba la sogs pas kyang 'grub pa'i phyir ro zhes man ngag rig pa rnams gsung ngo //
analyzed: bgegs bsal ba ni bskor ba la sogs pas kyang 'grub pa'i phyir ro zhes man ngag rig pa rnams gsung ngo //
translated: because the removal of obstacles is accomplished by circumambulation and so forth.

original: de nas dkyil 'khor gyis gzhi dris byugs la me tog dang sbos la sogs pa dang zur bzhi dang sgo bzhir spos phor la sogs pa dang / gar dang glu la sogs pas yang dag par mchod nas lag pas reg cing dkyil 'khor gyi bdag po'i sngags brgya rtsa brgyad dang /
analyzed: de nas dkyil 'khor gyis gzhi dris byugs la me tog dang sbos la sogs pa dang zur bzhi dang sgo bzhir spos phor la sogs pa dang / gar dang glu la sogs pas yang dag par mchod nas lag pas reg cing dkyil 'khor gyi bdag po'i sngags brgya rtsa brgyad dang /
translated: Then, having anointed the ground of the maṇḍala with cow dung, having scattered flowers, incense and so forth, and having made offerings with incense burners and so forth in the four corners and four gates, and having made offerings with dance, song and so forth, having touched it with one's hand, and having recited the mantra of the lord of the maṇḍala one hundred and eight times,

original: yi ge brgya pa lan bdun bzlas la de nyid du lha'i 'khor lo spro zhing bsdu bas nyal bar bya'o //
analyzed: yi ge brgya pa lan bdun bzlas la de nyid du lha'i 'khor lo spro zhing bsdu bas nyal bar bya'o //
translated: and having recited the one hundred syllable mantra seven times, one should sleep there, emanating and gathering the wheel of deities.

original: sa yongs su bzung ba'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: sa yongs su bzung ba'i cho ga'o //
translated: This is the rite of taking possession of the ground.

original: de nas snga bar langs nas 'gro ba rdo rje 'chang gi go 'phang la dgod par bya ba'i ched du bgegs med par bya'o zhes bsams nas /🔽skad cig gis stong nyid kyi rjes la ram las byung ba'i nyi ma la gnas pa'i h'um las skyes pa'i sna tshogs rdo rje la gnas pa'i h'um gi 'od las byung ba'i rdo rje 'bar ba 'phros pas mtshams med cing dum bu gcig tu gyur pa'i rdo rje'i
analyzed: de nas snga bar langs nas 'gro ba rdo rje 'chang gi go 'phang la dgod par bya ba'i ched du bgegs med par bya'o zhes bsams nas / skad cig gis stong nyid kyi rjes la ram las byung ba'i nyi ma la gnas pa'i h'um las skyes pa'i sna tshogs rdo rje la gnas pa'i h'um gi 'od las byung ba'i rdo rje 'bar ba 'phros pas mtshams med cing dum bu gcig tu gyur pa'i rdo rje'i
translated: Then, having risen early, one should think, “In order to establish all beings in the state of Vajradhara, I will perform the rite of protection.”

original: rab dang / gur dang mda'i dra ba dang bla re dang / 'og tu sa gzhi 'bar zhing 'od zer bzod par dka' ba'i sna tshogs rdo rje'i rang @13b bzhin du bsgom mo //
analyzed: rab dang / gur dang mda'i dra ba dang bla re dang / 'og tu sa gzhi 'bar zhing 'od zer bzod par dka' ba'i sna tshogs rdo rje'i rang @13b bzhin du bsgom mo //
translated: After emptiness, in an instant, from raṃ appears a sun, upon which is hūṃ, from which arises a multicolored vajra cross, upon which is hūṃ. From the light rays that shine from the hūṃ, blazing vajras radiate and become an indestructible vajra ground, enclosure, lattice of vajras, tent, canopy, and below, a blazing ground that is difficult to bear, all of which are the nature of a multicolored vajra cross.

original: de'i dbus su skad cig gis bdag nyid rdo rje sems dpa'i ngo bo yongs su gyur nas /
analyzed: de'i dbus su skad cig gis bdag nyid rdo rje sems dpa'i ngo bo yongs su gyur nas /
translated: In the center of that, in an instant, one transforms into the essence of Vajrasattva,

original: khro bo 'jig rten gsum las rnam par rgyal ba /
analyzed: khro bo 'jig rten gsum las rnam par rgyal ba /
translated: who becomes the wrathful Trailokyavijaya.

original: ming gzhan ni rdo rje h'um mdzad ces pa g-yas brkyang ba'i zhabs kyis sna tshogs padma dang nyi ma la gnas pa'i 'jigs byed dang dus mtshan mnan pa ;
analyzed: ming gzhan ni rdo rje h'um mdzad ces pa g-yas brkyang ba'i zhabs kyis sna tshogs padma dang nyi ma la gnas pa'i 'jigs byed dang dus mtshan mnan pa ;
translated: Another name is Vajra Humkara. He stands with his right leg extended on Bhairava and Kalarati who are on a multicolored lotus and sun,

original: rab tu khros pa bskal ba'i mtha'i me ltar 'od zer gyi phung po 'bar ba /
analyzed: rab tu khros pa bskal ba'i mtha'i me ltar 'od zer gyi phung po 'bar ba /
translated: and he is very wrathful, blazing with a mass of light rays like the fire at the end of the eon.

original: 'gro ba ma lus pa'i bgegs kyi tshogs zab lta bu /
analyzed: 'gro ba ma lus pa'i bgegs kyi tshogs zab lta bu /
translated: He is the destroyer of the entire host of obstacles of all migrating beings.🔽He has three faces—blue, yellow, and red—and three eyes.

original: sdo ba dang ser ba dang / ljang gu'i mdog can gyi rtsa ba dang / g-yas pa dang / cig shos kyi zhal gsum gdangs pa /
analyzed: sdo ba dang ser ba dang / ljang gu'i mdog can gyi rtsa ba dang / g-yas pa dang / cig shos kyi zhal gsum gdangs pa /
translated: He has bared fangs.

original: mche ba gtsigs pa /🔽ljags 'dril ba ;
analyzed: mche ba gtsigs pa / ljags 'dril ba ;
translated: He has a curled tongue.

original: zhal re re zhing smin ma 'khyug pa khro gnyer dang bcas pa /
analyzed: zhal re re zhing smin ma 'khyug pa khro gnyer dang bcas pa /
translated: Each face has eyebrows that are furrowed with wrath.

original: spyan gsum dmar zhing zlum pa /
analyzed: spyan gsum dmar zhing zlum pa /
translated: His three eyes are red and round.

original: phyag rgya drug dang ldan pa /
analyzed: phyag rgya drug dang ldan pa /
translated: He has six symbolic ornaments.

original: dpral bar thod pa lngas brgyan pa /🔽khrag 'dzag pa'i mgo bo'i phreng ba mgul la 'phyang ba /
analyzed: dpral bar thod pa lngas brgyan pa / khrag 'dzag pa'i mgo bo'i phreng ba mgul la 'phyang ba /
translated: He is adorned with five skulls on his forehead.🔽A garland of heads dripping with blood hangs around his neck.

original: mgo bo dang bcas pa'i ske rags can /
analyzed: mgo bo dang bcas pa'i ske rags can /
translated: He has a belt of heads.

original: stag gi bags pa'i na bza' 'byang ba ;
analyzed: stag gi bags pa'i na bza' 'byang ba ;
translated: His upper garment is a tiger skin.

original: mtha' yas nag pos bcings pa'i dbu skra kham pa gyen du 'bar ba /
analyzed: mtha' yas nag pos bcings pa'i dbu skra kham pa gyen du 'bar ba /
translated: His black hair, bound up with an endless knot, blazes upward.

original: 'jog po la sogs pa'i klu'i rgyal po brgyad kyis brgyan pa /
analyzed: 'jog po la sogs pa'i klu'i rgyal po brgyad kyis brgyan pa /
translated: He is adorned with the eight nāga kings, Ananta and so forth.

original: rdo rje dang dril bu dang ldan pa'i phyag rgya gnyis kyi rdo rje khu tshur gnyis rgyab sbyar te /
analyzed: rdo rje dang dril bu dang ldan pa'i phyag rgya gnyis kyi rdo rje khu tshur gnyis rgyab sbyar te /
translated: He has the mudra of vajra and bell, with the two vajra fists pressed together back to back,🔽with the two little fingers joined and the two index fingers extended, the mudra of total victory over the three worlds.

original: mthe'u chung gnyis sprel zhing mdzub mo gnyis brkyang bar byas pa'i 'jig rten gsum las rnam par rgyal ba'i phyag rgyas rang 'od kyi shes rab dang snyoms par 'jug pa phyag g-yas pa dag gis lcags kyu dang zhags pa dang / g-yon pa dag gis thod pa dang kha tv'am ga 'dzin pa /
analyzed: mthe'u chung gnyis sprel zhing mdzub mo gnyis brkyang bar byas pa'i 'jig rten gsum las rnam par rgyal ba'i phyag rgyas rang 'od kyi shes rab dang snyoms par 'jug pa phyag g-yas pa dag gis lcags kyu dang zhags pa dang / g-yon pa dag gis thod pa dang kha tv'am ga 'dzin pa /
translated: He is in union with his natural-light consort with his right hands holding a hook and lasso and his left hands holding a skull cup and khaṭvāṅga.

original: yi ge h'um drag po sgrogs shing phyogs su lta bas rang gi snying gar h'um las spros pa'i 'od zer gyis phyogs bcu'i bgegs rnams bkug ste /
analyzed: yi ge h'um drag po sgrogs shing phyogs su lta bas rang gi snying gar h'um las spros pa'i 'od zer gyis phyogs bcu'i bgegs rnams bkug ste /
translated: He is shouting the fierce syllable hūṃ and looking in the directions.

original: h'um las spros pa'i khro bo bcu la gtad par bya'o //
analyzed: h'um las spros pa'i khro bo bcu la gtad par bya'o //
translated: The ten wrathful ones emanated from hūṃ should be aimed at them.

original: khro bo de rnams kyis kyang srid du sor bco brgyad pa'am /
analyzed: khro bo de rnams kyis kyang srid du sor bco brgyad pa'am /
translated: Those wrathful ones should be eighteen fingerbreadths long,

original: bcu gnyis pa'am /
analyzed: bcu gnyis pa'am /
translated: twelve fingerbreadths,

original: brgyad pa sbom du rim pa bzhin du sor drug pa dang bzhi pa dang / drug cha dang bcas pa'i phyed dang gsum pa seng ldeng las byas pa'am /
analyzed: brgyad pa sbom du rim pa bzhin du sor drug pa dang bzhi pa dang / drug cha dang bcas pa'i phyed dang gsum pa seng ldeng las byas pa'am /
translated: or eight fingerbreadths, and six, four, and three and a half fingerbreadths in width, respectively. They should be made of khadira wood,🔽bone,

original: rus pa las byas pa'am /
analyzed: rus pa las byas pa'am /
translated: or iron.

original: lcags las byas pa'i phur pa bcu snod gsar bar bzhag la yungs kar dang / tsandan dmar pos byugs nas tshon skud lngas dkris la mchod de /
analyzed: lcags las byas pa'i phur pa bcu snod gsar bar bzhag la yungs kar dang / tsandan dmar pos byugs nas tshon skud lngas dkris la mchod de /
translated: Place the ten daggers in a new vessel, anoint them with white mustard seed and red sandalwood, wrap them with five-colored yarn, and make offerings.

original: de re re la me tog gi phreng ba dmar pos bcings te /
analyzed: de re re la me tog gi phreng ba dmar pos bcings te /
translated: Tie each with a red flower garland.

original: lte ba nas 'og tu rtse gcig pa'i rnam pa @14a * //
analyzed: lte ba nas 'og tu rtse gcig pa'i rnam pa @14a * //
translated: The lower end is single-pointed,🔽and the upper end has the form of oneself blazing like the fire at the end of the eon.

original: steng du bdag nyid kyi gzugs can bskal pa'i mtha'i me ltar 'bar bar bsgoms nas g-yon pa'i rdo rje khu tshur gyis bzung ste /
analyzed: steng du bdag nyid kyi gzugs can bskal pa'i mtha'i me ltar 'bar bar bsgoms nas g-yon pa'i rdo rje khu tshur gyis bzung ste /
translated: Grasp it with the left vajra fist.

original: phyag g-yas pas mtshan pa'i gtso bo yongs su gyur pa'i tho ba me tog dmar po'i phreng ba bcings pa bzung nas /
analyzed: phyag g-yas pas mtshan pa'i gtso bo yongs su gyur pa'i tho ba me tog dmar po'i phreng ba bcings pa bzung nas /
translated: The principal one, marked with the right hand, transforms into a hammer bound with a garland of red flowers.

original: sgra ring por brjod pa'i h'um las byung ba'i khron pa bcur bgegs de rnams bcug la /🔽aom badzra k'i li k'i la ya sarba bi ghn'a na bighn'a na h'um zhes pa'am /
analyzed: sgra ring por brjod pa'i h'um las byung ba'i khron pa bcur bgegs de rnams bcug la / aom badzra k'i li k'i la ya sarba bi ghn'a na bighn'a na h'um zhes pa'am /
translated: Having uttered the long sound of hūṃ, the obstructors are placed in the ten pits that arise from ten hūṃs.🔽Recite oṃ vajra kaila ya sarva vighanān bighanān hūṃ.

original: aom gha gha gh'a ta ya gh'a ta ya sarba du sht'am phat phat k'i la ya sarba p'a pam phat phat h'um h'um badzra k'i la badzra dh'a ra a'a dzny'a pa ya ti sarba bi ghn'a na k'a ya w'a ktsi ttam k'i la ya h'um h'um phat phat
analyzed: aom gha gha gh'a ta ya gh'a ta ya sarba du sht'am phat phat k'i la ya sarba p'a pam phat phat h'um h'um badzra k'i la badzra dh'a ra a'a dzny'a pa ya ti sarba bi ghn'a na k'a ya w'a ktsi ttam k'i la ya h'um h'um phat phat
translated: Or recite oṃ gha gha ghatāya ghatāya sarva duṣṭān phaṭ phaṭ kila ya sarva pāpān phaṭ phaṭ hūṃ hūṃ vajra kila vajra dhara ā jñāpaya ti sarva vighanān kāya vāka citta kila ya hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ phaṭ.

original: ces brjod pa sngon du 'gro bas mgo bor phur bus btab nas /
analyzed: ces brjod pa sngon du 'gro bas mgo bor phur bus btab nas /
translated: Having recited that mantra beforehand, imagine that the head is struck with the kīla.

original: aom badzra mungga ra a'a ko ta ya h'um zhes brjod cing brdung bar bsams la /
analyzed: aom badzra mungga ra a'a ko ta ya h'um zhes brjod cing brdung bar bsams la /
translated: Recite oṃ vajra muṃgāra ākotaya hūṃ and imagine that it is struck.

original: dbang ldan nas bzung nas g-yas skor du dkyil 'khor gyi phyi'i rdo rje phreng ba'i phyi rol gyi 'od zer gyi phreng ba'i phyogs brgyad du dang por slob dpon gyis gdab pa dang brdung bar bya'o //
analyzed: dbang ldan nas bzung nas g-yas skor du dkyil 'khor gyi phyi'i rdo rje phreng ba'i phyi rol gyi 'od zer gyi phreng ba'i phyogs brgyad du dang por slob dpon gyis gdab pa dang brdung bar bya'o //
translated: Beginning from the northeast, the master should first throw and drive in the stakes outside the vajra fence and outside the ring of light rays of the outer mandala, in the eight directions.

original: mi nus na de'i rjes la sgo'i slob dpon rnams kyis so //🔽gtsug tor gyi phur ba ni shar gyi phur pa las shar du'o //
analyzed: mi nus na de'i rjes la sgo'i slob dpon rnams kyis so // gtsug tor gyi phur ba ni shar gyi phur pa las shar du'o //
translated: If he is unable to do so, then the door masters should do it after him.🔽The uṣṇīṣa stake is driven in the east from the eastern stake.

original: gnod mdzes kyi ni nub kyi phur pa las nub tu gdab par bya'o //
analyzed: gnod mdzes kyi ni nub kyi phur pa las nub tu gdab par bya'o //
translated: Sumbha is driven in the west from the western stake.

original: gal te yang de nyid bsdus pa la sogs par phyi'i 'od zer gyi phreng ba la gdab po zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gal te yang de nyid bsdus pa la sogs par phyi'i 'od zer gyi phreng ba la gdab po zhes gsungs so //
translated: Also, in the Condensed [Hevajra Tantra] and so forth, it is said that the stakes are driven in the outer ring of light rays.

original: de lta na yang da ltar gyi slob dpon rnams ni dkyil 'khor gyi khang pa las phyi rol du phur pa btab nas /
analyzed: de lta na yang da ltar gyi slob dpon rnams ni dkyil 'khor gyi khang pa las phyi rol du phur pa btab nas /
translated: However, the present masters drive in the stakes outside the mandala house.

original: de'i steng du sa'i gong bu bcu byas par phur pa'i gzugs kyi khro bo rnams la thun so so la me tog la sogs pa dang bdug pa dang gtor ma dbul ba rnams kyis mnyes par bya'o zhes gsungs shing mdzad pa ni mi 'gal te /
analyzed: de'i steng du sa'i gong bu bcu byas par phur pa'i gzugs kyi khro bo rnams la thun so so la me tog la sogs pa dang bdug pa dang gtor ma dbul ba rnams kyis mnyes par bya'o zhes gsungs shing mdzad pa ni mi 'gal te /
translated: On top of that, having made ten lumps of earth, the wrathful ones in the form of daggers are pleased by the offerings of flowers, etc. and incense and sacrificial cakes in each session.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar byas nas yang mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar byas nas yang mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no contradiction in saying and doing this, because having done it in that way, it is for the sake of the desired powers.

original: de ltar phur bu btab pa dang brdung ba dag gis bgegs kyi tshogs ba de ba chen pos de bzhin nyid du ro gcig pa dang / bgegs lhag ma rnams kyang ring du bros par bsam mo //
analyzed: de ltar phur bu btab pa dang brdung ba dag gis bgegs kyi tshogs ba de ba chen pos de bzhin nyid du ro gcig pa dang / bgegs lhag ma rnams kyang ring du bros par bsam mo //
translated: In that way, having driven in the daggers and beaten the obstacles, one should imagine that the great mass of obstacles is of one taste with suchness, and that the remaining obstacles flee far away.

original: de lta bus steng dang 'og dang phyogs su khor yug chen po'i bar du 'gro ba rnams rnam pa thams cad du bgegs med par brtan par mos par bya'o zhes rim pa gcig go //
analyzed: de lta bus steng dang 'og dang phyogs su khor yug chen po'i bar du 'gro ba rnams rnam pa thams cad du bgegs med par brtan par mos par bya'o zhes rim pa gcig go //
translated: In that way, one should imagine that all beings above, below, and in the directions, up to the outer rim, are completely free from obstacles.

original: yang na aom a'a: h'um ya m'a nta kri ta sarba dushta aindra au pa aindra nam sa pa ri b'a r'a na k'i la ya h'um phat /🔽aom a'a: h'um pra dzny'a nta kri ta sarba du shta ya man sa pa ri b'a r'a na k'i la ya h'um phat /
analyzed: yang na aom a'a: h'um ya m'a nta kri ta sarba dushta aindra au pa aindra nam sa pa ri b'a r'a na k'i la ya h'um phat / aom a'a: h'um pra dzny'a nta kri ta sarba du shta ya man sa pa ri b'a r'a na k'i la ya h'um phat /
translated: Or else:🔽Oṃ āḥ hūṃ. Yamāntakṛta, all enemies, Indra, Upendra, Namas parivāra, kīlaya hūṃ phaṭ.

original: aom a'a: h'um padm'a nta kri ta @14b sarba du shta n'a gnas pa ri b'a r'a na k'i la ya h'um phat /
analyzed: aom a'a: h'um padm'a nta kri ta @14b sarba du shta n'a gnas pa ri b'a r'a na k'i la ya h'um phat /
translated: Oṃ āḥ hūṃ. Prajñāntakṛta, all enemies, Yama, Namas parivāra, kīlaya hūṃ phaṭ.🔽Oṃ āḥ hūṃ. Padmāntakṛta, all enemies, Nāga, Namas parivāra, kīlaya hūṃ phaṭ.

original: aom a'a: h'um bi ghn'a nta kri ta sarba dushta ku be ra na sa pa ri b'a r'a na k'i la ya h'um phat /
analyzed: aom a'a: h'um bi ghn'a nta kri ta sarba dushta ku be ra na sa pa ri b'a r'a na k'i la ya h'um phat /
translated: Oṃ āḥ hūṃ. Vighnāntakṛta, all enemies, Kubera, Namas parivāra, kīlaya hūṃ phaṭ.

original: aom a'a: h'um aa tsa la sarba du shta a'i shva na sa pa ri b'a r'a na k'i la ya h'um phat /
analyzed: aom a'a: h'um aa tsa la sarba du shta a'i shva na sa pa ri b'a r'a na k'i la ya h'um phat /
translated: Oṃ āḥ hūṃ. Acala, all enemies, Īśvara, Namas parivāra, kīlaya hūṃ phaṭ.

original: aom a'a: h'um ta kki r'a dza sarba dushta aa gni na sa pa ri b'a r'a na k'i la ya h'um phat /
analyzed: aom a'a: h'um ta kki r'a dza sarba dushta aa gni na sa pa ri b'a r'a na k'i la ya h'um phat /
translated: Oṃ āḥ hūṃ. Takkirāja, all enemies, Agni, Namas parivāra, kīlaya hūṃ phaṭ.

original: aom a'a: h'um ni la da nda sarba du shta na nee rri ta na sa pa ri s'a r'a na k'i la ya h'um phat /
analyzed: aom a'a: h'um ni la da nda sarba du shta na nee rri ta na sa pa ri s'a r'a na k'i la ya h'um phat /
translated: Oṃ āḥ hūṃ. Nilāmbaradhara, all enemies, Nairṛti, Namas parivāra, kīlaya hūṃ phaṭ.

original: aom a'a: h'um ma h'a ba la sarba du shta b'a yu na sa pa ri b'a r'a na k'i la ya h'um phat /
analyzed: aom a'a: h'um ma h'a ba la sarba du shta b'a yu na sa pa ri b'a r'a na k'i la ya h'um phat /
translated: Oṃ āḥ hūṃ mahābala sarva duṣṭān vajra kīlaya hūṃ phaṭ.

original: aom a'a: h'um tsa kra barti na sarba du shta aa rka tsandra pi ta ma h'a na sa pa ri b'a r'a na k'i la ya h'um phat /
analyzed: aom a'a: h'um tsa kra barti na sarba du shta aa rka tsandra pi ta ma h'a na sa pa ri b'a r'a na k'i la ya h'um phat /
translated: Oṃ āḥ hūṃ cakravarti sarva duṣṭān rakṣa candra piṭa mahā na sa parivāra kīlaya hūṃ phaṭ.

original: aom a'a: h'um su mbha sarba du shta be ma tsi tri pri thi b'i de ba t'a /
analyzed: aom a'a: h'um su mbha sarba du shta be ma tsi tri pri thi b'i de ba t'a /
translated: Oṃ āḥ hūṃ sūmbha sarva duṣṭān vemacitri prathīva deva tā.

original: sa pa ri b'a r'a na k'i la ya h'um phat /
analyzed: sa pa ri b'a r'a na k'i la ya h'um phat /
translated: Sa parivāra kīlaya hūṃ phaṭ.

original: ces pa'i sngags kyis shar la sogs par dbang po la sogs pa'i ngo bo bgegs rnams la phur bu gdab pa dang brdung bar bya'o //
analyzed: ces pa'i sngags kyis shar la sogs par dbang po la sogs pa'i ngo bo bgegs rnams la phur bu gdab pa dang brdung bar bya'o //
translated: With these mantras, one should drive in the daggers and beat the obstructors who are the nature of Indra and so forth in the east and so forth.

original: gzhan thams cad ni snga ma bzhin no zhes pa rim pa gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan thams cad ni snga ma bzhin no zhes pa rim pa gnyis pa'o //
translated: All else is the same as before.

original: kha cig ni mtshams bzhi kho nar phur pa bzhi gdab po zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kha cig ni mtshams bzhi kho nar phur pa bzhi gdab po zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say that one should drive in four daggers only in the four intermediate directions.

original: sgo rnams kho na la zhes pa ni gzhan no //
analyzed: sgo rnams kho na la zhes pa ni gzhan no //
translated: Others say that it is only in the gates.

original: khro bo rnams dang dbang po la sogs pa rnams kyi kha dog dang dbyibs la sogs pa 'dod par gyur na srung ba'i 'khor lo rgyas par bsgom pa ni man ngag gi snye mar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: khro bo rnams dang dbang po la sogs pa rnams kyi kha dog dang dbyibs la sogs pa 'dod par gyur na srung ba'i 'khor lo rgyas par bsgom pa ni man ngag gi snye mar rig par bya'o //
translated: If one desires the colors, shapes, etc. of the wrathful ones, the lords, etc., one should meditate on the extensive protection wheel, as should be known from the Ratnāvalī.

original: yang na sing ldeng la sogs pa'i phur pa med par ji ltar brjod pa'i sgom pa kho nas phur pa gdab pa dang / brdung ba byas la lag pa gan rkyal du gnas pa bsgyur nas aom a'a: badzra h'um zhes brjod cing sa la bsnun cing de ltar mos par bya'o //
analyzed: yang na sing ldeng la sogs pa'i phur pa med par ji ltar brjod pa'i sgom pa kho nas phur pa gdab pa dang / brdung ba byas la lag pa gan rkyal du gnas pa bsgyur nas aom a'a: badzra h'um zhes brjod cing sa la bsnun cing de ltar mos par bya'o //
translated: Or else, without a dagger of khadira wood, etc., one should perform the stabbing and striking with the meditation just described, and having turned over the supine hand, one should say oṃ āḥ vajra hūṃ, and strike the ground, and imagine it thus.

original: bgegs la phur bus gdab pa'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: bgegs la phur bus gdab pa'i cho ga'o //
translated: The rite of stabbing the obstructors with the dagger.

original: de'i rjes la dkyil 'khor gyi sa'i dbus su 'dug ste /
analyzed: de'i rjes la dkyil 'khor gyi sa'i dbus su 'dug ste /
translated: After that, one should sit in the center of the maṇḍala ground,

original: 'dug ste / 'khor byas par rang gi mdun du sa'i lha mo bam las byung bar bsgoms nas lag pa g-yas pa'i zla bar h'um bsams te /
analyzed: 'dug ste / 'khor byas par rang gi mdun du sa'i lha mo bam las byung bar bsgoms nas lag pa g-yas pa'i zla bar h'um bsams te /
translated: and having meditated on Pṛthivī, the goddess of the ground, arisen from vaṃ, in front of oneself, one should imagine hūṃ on the moon of the right hand,🔽and having made the mudra of the arrow, one should say oṃ pṛthivi bhūr jīvaṃ dehi svāhā.

original: sor mo'i rtse mos la lan gsum bsnun pa dang / de'i sgra dang h'um gi 'od zer rnams kyis bskul bas sa'i lha mo ye shes sems dpa'i ngo bo 'thon pa dang lhan cig 'dres par gyur pa dga' ba dang ldan pa'i thugs can ser mo zhi ba na bza' dkar po bsnams pa rgyan sna tshogs can /
analyzed: sor mo'i rtse mos la lan gsum bsnun pa dang / de'i sgra dang h'um gi 'od zer rnams kyis bskul bas sa'i lha mo ye shes sems dpa'i ngo bo 'thon pa dang lhan cig 'dres par gyur pa dga' ba dang ldan pa'i thugs can ser mo zhi ba na bza' dkar po bsnams pa rgyan sna tshogs can /
translated: She is yellow, peaceful, and endowed with the mind of joy. She is adorned with various ornaments.

original: phyag g-yon pa gser gyi bum pa bzang po bsnams shing /
analyzed: phyag g-yon pa gser gyi bum pa bzang po bsnams shing /
translated: Her left hand holds an excellent golden vase,

original: cig shos kyis mi 'jigs pa mdzad pa /
analyzed: cig shos kyis mi 'jigs pa mdzad pa /
translated: and the other one makes the gesture of fearlessness.🔽She stands in front, having been invited with water for welcoming and so forth.

original: zhal gcig ma mdun du gnas pa la mchod yon la sogs pa sngon du 'gro bas mchod pa'i mjug thog tu /🔽aom tshur spyon tshur spyon sa yi ni //
analyzed: zhal gcig ma mdun du gnas pa la mchod yon la sogs pa sngon du 'gro bas mchod pa'i mjug thog tu / aom tshur spyon tshur spyon sa yi ni //
translated: At the conclusion of the offerings,🔽recite:

original: lha mo @15a * //
analyzed: lha mo @15a * //
translated: Oṃ, come, come, O goddess of the earth,

original: chen mo 'jig rten yum //
analyzed: chen mo 'jig rten yum //
translated: great mother of the world,

original: rin chen kun gyis rab gang ma //
analyzed: rin chen kun gyis rab gang ma //
translated: filled with all jewels,

original: bzang po'i rgyan gyis byis rnam brgyan ma //
analyzed: bzang po'i rgyan gyis byis rnam brgyan ma //
translated: adorned with the ornaments of excellence,

original: do shal rkang gdub sgra ldan ma //
analyzed: do shal rkang gdub sgra ldan ma //
translated: with the sound of necklaces and anklets,

original: rdo rje sems dpa' rab mchod ma //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' rab mchod ma //
translated: adorning Vajrasattva.

original: mchog yon 'di ni bzhes byas nas //
analyzed: mchog yon 'di ni bzhes byas nas //
translated: Having accepted this supreme gift,

original: dkyil 'khor las ni legs bsgrub mdzod /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor las ni legs bsgrub mdzod /
translated: you should accomplish the maṇḍala.

original: h'i h'i h'i h'i h'am sv'a h'a zhes lan gsum brjod la spyan drangs pa dang / nye bar gnas par gsol ba dang bcas pa'i lha dang gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: h'i h'i h'i h'i h'am sv'a h'a zhes lan gsum brjod la spyan drangs pa dang / nye bar gnas par gsol ba dang bcas pa'i lha dang gnas par bya'o //
translated: Having recited “hī hī hī hī hī hāṃ svāhā” three times, the invited deities should be requested to remain together with the resident deities.

original: legs bsgrub mdzod ces ba'i shugs kyis ni nye bar gnas par brjod do //🔽yang na / skyob pa sangs rgyas thams cad kyi //
analyzed: legs bsgrub mdzod ces ba'i shugs kyis ni nye bar gnas par brjod do // yang na / skyob pa sangs rgyas thams cad kyi //
translated: The meaning of “accomplish” is expressed by the force of “you should remain.”🔽Or:🔽You are the witness, O goddess,🔽of the way of conduct and the special qualities

original: spyod pa'i tshul dang khyad par dang // sa dang pha rol phyin rnams dang ; / lha mo khyod ni dpang du gyur //🔽skyob pa sh'a kya seng ge yis //
analyzed: spyod pa'i tshul dang khyad par dang // sa dang pha rol phyin rnams dang ; / lha mo khyod ni dpang du gyur // skyob pa sh'a kya seng ge yis //
translated: of the stages and perfections of all the buddhas, the protectors.🔽Just as the protector, the lion of the Śākyas,

original: ji ltar bdud kyi dpung bcom pa //🔽de ltar bdag gis bdud kyi stobs //
analyzed: ji ltar bdud kyi dpung bcom pa // de ltar bdag gis bdud kyi stobs //
translated: destroyed the army of Māra,🔽in the same way, I will destroy

original: bcom nas dkyil 'khor 'dri bar bgyi //
analyzed: bcom nas dkyil 'khor 'dri bar bgyi //
translated: the power of Māra and draw the maṇḍala.

original: zhes lan gsum brjod la lhag par gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes lan gsum brjod la lhag par gnas par bya'o //
translated: Having recited this three times, one should remain in the samayas.

original: de yang de ltar gyis shig ces gsungs nas de nyid du thim par bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang de ltar gyis shig ces gsungs nas de nyid du thim par bsam par bya'o //
translated: Then, having said, “You should do just that,” one should imagine that they dissolve into oneself.

original: de nas rdo rje bcing ba nang du byas nas des sa de mnan la aom badzr'i bha ba h'um /
analyzed: de nas rdo rje bcing ba nang du byas nas des sa de mnan la aom badzr'i bha ba h'um /
translated: Then, having made the vajra bond inside, one should press down on the ground with it and recite Oṃ vajra āveśaya aṃ three times.

original: zhes lan gsum brjod de rdo rje bsdams pa las byung ba'i yi ge h'um 'bar ba 'phros pas dbang chen gyi 'og gi bar rdo rjer byas par bsams nas aom badzra di da ti shtha zhes lan gsum brjod pas byin gyis brlab po //
analyzed: zhes lan gsum brjod de rdo rje bsdams pa las byung ba'i yi ge h'um 'bar ba 'phros pas dbang chen gyi 'og gi bar rdo rjer byas par bsams nas aom badzra di da ti shtha zhes lan gsum brjod pas byin gyis brlab po //
translated: Having imagined that the ground below the great power is made of vajra by the spreading of the blazing syllable hūṃ arisen from the vajra bond, one should consecrate it by reciting Oṃ vajra dṛdhī-sthāna three times.

original: de nas sa rang gi dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas sa rang gi dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: Then the ground will come under one’s control.

original: nor 'dzin ma lhag par gnas pa'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: nor 'dzin ma lhag par gnas pa'i cho ga'o //
translated: This is the rite of the special consecration of the earth.

original: de nas dkyil 'khor gyi sa la dri zhim po'i bdud rtsi lnga dang bcas pa la yi ge gsum gyis bsngags pas byug cing /
analyzed: de nas dkyil 'khor gyi sa la dri zhim po'i bdud rtsi lnga dang bcas pa la yi ge gsum gyis bsngags pas byug cing /
translated: Then, on the ground of the maṇḍala, one should smear it with the five nectars and the five cow products, and anoint it with the three syllables.

original: me tog gcal du dgram du bcug la /
analyzed: me tog gcal du dgram du bcug la /
translated: One should scatter flowers on the ground.

original: phyi dro'i dus su khrus bya zhing lus la dri bzang pos byugs te gos dmar po bzang po gyon la /
analyzed: phyi dro'i dus su khrus bya zhing lus la dri bzang pos byugs te gos dmar po bzang po gyon la /
translated: In the evening, one should bathe, anoint one’s body with perfume, and put on good, red clothes.

original: me tog gi phreng ba can gyi zhim pos bgos la /
analyzed: me tog gi phreng ba can gyi zhim pos bgos la /
translated: One should be anointed with the perfume of a flower garland.

original: do shal dang / rkang gdub dang / rna rgyan dang / dpung rgyan dang / lag gdub dang / 'og pag dang / sor gdub la sogs pa'i rgyan gyis brgyan te /
analyzed: do shal dang / rkang gdub dang / rna rgyan dang / dpung rgyan dang / lag gdub dang / 'og pag dang / sor gdub la sogs pa'i rgyan gyis brgyan te /
translated: He is adorned with ornaments such as necklaces, anklets, earrings, bracelets, armlets, rings, and so forth.

original: aom h'um sv'a h'a zhes pa dang / aom badzra au shn'i sha h'um phat ces pa dag gis go rims bzhin du lan bdun du bsngags pa'i gos dmar po dang cod pan gyis brgyan pa dkyil 'khor gyi gzhi'i dbus su shar du phyogs par 'dug pa'am /
analyzed: aom h'um sv'a h'a zhes pa dang / aom badzra au shn'i sha h'um phat ces pa dag gis go rims bzhin du lan bdun du bsngags pa'i gos dmar po dang cod pan gyis brgyan pa dkyil 'khor gyi gzhi'i dbus su shar du phyogs par 'dug pa'am /
translated: With the mantras Oṃ hūṃ svāhā and Oṃ vajra uṣṇīṣa hūṃ phaṭ, he is adorned with a red garment and a crown, and he sits in the center of the maṇḍala facing east.

original: phyogs gzhan la ni dkyil 'khor gyi shar nas nub tu phyogs pas 'dug ste /
analyzed: phyogs gzhan la ni dkyil 'khor gyi shar nas nub tu phyogs pas 'dug ste /
translated: Or, in another case, he sits facing west in the east of the maṇḍala.

original: dkyil 'khor gyi bdag po'i rnal @15b 'byor dang ldan pas lha rnams kyi gnas su bdud rtsi dang / tsandan dang / gur gum la sogs pas mandala rnams byas la rang gi dam tshig gi 'khor lo ji lta bar bsgoms nas de la nam mkha' la gnas pa'i ye shes kyi 'khor lo spyan drangs nas bcug ste /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi bdag po'i rnal @15b 'byor dang ldan pas lha rnams kyi gnas su bdud rtsi dang / tsandan dang / gur gum la sogs pas mandala rnams byas la rang gi dam tshig gi 'khor lo ji lta bar bsgoms nas de la nam mkha' la gnas pa'i ye shes kyi 'khor lo spyan drangs nas bcug ste /
translated: Endowed with the yoga of the lord of the mandala, in the places of the deities one should make mandalas of nectar, sandalwood, saffron, and so forth, and having meditated on them just like one's own commitment wheel, one should invite the wisdom wheel abiding in the sky and cause it to enter.

original: mchod pa dang bstod pa dang bdud rtsi myang ba bya'o //
analyzed: mchod pa dang bstod pa dang bdud rtsi myang ba bya'o //
translated: One should make offerings, praise, and taste the elixir.

original: de nas bsgoms pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi phyi rol du shar la sogs pa'i phyogs su gnas pa'i bum pa rnams sam /
analyzed: de nas bsgoms pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi phyi rol du shar la sogs pa'i phyogs su gnas pa'i bum pa rnams sam /
translated: Then, outside the visualized mandala, in the east and so forth, one should perform the consecration of the vases that are located there.

original: phyogs gzhan la ni byang du phyogs pas dbang ldan gyi mtshams na gnas pa'i bum pa rnams lhag par gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: phyogs gzhan la ni byang du phyogs pas dbang ldan gyi mtshams na gnas pa'i bum pa rnams lhag par gnas par bya'o //
translated: Or, in another direction, one should perform the consecration of the vases located in the northeast corner, facing north.

original: de la zhi ba dang / rgyas pa dag gi bum ba'i lto ba ni zlum po sor bcu drug go //
analyzed: de la zhi ba dang / rgyas pa dag gi bum ba'i lto ba ni zlum po sor bcu drug go //
translated: There, the belly of the vases for pacifying and increasing is round, sixteen fingerbreadths.

original: lto ba'i 'og nas kha dang mchu'i bar gyi dpangs su ni sor nyi shu'o //
analyzed: lto ba'i 'og nas kha dang mchu'i bar gyi dpangs su ni sor nyi shu'o //
translated: The height from the lower belly to the mouth and lips is twenty finger-widths.

original: kha'i mtshams nas 'phyang ba'i mchu dag ni sor gnyis so //
analyzed: kha'i mtshams nas 'phyang ba'i mchu dag ni sor gnyis so //
translated: The lips hanging from the mouth are two finger-widths.

original: mgrin pa ni sor drug go //
analyzed: mgrin pa ni sor drug go //
translated: The throat is six finger-widths.

original: mchu'i mtha' nas mchu'i mtha'i bar gyi kha ni sor brgyad do //
analyzed: mchu'i mtha' nas mchu'i mtha'i bar gyi kha ni sor brgyad do //
translated: The mouth from the edge of the lips to the edge of the lips is eight finger-widths.

original: sor brgyad kyi tsha gnyis ni mgul ba'i sbubs so //
analyzed: sor brgyad kyi tsha gnyis ni mgul ba'i sbubs so //
translated: Two of the eight finger-widths are the cavity of the throat.

original: cha gcig gis ni bcu gnyis kyi zheng ngo //
analyzed: cha gcig gis ni bcu gnyis kyi zheng ngo //
translated: One part is the width of twelve.

original: dbye ba dang bskrad pa dag gi lto ba ni zlum por sor bcu gnyis so //
analyzed: dbye ba dang bskrad pa dag gi lto ba ni zlum por sor bcu gnyis so //
translated: The belly of the division and expulsion is round, twelve finger-widths.

original: dpangs su sor nyi shu rtsa bzhi'o //
analyzed: dpangs su sor nyi shu rtsa bzhi'o //
translated: The height is twenty-four finger-widths.

original: ske ba yon po ste sor brgyad do //
analyzed: ske ba yon po ste sor brgyad do //
translated: The neck is crooked, eight finger-widths.

original: kha ni sor drug go //
analyzed: kha ni sor drug go //
translated: The mouth is six finger-widths.

original: mchu gnyis ni sor re re'o //
analyzed: mchu gnyis ni sor re re'o //
translated: The two lips are one finger-width each.

original: dbang dang dgug pa dag gi bum pa ni bzo pos ji ltar byas pa'o //
analyzed: dbang dang dgug pa dag gi bum pa ni bzo pos ji ltar byas pa'o //
translated: The vase of the power and attraction is made by the artist.

original: rengs pa la ni thung zhing zlum pa dang / dpangs su sor bcu drug go //
analyzed: rengs pa la ni thung zhing zlum pa dang / dpangs su sor bcu drug go //
translated: For the paralysis, it is short and round, and sixteen finger-widths in height.

original: mgrin pa ni sor bzhi'o //
analyzed: mgrin pa ni sor bzhi'o //
translated: The throat is four finger-widths.

original: kha ni sor drug pa'o //
analyzed: kha ni sor drug pa'o //
translated: The mouth is six finger-widths.

original: mchu ni sbom zhing sor gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: mchu ni sbom zhing sor gnyis pa'o //
translated: The spout is thick and two fingerbreadths.

original: las thams cad pa la zhi ba la sogs pa'i las la brjod pa'i bum ba rnams gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: las thams cad pa la zhi ba la sogs pa'i las la brjod pa'i bum ba rnams gzung bar bya'o //
translated: For all activities, one should take the vases described for the activities of pacification and so forth.

original: 'di ni dus kyi 'khor lo las gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dus kyi 'khor lo las gsungs pa'o //
translated: This is stated in the Kālacakra Tantra.

original: de las gzhan pa'i rgyud rnams las bum pa rtsa ba dang nag nog med pa la mchu 'phyang ba /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i rgyud rnams las bum pa rtsa ba dang nag nog med pa la mchu 'phyang ba /
translated: In other tantras, vases are described as having no cracks or flaws, with a long spout,

original: mgrin pa ring ba /
analyzed: mgrin pa ring ba /
translated: a long neck,

original: gsus pa che ba rnams zhes gsungs pa yang sor bcu drug pa la sogs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gsus pa che ba rnams zhes gsungs pa yang sor bcu drug pa la sogs par rig par bya'o //
translated: and a large belly. These should be understood to be sixteen fingerbreadths in size and so forth.

original: 'dir klu'i blo gros zhabs kyis gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'dir klu'i blo gros zhabs kyis gsungs pa /
translated: In this regard, Nāgabodhi’s disciple states:

original: gser ram dngul lam zangs ma'am //
analyzed: gser ram dngul lam zangs ma'am //
translated: Made of gold, silver, or copper,

original: yang nas las byas pa nyid //
analyzed: yang nas las byas pa nyid //
translated: or else made of clay,

original: ji ltar rnyed pa'i bum pa ni //
analyzed: ji ltar rnyed pa'i bum pa ni //
translated: the vase that one finds

original: rab bzang brtul zhugs can gyis dgod //
analyzed: rab bzang brtul zhugs can gyis dgod //
translated: should be used by the disciplined one.

original: ces so // de'i phyir gser la sogs pa'i bum pa brjod pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa snyong par byas @16a * //
analyzed: ces so // de'i phyir gser la sogs pa'i bum pa brjod pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa snyong par byas @16a * //
translated: Therefore, one should use a vase made of gold and so forth that has the characteristics described above.

original: nas ; bam las rin po che'i ngo bor bsgoms la zhi ba dang rgyas pa'i don du 'bras btags pa'am /🔽thod lo kor ram /
analyzed: nas ; bam las rin po che'i ngo bor bsgoms la zhi ba dang rgyas pa'i don du 'bras btags pa'am / thod lo kor ram /
translated: Meditate on the essence of the vase as a grain, such as barley, and for the purpose of pacifying or increasing, plant the grain.🔽Or, make the vase white with charnel ground ash or a sandalwood paste.

original: tsandan gyi lde gus dkar par byas te lha'i mtshan ma bris te bdud rtsi lda dang bcas pa'i dri'i chu dang / rin po che dang / sman dang / 'bru lnga dang ldan pa yal 'dab kyis kha brgyan pa /
analyzed: tsandan gyi lde gus dkar par byas te lha'i mtshan ma bris te bdud rtsi lda dang bcas pa'i dri'i chu dang / rin po che dang / sman dang / 'bru lnga dang ldan pa yal 'dab kyis kha brgyan pa /
translated: Write the name of the deity, and fill the vase with scented water, the five elixirs, jewels, medicine, and the five grains.🔽Cover the mouth of the vase with a leaf and tie a garland of flowers around its neck.🔽Arrange the vases under the canopy in the order of the signs of the colored sand mandala as will be explained.

original: ske la me tog phreng ba dang bcas pa'i gos zung bcings pa rnams bla re'i 'og tu 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rdul tshon gyi dkyil 'khor gyi mtshan ma dgod pa'i rim pas so sor dri'i mandala gyi steng du rang dang mthun pa'i gdan la dkyil 'khor gyi rnam
analyzed: ske la me tog phreng ba dang bcas pa'i gos zung bcings pa rnams bla re'i 'og tu 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rdul tshon gyi dkyil 'khor gyi mtshan ma dgod pa'i rim pas so sor dri'i mandala gyi steng du rang dang mthun pa'i gdan la dkyil 'khor gyi rnam
translated: Place the vases on their individual seats that correspond to their respective deities.

original: par mdun du bkod nas /🔽cho ga mkhas pas gos steng du //
analyzed: par mdun du bkod nas / cho ga mkhas pas gos steng du //
translated: Arrange the vases in front in the aspect of a mandala.🔽The venerable Gāndhārī says in the Methods of the Guhyasamāja Mandala:🔽The expert in ritual should lay out

original: srad bu dkar bzang dgod par bya //
analyzed: srad bu dkar bzang dgod par bya //
translated: the excellent white thread on the cloth.

original: zhes glu'i blo gros zhabs kyis gsungs shing man ngag de'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes glu'i blo gros zhabs kyis gsungs shing man ngag de'i phyir /
translated: For that esoteric instruction,

original: h'um lan bdun bzlas pa'i srad bu dkar po bdun gyis /
analyzed: h'um lan bdun bzlas pa'i srad bu dkar po bdun gyis /
translated: One should wrap it with seven white threads, each of which has been enchanted seven times with the syllable HŪṀ.

original: aom badzra shi kha ra ru ta ma ta di sham bandha bandha h'um zhes pa'i sngags kyis dkri bar bya'o //
analyzed: aom badzra shi kha ra ru ta ma ta di sham bandha bandha h'um zhes pa'i sngags kyis dkri bar bya'o //
translated: With the mantra, “OṂ Vajra-Śikhararuta Mata Diśaṃ Bhanda Bhanda HŪṀ,”

original: rgyud gzhan du zhi ba la sogs pa'i las dang mthun pa'i kha dog can lnga rnams kyis zhes so //
analyzed: rgyud gzhan du zhi ba la sogs pa'i las dang mthun pa'i kha dog can lnga rnams kyis zhes so //
translated: one should wrap it with five threads of the colors appropriate to the rite of pacification, etc., as taught in other tantras.

original: rin po che lnga ni mu tig dang / gser dang / padma r'a ga dang / bye ru dang mu men no //
analyzed: rin po che lnga ni mu tig dang / gser dang / padma r'a ga dang / bye ru dang mu men no //
translated: The five precious substances are pearl, gold, ruby, coral, and sapphire.

original: padma r'a ga ma rnyed na dngul lam zangs sam dung ngo //
analyzed: padma r'a ga ma rnyed na dngul lam zangs sam dung ngo //
translated: If one cannot obtain a ruby, one may use silver, copper, or a conch shell.

original: mu men gyi gnas su nor bu yang rung ngo //
analyzed: mu men gyi gnas su nor bu yang rung ngo //
translated: In place of the sapphire, one may also use a gem.

original: 'byor pa chung na rnam par rgyal ba dang / las thams cad pa'i bum pa dag la rin po che snying bor bya'i /
analyzed: 'byor pa chung na rnam par rgyal ba dang / las thams cad pa'i bum pa dag la rin po che snying bor bya'i /
translated: If one has little wealth, one should make the precious substances the essence of the victorious vase and the vase for all activities.

original: bum pa gzhan la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bum pa gzhan la ni ma yin no //
translated: One should not do this for other vases.

original: de yang rnam par rgyal ba'i bum pa la nges par rin po che'i snying por bya'o //
analyzed: de yang rnam par rgyal ba'i bum pa la nges par rin po che'i snying por bya'o //
translated: Moreover, one should definitely make the precious substances the essence of the victorious vase.

original: sman ldan ni bri ha ti dang / kanda ka ri dang / danda autpala dkar dmar dang / aa pa ra dzi ta dkar po rnams so //
analyzed: sman ldan ni bri ha ti dang / kanda ka ri dang / danda autpala dkar dmar dang / aa pa ra dzi ta dkar po rnams so //
translated: The five herbs are brihati, kantakari, danti, utpala, and white or red aparajita.

original: 'bru lnga ni til dang / nas dang / mon sran dang / 'bras so ba dang / gro rnams so //
analyzed: 'bru lnga ni til dang / nas dang / mon sran dang / 'bras so ba dang / gro rnams so //
