translated: The five grains are sesame, barley, beans, rice, and wheat.

original: kha cig tu ni gro'i gnas su mon sran gre'u'o //
analyzed: kha cig tu ni gro'i gnas su mon sran gre'u'o //
translated: In some cases, peas are substituted for wheat.

original: aa mra dang / n'a ga ge sar dang / aa sho ka dang / aa shvadtha dang / au dumw'a ra ste lnga po rnams gang yang rung ba'i yal 'dab po //🔽n'a ga ge sar med na n+ya gro dha'am /
analyzed: aa mra dang / n'a ga ge sar dang / aa sho ka dang / aa shvadtha dang / au dumw'a ra ste lnga po rnams gang yang rung ba'i yal 'dab po // n'a ga ge sar med na n+ya gro dha'am /
translated: The five leaves are mango, ironwood, asoka, ashvakarna, and udumbara.

original: dzambu'i lo ma'o //
analyzed: dzambu'i lo ma'o //
translated: If you cannot get ironwood, use banyan.🔽Or use the leaves of the rose apple tree.

original: gos ni dmar po 'am ;
analyzed: gos ni dmar po 'am ;
translated: The cloth is red,

original: ser po'am dkar po'o //
analyzed: ser po'am dkar po'o //
translated: yellow, or white.

original: kha cig tu ni ljang gu dang sngon po yang gsungs so //
analyzed: kha cig tu ni ljang gu dang sngon po yang gsungs so //
translated: In some cases, it is also said to be green or blue.

original: rnam par rgyal ba'i bum pa la chos 'byung gi dbus su padma la ji ltar rigs par zla ba'am nyi mar bdag po'i mtshan ma'am sa bon no //
analyzed: rnam par rgyal ba'i bum pa la chos 'byung gi dbus su padma la ji ltar rigs par zla ba'am nyi mar bdag po'i mtshan ma'am sa bon no //
translated: In the center of the phenomena source in the victory vase, on a lotus as appropriate, is a moon or sun, with the sign of the lord or the seed syllable.

original: bum pa gzhan rnams la ni padma la gnas pa'i zla ba'am nyi mar ji ltar @16b rigs par lha rnams kyi rang rang gi mtshan ma'am sa bon no //
analyzed: bum pa gzhan rnams la ni padma la gnas pa'i zla ba'am nyi mar ji ltar @16b rigs par lha rnams kyi rang rang gi mtshan ma'am sa bon no //
translated: For the other vases, on the lotus and moon or sun as appropriate, are the individual signs or seed syllables of the deities.

original: de skad du yang klu'i blo'i zhabs kyis /
analyzed: de skad du yang klu'i blo'i zhabs kyis /
translated: Thus Nāgabodhi says:

original: dkyil 'khor pa ni thams cad kyi //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor pa ni thams cad kyi //
translated: For all the deities of the maṇḍala,

original: sa bon yang na mtshan ma'ang rung //🔽gur gum la sogs mngon 'dus byas //
analyzed: sa bon yang na mtshan ma'ang rung // gur gum la sogs mngon 'dus byas //
translated: either the seed syllable or the sign🔽is drawn on the side of the vase

original: mkhas pas bum pa'i logs la bri //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: mkhas pas bum pa'i logs la bri // zhes gsungs so //
translated: by the wise with saffron and so forth.

original: dkyil 'khor gang du lha ji snyed yod pa de snyed du de rnams kyi bum pa'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gang du lha ji snyed yod pa de snyed du de rnams kyi bum pa'o //
translated: The number of vases is the same as the number of deities in the maṇḍala.

original: yang na dbus kyi pho brang gi lha rnams kho na'i'o //
analyzed: yang na dbus kyi pho brang gi lha rnams kho na'i'o //
translated: Alternatively, they are only for the deities of the central palace.

original: de la rigs kyi yum rnams kyi bzhi'o //🔽de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi lnga'o //
analyzed: de la rigs kyi yum rnams kyi bzhi'o // de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi lnga'o //
translated: For that, there are four for the consorts of the families.🔽There are five for the tathāgatas.

original: yang na de bzhin gshegs pa kho na'i lnga'o //
analyzed: yang na de bzhin gshegs pa kho na'i lnga'o //
translated: Alternatively, there are five for the tathāgatas alone.

original: yang na bdag po'i gcig dang / de bzhin gshegs pa bzhi'i gcig dang rigs kyi yum bzhi'i gcig dang / gzugs rdo rje la sogs pa drug gi gcig dang / khro bo bzhi'i gcig ste lnga'o //
analyzed: yang na bdag po'i gcig dang / de bzhin gshegs pa bzhi'i gcig dang rigs kyi yum bzhi'i gcig dang / gzugs rdo rje la sogs pa drug gi gcig dang / khro bo bzhi'i gcig ste lnga'o //
translated: Or else, there are five: the one of the lord, the one of the four Tathagatas, the one of the four consorts of the families, the one of the six beginning with Rupavajrā, and the one of the four wrathful ones.

original: yang na gtso bo kho na'i gcig go //
analyzed: yang na gtso bo kho na'i gcig go //
translated: Or else, there is only one, that of the principal one.

original: phyogs 'di rnams la las thams cad pa'i bum pa lhag par bya ste /
analyzed: phyogs 'di rnams la las thams cad pa'i bum pa lhag par bya ste /
translated: In these directions, one should make a special vase of all activities,

original: slob ma la sogs pa bsang ba'i don du'o ;
analyzed: slob ma la sogs pa bsang ba'i don du'o ;
translated: for the purpose of purifying the disciples and so forth.

original: ; kha cig gis ni 'di mi 'dod do //
analyzed: ; kha cig gis ni 'di mi 'dod do //
translated: Some do not accept this.

original: bum pa gnyis pa yang med na rnam par rgyal ba'i bum pa la gtso bo'i mtshan ma dang / de'i g-yon du las thams cad pa'i mtshan ma bri bar bya'o zhes pa ni phyogs gzhan te /
analyzed: bum pa gnyis pa yang med na rnam par rgyal ba'i bum pa la gtso bo'i mtshan ma dang / de'i g-yon du las thams cad pa'i mtshan ma bri bar bya'o zhes pa ni phyogs gzhan te /
translated: If there is no second vase, one should draw the sign of the principal one on the victorious vase, and to the left of that, the sign of all activities. This is another position.

original: de'i mtshan ma ni bgegs mthar byed kyi'o //
analyzed: de'i mtshan ma ni bgegs mthar byed kyi'o //
translated: Its sign is that of Vighnantaka.

original: rnam par snad mdzad la sogs pa'i mtshan ma bzhi phyogs bzhir bri'o zhes pa'i phyogs la gtso bo'i mtshan ma ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi mtshan ma'i steng du'o //
analyzed: rnam par snad mdzad la sogs pa'i mtshan ma bzhi phyogs bzhir bri'o zhes pa'i phyogs la gtso bo'i mtshan ma ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi mtshan ma'i steng du'o //
translated: In some places it is explained that the sign of the principal one is on top of the sign of Vairochana.

original: kha cig tu ni de nyid kha'i steng du'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: kha cig tu ni de nyid kha'i steng du'o zhes bshad do //
translated: In some places it is explained that it is on top of the mouth.

original: spyan ma la sogs pa rnams kyi yang phyogs bzhi ru'o zhes pa ni phyogs gzhan no //
analyzed: spyan ma la sogs pa rnams kyi yang phyogs bzhi ru'o zhes pa ni phyogs gzhan no //
translated: The signs of Locana and so forth are in the four directions.

original: yang na / sangs rgyas lnga dang lha mo bzhi //
analyzed: yang na / sangs rgyas lnga dang lha mo bzhi //
translated: Or, the five Buddhas, four goddesses,

original: khro bo bzhi yi bum pa rnams //
analyzed: khro bo bzhi yi bum pa rnams //
translated: four wrathful ones,

original: so sor 'khyil ba'i gcig dang ni //
analyzed: so sor 'khyil ba'i gcig dang ni //
translated: and one coiled to the right,

original: gzugs kyi rdo rje sogs drug la'ang //
analyzed: gzugs kyi rdo rje sogs drug la'ang //
translated: and also the six beginning with Rupavajrā,

original: mtshan ma lhan pa gcig yin no //
analyzed: mtshan ma lhan pa gcig yin no //
translated: have one sign each.

original: zhes bya bas bco lnga'o //
analyzed: zhes bya bas bco lnga'o //
translated: Thus there are fifteen.

original: 'ga' zhig gis brjod pa'i phyogs rnams las phyogs gzhan du brjod pa ni mi rigs so //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gis brjod pa'i phyogs rnams las phyogs gzhan du brjod pa ni mi rigs so //
translated: It is not correct to state another position different from those stated by some.

original: de ltar 'jam pa'i rdo rje'i dkyil 'khor la nyi shu dang / bcu dang / drug dang / gnyis dang / gcig dang / bco lnga ste bum pa'i grangs rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar 'jam pa'i rdo rje'i dkyil 'khor la nyi shu dang / bcu dang / drug dang / gnyis dang / gcig dang / bco lnga ste bum pa'i grangs rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: Thus, in the maṇḍala of Mañjuvajra, there are twenty, ten, six, two, one, and fifteen vases, which are the number of vases that are set up.

original: bsdus pa'i rim pa'i dkyil 'khor du lnga pa gnyis pa'i phyogs la ni /
analyzed: bsdus pa'i rim pa'i dkyil 'khor du lnga pa gnyis pa'i phyogs la ni /
translated: In the maṇḍala of the concise stage, on the side of the fifth two,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi gcig go //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi gcig go //
translated: there is one of the tathāgatas.

original: yum rnams @17a * //🔽kyi gcig go //
analyzed: yum rnams @17a * // kyi gcig go //
translated: There is one of the mothers.

original: gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pa bzhi'i gcig go //
analyzed: gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pa bzhi'i gcig go //
translated: There is one of the four, beginning with Rūpavajrā.

original: byang chub sems dpa' brgyad kyi gcig go //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' brgyad kyi gcig go //
translated: There is one of the eight bodhisattvas.🔽There is one of the ten wrathful ones.

original: khro bo bcu'i gcig go zhes pa ni khyad par ro //
analyzed: khro bo bcu'i gcig go zhes pa ni khyad par ro //
translated: This is the difference.

original: rang phyogs sras gnyis bdag gi gcig //
analyzed: rang phyogs sras gnyis bdag gi gcig //
translated: Some say that there is one of the two sons in one’s own direction,

original: khro drug btsun mo rnams kyi yang //
analyzed: khro drug btsun mo rnams kyi yang //
translated: and there is one of the six wrathful ones and the queens.

original: pho brang gnas dang sgo skyong dang / bgegs dgra'i re re nyi shu'o //
analyzed: pho brang gnas dang sgo skyong dang / bgegs dgra'i re re nyi shu'o //
translated: There is one of the palace, the gate guardians, and the obstacle-makers.

original: zhes pa ni kha cig go //
analyzed: zhes pa ni kha cig go //
translated: This is the position of some.🔽In the maṇḍala of Vajradhātu, which is taught in the Kālacakra, on the side of the fifth two,

original: kha sbyor du gsungs pa'i rdo rje dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor du phyogs gnyis pa'i lnga pa la ni /
analyzed: kha sbyor du gsungs pa'i rdo rje dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor du phyogs gnyis pa'i lnga pa la ni /
translated: there is one of the tathāgatas.🔽There is one of the mothers.🔽There is one of the four, beginning with Rūpavajrā.🔽There is one of the eight bodhisattvas.🔽There is one of the ten wrathful ones.🔽This is the difference.🔽Some say that there is one of the two sons in one’s own direction,🔽and there is one of the six wrathful ones and the queens.🔽There is one of the palace, the gate guardians, and the obstacle-makers.🔽This is the position of some.

original: pho brang na gnas pa rnams kyi gcig go //
analyzed: pho brang na gnas pa rnams kyi gcig go //
translated: One is for those who dwell in the palace.

original: rim pa gnyis par gnas pa rnams kyi gcig go //
analyzed: rim pa gnyis par gnas pa rnams kyi gcig go //
translated: One is for those who dwell in the second tier.

original: phyogs kyi lha mo rnams kyi gcig go //
analyzed: phyogs kyi lha mo rnams kyi gcig go //
translated: One is for the goddesses of the directions.

original: mtshams kyi lha mo brgyad rnams kyi gcig go //
analyzed: mtshams kyi lha mo brgyad rnams kyi gcig go //
translated: One is for the eight goddesses of the intermediate directions.

original: sgo skyong rnams kyi gcig go zhes pa ni khyad par ro //
analyzed: sgo skyong rnams kyi gcig go zhes pa ni khyad par ro //
translated: One is for the gate guardians.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dang rigs kyi yum dang sgo skyong rnams kyi bum pa so sor ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dang rigs kyi yum dang sgo skyong rnams kyi bum pa so sor ro //
translated: The vases of the transcendent lords, the consorts of the transcendent lords, and the gate guardians are individual.

original: rim pa gnyis par gnas pa'i phyogs kyi lha mo rnams kyi gcig go //
analyzed: rim pa gnyis par gnas pa'i phyogs kyi lha mo rnams kyi gcig go //
translated: One is for the goddesses of the directions who dwell in the second tier.

original: mtshams kyi lha mo rnams kyi gcig go//
analyzed: mtshams kyi lha mo rnams kyi gcig go//
translated: One is for the goddesses of the intermediate directions.

original: rim pa gsum pa'i phyogs kyi g-yon phyogs su gnas pa rnams kyi gcig go //🔽g-yas phyogs na gnas pa rnams kyi gcig go //
analyzed: rim pa gsum pa'i phyogs kyi g-yon phyogs su gnas pa rnams kyi gcig go // g-yas phyogs na gnas pa rnams kyi gcig go //
translated: One is for those who dwell to the left of the directions in the third tier.🔽One is for those who dwell to the right.

original: mtshams su gnas pa rnams kyi gcig go //
analyzed: mtshams su gnas pa rnams kyi gcig go //
translated: One is for those who dwell in the intermediate directions.

original: de'i phyi rol du mtshams su gnas pa rnams kyi gcig go //
analyzed: de'i phyi rol du mtshams su gnas pa rnams kyi gcig go //
translated: One is for those who dwell in the intermediate directions outside of that.🔽One is for all activities.

original: las thams cad pa'i gcig ste de ltar nyi shu zhes pa ni kha cig go//
analyzed: las thams cad pa'i gcig ste de ltar nyi shu zhes pa ni kha cig go//
translated: Thus there are twenty.

original: bde mchog gi dkyil 'khor la ni 'khor lo lnga la so sor re re ste lnga'o //
analyzed: bde mchog gi dkyil 'khor la ni 'khor lo lnga la so sor re re ste lnga'o //
translated: In the Cakrasaṃvara maṇḍala, there are five for each of the five wheels, making twenty-five.

original: yang na pho brang du gnas pa rnams kho na'i lnga'o //
analyzed: yang na pho brang du gnas pa rnams kho na'i lnga'o //
translated: Alternatively, there are five for those who dwell in the palace.

original: yang na 'di rnams kyi lnga dang 'khor lo bzhi'i bzhi ste dgu'o //
analyzed: yang na 'di rnams kyi lnga dang 'khor lo bzhi'i bzhi ste dgu'o //
translated: Or there are nine, five for these and four for the four wheels.

original: yang na dbus kyi pho brang dang dam tshig gi 'khor lo la gnas pa rnams kyi bcu gsum mo //
analyzed: yang na dbus kyi pho brang dang dam tshig gi 'khor lo la gnas pa rnams kyi bcu gsum mo //
translated: Or there are thirteen, for those who dwell in the central palace and the commitment wheel.

original: thugs kyi 'khor lor phyogs su gnas pa rnams kyi gcig dang / mtshams kyi gnas pa rnams kyi gcig go //
analyzed: thugs kyi 'khor lor phyogs su gnas pa rnams kyi gcig dang / mtshams kyi gnas pa rnams kyi gcig go //
translated: There is one for those who dwell in the mind wheel in the directions and one for those who dwell in the intermediate directions.

original: de bzhin du gsung gi 'khor lo dang sku'i 'khor lor yang de bcu dgu'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gsung gi 'khor lo dang sku'i 'khor lor yang de bcu dgu'o //
translated: Similarly, there are nineteen for the speech wheel and the body wheel.

original: phyogs 'di rnams su lha so so'i dgod pa las kyang dum skyes ma'i las thams cad pa'i lhag par dgod do //
analyzed: phyogs 'di rnams su lha so so'i dgod pa las kyang dum skyes ma'i las thams cad pa'i lhag par dgod do //
translated: In these directions, the arrangement of the individual deities is also to be done, especially for the all-activity Vārāhī.

original: 'di'i rjes su 'brangs pas dkyil 'khor gzhan rnams la yang ji ltar rigs par bum pa'i grangs rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di'i rjes su 'brangs pas dkyil 'khor gzhan rnams la yang ji ltar rigs par bum pa'i grangs rig par bya'o //
translated: Following this, the number of vases should be understood for the other maṇḍalas as appropriate.

original: de la gtso bo yin pa'i phyir dang bya ba mang po'i phyir rnam par rgyal ba'i steng du ji ltar rnyed pa'i bdud rtsi lnga dang / dri bzang gi chu aom badzra aa mri to da ka tha: h'um zhes bya ba dang / yi ge gsum gyis lan bdun bsngags @17b pas ye shes kyi bdud rtsir byas pa'i rdo rje'i rdul phra rab kyi rang bzhin dang ldan pa'i dung chos sam padma'i snod h'um gis bsngags pa dang /
analyzed: de la gtso bo yin pa'i phyir dang bya ba mang po'i phyir rnam par rgyal ba'i steng du ji ltar rnyed pa'i bdud rtsi lnga dang / dri bzang gi chu aom badzra aa mri to da ka tha: h'um zhes bya ba dang / yi ge gsum gyis lan bdun bsngags @17b pas ye shes kyi bdud rtsir byas pa'i rdo rje'i rdul phra rab kyi rang bzhin dang ldan pa'i dung chos sam padma'i snod h'um gis bsngags pa dang /
translated: Since it is the principal one and has many functions, consecrate the victorious vase with the five elixirs and fragrant water found in it, and recite Oṃ vajra-amṛta kuṇḍali hana hana hūṃ phaṭ seven times and the three syllables.

original: me tog phreng ba bcings pa'i rdo rje bzhag nas /
analyzed: me tog phreng ba bcings pa'i rdo rje bzhag nas /
translated: Then place the vajra with the flower garland tied on it.

original: nang du aom ta pte ma h'a tapte sv'a h'a /
analyzed: nang du aom ta pte ma h'a tapte sv'a h'a /
translated: Recite Oṃ taṃ pīta mahā taṃ pīta svāhā.

original: zhes bya bas drangs pa'i lha'i gangg'a'i chu'i ngo bo'i chu la lha'i 'khor lo'i gdan dang bcas pa skad cig gis bsams la mdun du snying ga'i sa bon gyi 'od zer gyis ye shes kyi 'khor lo spyan drangs la /
analyzed: zhes bya bas drangs pa'i lha'i gangg'a'i chu'i ngo bo'i chu la lha'i 'khor lo'i gdan dang bcas pa skad cig gis bsams la mdun du snying ga'i sa bon gyi 'od zer gyis ye shes kyi 'khor lo spyan drangs la /
translated: The water inside the vase is the essence of the divine Gaṅgā water, and the seat of the divine wheel is instantly visualized.

original: zhabs bsil dang zhal bsil dang / mchod yon phul la de nas de dam tshig gi 'khor lo la bcug nas 'dod chags chen pos zhu bar gyur nas byang chub sems kyi ngo bor sngar blugs pa'i chu dang ro gcig tu gyur par bsam mo //
analyzed: zhabs bsil dang zhal bsil dang / mchod yon phul la de nas de dam tshig gi 'khor lo la bcug nas 'dod chags chen pos zhu bar gyur nas byang chub sems kyi ngo bor sngar blugs pa'i chu dang ro gcig tu gyur par bsam mo //
translated: Having offered water for the feet, water for the mouth, and water of welcome, then having introduced them into the pledge wheel, they melt through great passion and become of one taste with the water previously poured, the essence of the spirit of enlightenment.

original: mtshan ma la yang dam tshig gi lha dang ye shes kyi lha gcig tu gyur par bsam mo //🔽de nas h'um brjod cing rdo rje dang 'brel ba'i me tog gi phreng ba'i mtha' g-yon pa'i khu tshur gyis bzung la 'khor lo'i gtso bo'i snying po'i sngags sam aom badzrod ka h'um zhes bya bas chu la brgya rtsa brgyad bsngags nas der 'khyil pa bzlas pa'i me
analyzed: mtshan ma la yang dam tshig gi lha dang ye shes kyi lha gcig tu gyur par bsam mo // de nas h'um brjod cing rdo rje dang 'brel ba'i me tog gi phreng ba'i mtha' g-yon pa'i khu tshur gyis bzung la 'khor lo'i gtso bo'i snying po'i sngags sam aom badzrod ka h'um zhes bya bas chu la brgya rtsa brgyad bsngags nas der 'khyil pa bzlas pa'i me
translated: Also, one should think that the pledge deity and the awareness deity become one.

original: tog dkar po gsum gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: tog dkar po gsum gzhug par bya'o //
translated: Then, saying hūṃ, holding the end of the flower garland connected with the vajra with the left fist, one should enchant the water one hundred and eight times with the essence mantra of the principal deity of the wheel or with oṃ vajrodaka hūṃ, and place three flowers enchanted with the mantra of Amṛtakuṇḍali into it.

original: bum pa gzhan lha gang dang gang yin pa de dang de'i sngags kyis brgya rtsa brgyad dam nyi shu rtsa gcig gam bdun du bzlas te steng gi rdo rje me tog gi phreng pa'i mthar de ltar bzung nas so ;
analyzed: bum pa gzhan lha gang dang gang yin pa de dang de'i sngags kyis brgya rtsa brgyad dam nyi shu rtsa gcig gam bdun du bzlas te steng gi rdo rje me tog gi phreng pa'i mthar de ltar bzung nas so ;
translated: The vase of any deity, with the mantra of that deity, one should recite one hundred and eight, twenty-one, or seven times, and holding it in one's hand at the end of the flower garland above the vajra,

original: / de bzhin du me tog kyang gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: / de bzhin du me tog kyang gzhug par bya'o //
translated: one should place the flower.

original: de nas rnam par rgyal ba la sogs pa'i bum pa rnams la me tog la sogs pas yang dag par mchod la /
analyzed: de nas rnam par rgyal ba la sogs pa'i bum pa rnams la me tog la sogs pas yang dag par mchod la /
translated: Then, having made offerings to the victorious vase and so forth with flowers and so forth,

original: bsrung ba'i don du las thams cad pa'i bum pa'i chus de'i yal 'dab nyid kyis bsangs te /
analyzed: bsrung ba'i don du las thams cad pa'i bum pa'i chus de'i yal 'dab nyid kyis bsangs te /
translated: in order to protect, one should sprinkle with the water of the all-activity vase, with its own branch,

original: 'dir ji srid du dkyil 'khor gyi bya ba rnams rdzogs pa de srid du bgegs rnams bzlog bar mdzod cig ces brjod cing gtor ma byin nas nye bar reg ste /
analyzed: 'dir ji srid du dkyil 'khor gyi bya ba rnams rdzogs pa de srid du bgegs rnams bzlog bar mdzod cig ces brjod cing gtor ma byin nas nye bar reg ste /
translated: and having given the bali, saying, Here, for as long as the activities of the mandala are completed, please ward off the obstructors, one should touch it.

original: mi bskyod rdo rje zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bstod pa sngon du 'gro bas dril bu dkrol bar bya'o //
analyzed: mi bskyod rdo rje zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bstod pa sngon du 'gro bas dril bu dkrol bar bya'o //
translated: Having gone in front with the praise beginning with Akṣobhya Vajra, one should ring the bell.

original: bdag nyid dang slob ma rnams la yang bsang gtor bya ba'i don du bum pa de rnams las chu nyung zad blangs la dkyil 'khor khang pa'i shar sgo'i byang gi char man ji la gnas pa'i dung chos la sogs par gzhag go //
analyzed: bdag nyid dang slob ma rnams la yang bsang gtor bya ba'i don du bum pa de rnams las chu nyung zad blangs la dkyil 'khor khang pa'i shar sgo'i byang gi char man ji la gnas pa'i dung chos la sogs par gzhag go //
translated: For the purpose of sprinkling oneself and the disciples, take a little water from those vases and place it in a conch shell, etc. located in the north of the east door of the mandala house on a maṃ.

original: gzhan du ni las thams cad pa'i bum pa nyid ku sha'i chun po dang ldan pa de'i don du der gzhag par bya'o zhes so //
analyzed: gzhan du ni las thams cad pa'i bum pa nyid ku sha'i chun po dang ldan pa de'i don du der gzhag par bya'o zhes so //
translated: Otherwise, the vase for all activities itself, together with a bundle of kuśa grass, should be placed there for that purpose.

original: bum pa rnams la mngon par bsngags pa dang / @18a * //
analyzed: bum pa rnams la mngon par bsngags pa dang / @18a * //
translated: The recitation of the mantras of the vases and

original: mchod pa la sogs pa nyi ma so sor thun gsum ma ma gcig tu bya'o //
analyzed: mchod pa la sogs pa nyi ma so sor thun gsum ma ma gcig tu bya'o //
translated: the offerings, etc. should be done daily in three sessions or in one session.

original: 'khor lo'i gtso bo la sogs pa'i sngags ni sgrub thabs la sogs pa rnams kyi nang du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'khor lo'i gtso bo la sogs pa'i sngags ni sgrub thabs la sogs pa rnams kyi nang du shes par bya'o //
translated: The mantras of the principal ones of the maṇḍala, etc. should be known from the sādhanas, etc.

original: slar mdor bsdus pa ni rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor gyi phreng ba phal cher grags ba'i phyir kha cig brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: slar mdor bsdus pa ni rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor gyi phreng ba phal cher grags ba'i phyir kha cig brjod par bya ste /
translated: The brief version is stated here because the Garland of Perfect Yoga is mostly well known.

original: de la 'jam ba'i rdo rje'i dkyil 'khor la gtso bo mi bskyod pa dang lhan cig dbyer med ba'i aom a'a: m'am h'um /
analyzed: de la 'jam ba'i rdo rje'i dkyil 'khor la gtso bo mi bskyod pa dang lhan cig dbyer med ba'i aom a'a: m'am h'um /
translated: In the mandala of Vajrapani, the principal deity is inseparable from Akshobhya, and the seed syllable is OM AH HUM.

original: rnam par snang mdzad kyi aom a'a: dzi na dzik h'um /
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad kyi aom a'a: dzi na dzik h'um /
translated: In the mandala of Vairochana, the seed syllable is OM AH JINAJIK HOH.

original: rin chen 'byung ldan gyi aom a'a: ratna dhrik h'um /🔽snang ba mtha' yas kyi aom a'a: a'a ro li ka h'um /
analyzed: rin chen 'byung ldan gyi aom a'a: ratna dhrik h'um / snang ba mtha' yas kyi aom a'a: a'a ro li ka h'um /
translated: In the mandala of Ratnasambhava, the seed syllable is OM AH RATNADHIK HOH.🔽In the mandala of Amitabha, the seed syllable is OM AH AROLIK HOH.

original: don yod grub pa'i aom a'a: pradzny'a dhri ka h'um /🔽spyan ma'i aom a'a: mo ha ra t'i h'um /
analyzed: don yod grub pa'i aom a'a: pradzny'a dhri ka h'um / spyan ma'i aom a'a: mo ha ra t'i h'um /
translated: In the mandala of Amoghasiddhi, the seed syllable is OM AH PRAJNADHIK HOH.🔽In the mandala of Lochana, the seed syllable is OM AH MOHARATI HOH.

original: m'a ma k'i'i aom a'a: dve sha ra t'i h'um /🔽gos dkar mo'i aom a'a: r'a ga ra t'i h'um /
analyzed: m'a ma k'i'i aom a'a: dve sha ra t'i h'um / gos dkar mo'i aom a'a: r'a ga ra t'i h'um /
translated: In the mandala of Mamaki, the seed syllable is OM AH DWESHARA TI HOH.🔽In the mandala of Pandaravasini, the seed syllable is OM AH RAGARATI HOH.

original: sgrol ma'i aom a'a: badzra ra t'i h'um /🔽gzugs rdo rje ma'i aom a'a: r'u pa badzra dza: h'um /
analyzed: sgrol ma'i aom a'a: badzra ra t'i h'um / gzugs rdo rje ma'i aom a'a: r'u pa badzra dza: h'um /
translated: In the mandala of Tara, the seed syllable is OM AH VAJRA RATI HOH.🔽In the mandala of Rupavajra, the seed syllable is OM AH RUPA VAJRA JAH HOH.

original: sgra rdo rje ma'i aom a'a: shabta badzre h'um h'um /🔽dri rdo rje ma'i aom a'a: gandha badzre bam h'um /
analyzed: sgra rdo rje ma'i aom a'a: shabta badzre h'um h'um / dri rdo rje ma'i aom a'a: gandha badzre bam h'um /
translated: In the mandala of Shaptavajra, the seed syllable is OM AH SHABDA VAJRA HUM HOH.🔽In the mandala of Gandhavajra, the seed syllable is OM AH GANDHA VAJRA VAM HOH.

original: ro rdo rje ma'i aom a'a: r'a sa badzra ho: h'um /
analyzed: ro rdo rje ma'i aom a'a: r'a sa badzra ho: h'um /
translated: In the mandala of Rasavajra, the seed syllable is OM AH RASA VAJRA HO HOH.

original: reg bya rdo rje ma'i aom a'a: spa rshe badzre kham h'um /
analyzed: reg bya rdo rje ma'i aom a'a: spa rshe badzre kham h'um /
translated: The mantra of Sparśavajrā is Oṃ āḥ sparśavajrā khaṃ hūṃ.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi rdo rje ma'i aom a'a: dharma dh'a tu badzre ram h'um /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi rdo rje ma'i aom a'a: dharma dh'a tu badzre ram h'um /
translated: The mantra of Dharmadhātuvajrā is Oṃ āḥ dharmadhātuvajrā raṃ hūṃ.

original: gshin rje gshed kyi aom a'a: ya m'anta kri ta h'um /
analyzed: gshin rje gshed kyi aom a'a: ya m'anta kri ta h'um /
translated: The mantra of Yamāntaka is Oṃ āḥ yamāntakṛt hūṃ.

original: shes rab mthar byed kyi aom a'a: pradzny'a nta kri ta h'um /
analyzed: shes rab mthar byed kyi aom a'a: pradzny'a nta kri ta h'um /
translated: The mantra of Prajñāntaka is Oṃ āḥ prajñāntakṛt hūṃ.

original: padma mthar byed kyi aom a'a: padm'a nta kri ta h'um /
analyzed: padma mthar byed kyi aom a'a: padm'a nta kri ta h'um /
translated: The mantra of Padmāntaka is Oṃ āḥ padmāntakṛt hūṃ.

original: bdud rtsi 'khyil pa'i aom a'a: bighn'a nta kri ta h'um /
analyzed: bdud rtsi 'khyil pa'i aom a'a: bighn'a nta kri ta h'um /
translated: The mantra of Amṛtakuṇḍali is Oṃ āḥ vighnāntakṛt hūṃ.

original: gang gi tshe 'jam pa'i rdo rje dang dbyer med pa'i mi bskyod pas 'khor lo'i gtso bo byed pa de'i tshe aom a'a: badzra dhrik h'um ngo //
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'jam pa'i rdo rje dang dbyer med pa'i mi bskyod pas 'khor lo'i gtso bo byed pa de'i tshe aom a'a: badzra dhrik h'um ngo //
translated: When Akṣobhya, who is inseparable from Mañjuvajra, is the principal of the wheel, then the mantra is Oṃ āḥ vajra-dhṛk hūṃ.

original: bsdus pa'i rim pa'i dkyil 'khor la mi bskyod pa la sogs pa rnams kyi sngags ni sngar brjod pa nyid do //
analyzed: bsdus pa'i rim pa'i dkyil 'khor la mi bskyod pa la sogs pa rnams kyi sngags ni sngar brjod pa nyid do //
translated: In the concise stage maṇḍala, the mantras of Akṣobhya and so forth are just as previously stated.

original: byams pa la sogs pa rnams kyi aom a'a: mee tri ya mam h'um /
analyzed: byams pa la sogs pa rnams kyi aom a'a: mee tri ya mam h'um /
translated: The mantras of Maitreya and so forth are Oṃ āḥ maitryāya maṃ hūṃ,

original: aom a'a: kshi ti garbha thlhim h'um /
analyzed: aom a'a: kshi ti garbha thlhim h'um /
translated: Oṃ āḥ kṣiti-garbha thaṃ hūṃ,🔽and so forth.

original: aom a'a: badzra p'a ni aom h'um /🔽aom a'a: kha ga rbha aom h'um /
analyzed: aom a'a: badzra p'a ni aom h'um / aom a'a: kha ga rbha aom h'um /
translated: Oṃ āḥ vajrapāṇi oṃ hūṃ.🔽Oṃ āḥ khagarbha oṃ hūṃ.

original: aom a'a: lo ke shva ra aom h'um /
analyzed: aom a'a: lo ke shva ra aom h'um /
translated: Oṃ āḥ lokeśvara oṃ hūṃ.

original: aom a'a: manydzugho sha h'um h'um /🔽aom a'a: sarba ni ba ra na biskam bhi ni aom h'um /
analyzed: aom a'a: manydzugho sha h'um h'um / aom a'a: sarba ni ba ra na biskam bhi ni aom h'um /
translated: Oṃ āḥ mañjughoṣa hūṃ hūṃ.🔽Oṃ āḥ sarvanivaranaviskambhinī oṃ hūṃ.

original: aom a'a: sa manta bha dra sam h'um /
analyzed: aom a'a: sa manta bha dra sam h'um /
translated: Oṃ āḥ samanta bhadra saṃ hūṃ.

original: aom a'a: aa tsa la h'um h'um /
analyzed: aom a'a: aa tsa la h'um h'um /
translated: Oṃ āḥ acala hūṃ hūṃ.

original: aom a'a: ta ki r'a dza h'um h'um /
analyzed: aom a'a: ta ki r'a dza h'um h'um /
translated: Oṃ āḥ takkirāja hūṃ hūṃ.

original: aom a'a: n'i la danda h'um h'um /
analyzed: aom a'a: n'i la danda h'um h'um /
translated: Oṃ āḥ nilanandā hūṃ hūṃ.

original: aom a'a: ma h'a ba la h'um h'um /
analyzed: aom a'a: ma h'a ba la h'um h'um /
translated: Oṃ āḥ mahābala hūṃ hūṃ.

original: aom a'a: aushn'i sha h'um h'um /
analyzed: aom a'a: aushn'i sha h'um h'um /
translated: Oṃ āḥ uṣṇīṣa hūṃ hūṃ.

original: aom a'a: sumbha h'um h'um /
analyzed: aom a'a: sumbha h'um h'um /
translated: Oṃ āḥ sumbha hūṃ hūṃ.

original: gang gi tshe mi bskyod pa dang dbyer med pa'i rdo rje sems dpa' 'khor lo'i gtso bo byed pa de'i tshe 'dir aom a'a: h'um h'um zhes pa sngags so //
analyzed: gang gi tshe mi bskyod pa dang dbyer med pa'i rdo rje sems dpa' 'khor lo'i gtso bo byed pa de'i tshe 'dir aom a'a: h'um h'um zhes pa sngags so //
translated: When Akṣobhya inseparable from Vajrasattva is the principal of the wheel, then here the mantra is oṃ āḥ hūṃ hūṃ.

original: kha sbyor du gsungs pa'i rdo rje sems dpa'i dkyil 'khor la ni /
analyzed: kha sbyor du gsungs pa'i rdo rje sems dpa'i dkyil 'khor la ni /
translated: In the maṇḍala of Vajrasattva taught in the Samputa,

original: aom a'a: badzra aa mri ta ma h'a su kha h'am sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom a'a: badzra aa mri ta ma h'a su kha h'am sv'a h'a /
translated: it is oṃ āḥ vajra amṛta mahāsukha hāṃ svāhā.

original: zhes pa ni 'khor lo'i gtso bo rdo rje sems @18b dpa'i snying po'i sngags so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni 'khor lo'i gtso bo rdo rje sems @18b dpa'i snying po'i sngags so //
translated: This is the essence mantra of Vajrasattva, the principal of the wheel.

original: aom a'a: badzra gha nte ho: ham sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom a'a: badzra gha nte ho: ham sv'a h'a /
translated: Om aḥ vajra ghanta hoḥ ham svāhā.

original: zhes ba rdo rje dril bu ma'i sngags te las thams cad pa'o //
analyzed: zhes ba rdo rje dril bu ma'i sngags te las thams cad pa'o //
translated: This is the mantra of Vajraghanta, which is for all activities.

original: sngags gzhan rnams ni rgyud nyid du phyogs gcig tu gsungs so //
analyzed: sngags gzhan rnams ni rgyud nyid du phyogs gcig tu gsungs so //
translated: The other mantras are taught in the tantra itself in one place.

original: 'khor lo sdom pa'i dkyil 'khor du gtso bo'o //
analyzed: 'khor lo sdom pa'i dkyil 'khor du gtso bo'o //
translated: This is the principal one in the Cakrasaṃvara maṇḍala.

original: aom shr'i badzra he he ru ru kam h'um h'um phat /
analyzed: aom shr'i badzra he he ru ru kam h'um h'um phat /
translated: Om śrī vajra he he ru ru kāra hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ.

original: d'a ki ni dz'a la sam war sv'a h'a zhes pa ni snying bo'o //
analyzed: d'a ki ni dz'a la sam war sv'a h'a zhes pa ni snying bo'o //
translated: Dakini jālā sana svāhā. This is the essence.

original: aom khanda ro hi h'um h'um phat zhes pa ni dum skyes ma'i sngags te las thams cad pa'o //
analyzed: aom khanda ro hi h'um h'um phat zhes pa ni dum skyes ma'i sngags te las thams cad pa'o //
translated: Om khaṇḍarohī hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ. This is the mantra of Khaṇḍarohā, which is for all activities.

original: dkyil 'khor pa gzhan rnams kyi sngags ni bde mchog gi mngon par rtogs par kho bos gdams ngag dang bcas pa bris so //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor pa gzhan rnams kyi sngags ni bde mchog gi mngon par rtogs par kho bos gdams ngag dang bcas pa bris so //
translated: I have written the mantras of the other maṇḍala deities along with instructions in the Cakrasaṃvara Abhisamaya.

original: kye'i rdo rje'i dkyil 'khor du ni 'khor lo'i gtso bo'i aom de wa pi tsu badzra h'um h'um h'um phat sv'a h'a /🔽zhes pa ni snying po'o //
analyzed: kye'i rdo rje'i dkyil 'khor du ni 'khor lo'i gtso bo'i aom de wa pi tsu badzra h'um h'um h'um phat sv'a h'a / zhes pa ni snying po'o //
translated: In the mandala of Hevajra, the essence of the principal wheel is Oṃ deva picu vajra hūṃ hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ svāhā.

original: aom a'a: sv'a h'a zhes pa'am /
analyzed: aom a'a: sv'a h'a zhes pa'am /

analyzed: aom a'a: badzra ghasma r'i aom h'um sv'a h'a /

analyzed: zhes pa za phod ma'i sngags te las thams cad pa'o //

translated: In the Vajradhātu maṇḍala taught in the Compendium of Principles, the essence of the principal wheel is Oṃ sarva tathāgata mahā yogiśvara hūṃ.

analyzed: aom badzra yaksha h'um zhes pa rdo rje gnod sbyin gyi sngags te /

original: las thams cad pa'o //

original: gzhan ni de kho na nyid bsdus pa'i rgyud du yang dag par bsdus so //
analyzed: gzhan ni de kho na nyid bsdus pa'i rgyud du yang dag par bsdus so //

analyzed: 'dir dkyil 'khor la sogs pa'i las la nye bar mkho ba'i phyir ;
translated: Here, in order to be useful for the maṇḍala and so forth,

original: dang por rdul tshon dkar po la sogs pas padma 'dab ma brgyad pa bris pa'i lte bar rnam rgyal gyi bum pa'am las thams cad pa'i bum pa gzhag go //
analyzed: dang por rdul tshon dkar po la sogs pas padma 'dab ma brgyad pa bris pa'i lte bar rnam rgyal gyi bum pa'am las thams cad pa'i bum pa gzhag go //

original: shar gyi 'dab ma la 'chad par 'gyur ba'i cho gas lhag par gnas par byas pa'i tshon sna lnga'i thig skud gnas pa'i snod do //🔽lhor rdo rje'o //

original: byang du rdo rje dril bu'o //
analyzed: byang du rdo rje dril bu'o //
translated: In the north, the vajra bell.

original: nub dang mtshams kyi 'dab ma rnams la ni ji ltar rigs pa'i rdul tshon lnga'i snod rnams so //🔽bum pa de'i chu la 'khyil ba'i sngags sam /
analyzed: nub dang mtshams kyi 'dab ma rnams la ni ji ltar rigs pa'i rdul tshon lnga'i snod rnams so // bum pa de'i chu la 'khyil ba'i sngags sam /
translated: On the western and intermediate petals, the vessels of the five-colored sand as appropriate.🔽One should sprinkle the water of that vase on the thread and the sand, reciting the mantra of Amṛtakuṇḍali

original: aom a'a a'a aam aa: zhes pa brjod cing tshon dang thig la bsang gtor bya'o //
analyzed: aom a'a a'a aam aa: zhes pa brjod cing tshon dang thig la bsang gtor bya'o //

original: bum pa lhag par gnas pa'i cho ga'o ;
analyzed: bum pa lhag par gnas pa'i cho ga'o ;
translated: This is the rite of consecrating the vase.

original: der nub tu phyogs pas bdud rtsi lnga dang bcas pa dri bzang pos ji ltar 'byung ba'i bdag po lnga'i le'u tshe rnams su mandala gru bzhi pa dang / lha gzhan rnams la zlum por byas la /

translated: In the west, facing west, in the four-cornered maṇḍala, and in the round maṇḍala for the other deities, one should arrange the five lords of the elements together with the five elixirs in the five heaps of the five scents, as they occur.

original: @19a * // mandala de rnams su rang gi snying ga'i sa bon gyi 'od zer gyis spyan drangs pa'i 'khor lo'i gtso bo la sogs ba'i lha'i dkyil 'khor ji ltar rigs par padma la gnas pa'i zla ba'am nyi ma rnams la bkod nas /
analyzed: @19a * // mandala de rnams su rang gi snying ga'i sa bon gyi 'od zer gyis spyan drangs pa'i 'khor lo'i gtso bo la sogs ba'i lha'i dkyil 'khor ji ltar rigs par padma la gnas pa'i zla ba'am nyi ma rnams la bkod nas /
translated: In those maṇḍalas, one should arrange the maṇḍala wheels of the deities, such as the principal of the wheel, and so on, invited by the light rays of the seed syllable in one’s heart center, upon lotuses, moons, or suns, as is appropriate.

original: zhabs bsil la sogs pa sngon du 'gro bas mchod pa dang / bstod pa dang bdud rtsi myang ba bya ste /🔽pus mo g-yas pa sa la btsugs shing lce h'um las skyes pa'i rdo rje rtse gcig pa byas par h'um bkod de /
analyzed: zhabs bsil la sogs pa sngon du 'gro bas mchod pa dang / bstod pa dang bdud rtsi myang ba bya ste / pus mo g-yas pa sa la btsugs shing lce h'um las skyes pa'i rdo rje rtse gcig pa byas par h'um bkod de /
translated: Having performed the offerings, praises, and tasting of elixir, with the preliminary of washing the feet, and so on,🔽one should place the right knee on the ground, and place hūṃ on the tongue, which is a single-tined vajra arisen from hūṃ.

original: lag pa g-yas par spos phor thogs te g-yon pas rdo rje dril bu dkrol zhing /
analyzed: lag pa g-yas par spos phor thogs te g-yon pas rdo rje dril bu dkrol zhing /

original: bcom ldan che ge rdo rje mchog //
analyzed: bcom ldan che ge rdo rje mchog //

original: rig pa'i rgyal po khyod la 'dud //
analyzed: rig pa'i rgyal po khyod la 'dud //

original: bka' drin gnang bar mdzad par rigs //
analyzed: bka' drin gnang bar mdzad par rigs //

original: sangs rgyas 'gro 'khor bya don stsol //

analyzed: lha dang 'jig rten skyod pa dang // 'byung po byang chub bstan gnas dang // sems can bstan la mngon dga' ba //

analyzed: gang su rdo rje'i spyan mnga' rnams //

original: bdag la yang dag dgongs su gsol //
analyzed: bdag la yang dag dgongs su gsol //

original: bdag ni che ge rdo rje can //
analyzed: bdag ni che ge rdo rje can //

translated: For the sake of the bindu of pristine consciousness and so on, having mentally arranged the maṇḍala on the ground of the maṇḍala in the sky, facing east, with the yoga of Vajradhara or the yoga of the principal maṇḍala, having obtained the signs,🔽the five-colored thread spun by a young girl who has not had an orgasm

translated: or purchased with the price of a hero is placed in five vessels. The five colors—white, yellow, red, green, and black—are mixed with white mustard seed and the five elixirs and dyed individually.

translated: Having placed the tips of the fingers on the palm of the left hand, beginning from the tips of the fingers up to the base of the thumb,🔽the syllables bhruṃ, āṃ, hrīḥ, khaṃ, and hūṃ are arranged.

original: bhr'um a'am dzr'im kham h'um gi yi ge rnams sam /
analyzed: bhr'um a'am dzr'im kham h'um gi yi ge rnams sam /

original: aom aa sva ha h'um rnams sam /🔽rgyud ji lta bar bskyed pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i ngo por gyur par bsgoms nas nam mkha' la bzhugs su gsol ba'i rang rang gi phyogs kyi de bzhin gshegs pa bsdus par gyur pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i thugs kar bhr'um la sogs pa las grub pa'i
analyzed: aom aa sva ha h'um rnams sam / rgyud ji lta bar bskyed pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i ngo por gyur par bsgoms nas nam mkha' la bzhugs su gsol ba'i rang rang gi phyogs kyi de bzhin gshegs pa bsdus par gyur pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i thugs kar bhr'um la sogs pa las grub pa'i
translated: or the syllables OṂ, A, SVA, HĀ, HŪṂ.🔽Having meditated on the nature of the five Tathāgatas generated according to the Tantra, one should visualize the wisdom thread, which is of the nature of light, arisen from the BHRŪṂ, etc.,

original: ye shes kyi skud pa 'od zer gyi rang bzhin bltas la /
analyzed: ye shes kyi skud pa 'od zer gyi rang bzhin bltas la /
translated: at the heart of the five Tathāgatas, who have been invited into the sky and who have absorbed the Tathāgatas of one’s own direction.

original: aom a'a: sh'a sho ta badzra su tram me pra ya tstsha ma h'a mandala s'u tra na ya h'um zhes bas rnam par snang mdzad dang ming bsgyur nas rin chen 'byung ldan la sogs pa rnams la yang gsol ba gdab par bya'o //

translated: One should request Vairocana with the words OṂ AḤ ŚĀŚOVATTVA VAJRA SŪTRAṂ ME PRAYATCA MAHĀMANDALA SŪTRAṆAYA HŪṂ, and one should request Ratnasaṃbhava and the others by changing the name.

analyzed: mig gnyis dza: las bskyed ba'i zla ba dang nyi ma ser po'i rang bzhin du bya ste /
translated: One should generate the two eyes from the syllables JRA and JRI, and one should make them of the nature of the yellow moon and sun.

original: aom d'i pta drishlta aam ku sha dza: zhes brjod nas /
analyzed: aom d'i pta drishlta aam ku sha dza: zhes brjod nas /
translated: One should recite OṂ DĪPTA DRṢṬI AṆKUŚA JA,

original: mig rab tu myur du bsgril zhing mig gi rdzi ma 'degs shing brdeb  pa /
analyzed: mig rab tu myur du bsgril zhing mig gi rdzi ma 'degs shing brdeb  pa /
translated: The eyes are rapidly closed and the eyelids are raised and beaten.

original: 'bar ba'i lta stangs lcags kyu lta bus rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa bskul bas de rnams bkug la rang rang gi kha dog can gyi thig skud lag pa na gnas pa rnams la bstim mo //

translated: The blazing gaze, like a hook, summons Vairochana and so forth. They are drawn in and dissolve into the threads of their own colors held in the hands.

analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de rnams ni me long lta bu la sogs pa'i ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin no // me long lta bu la @20a * //

translated: The pristine consciousnesses, such as the mirror-like pristine consciousness, are divided into twenty-five because each of the pristine consciousnesses is followed by the four pristine consciousnesses, and the five tathagatas emanate and gather from each seed.

original: ye shes re re zhing lha nyi shu'i dkyil 'khor gyi bdag nyid yin pas rnam pa brgyar phye ba yin no zhes kha cig tu gsungs so //
analyzed: ye shes re re zhing lha nyi shu'i dkyil 'khor gyi bdag nyid yin pas rnam pa brgyar phye ba yin no zhes kha cig tu gsungs so //
translated: Some say that each of the pristine consciousnesses is divided into one hundred because each of the pristine consciousnesses is the nature of a mandala of twenty deities.

original: de nas rnam par snang mdzad kyi gzugs sam /
analyzed: de nas rnam par snang mdzad kyi gzugs sam /
translated: Then, in the form of Vairochana,

original: bdud rtsi 'khyil pa la thams cad pa'i gzugs kyis slob ma thig skud 'dzin pa dang lhan cig tu aom a'a: aa n+yo n+y aa nu ga ta sarba dha rm'a: spa ra spa ra /
analyzed: bdud rtsi 'khyil pa la thams cad pa'i gzugs kyis slob ma thig skud 'dzin pa dang lhan cig tu aom a'a: aa n+yo n+y aa nu ga ta sarba dha rm'a: spa ra spa ra /
translated: or in the form of all of them, the master and the student holding the string, together with Om Ah, should recite Anuyoni Anugata Sarva Dharmas, Para Para,

analyzed: aa nu pra bi shta: sarba dha rm'a: a'a dyanta aa nu pra bishta sarba dha rm'a ;
translated: Anu Pravishtas Sarva Dharmas, Adhyanta Anu Pravishtas Sarva Dharmas.

original: aom a'a: h'um zhes brjod cing dang por skud ba lnga lngas thig skud re re bya'o //
analyzed: aom a'a: h'um zhes brjod cing dang por skud ba lnga lngas thig skud re re bya'o //
translated: Om Ah Hum. First, each string is made with five strings.

original: de nas de ltar bsgril ba'i lnga rnams kyis thig skud gcig tu bsgril ba'i thig skud slob dpon dang slob ma'i lag pa g-yon pa'i mdzub mo nas brtsams nas sor mo bzhi'i dbus su bcug cing rgyab nas drangs te slar yang bcug cing drangs nas /
analyzed: de nas de ltar bsgril ba'i lnga rnams kyis thig skud gcig tu bsgril ba'i thig skud slob dpon dang slob ma'i lag pa g-yon pa'i mdzub mo nas brtsams nas sor mo bzhi'i dbus su bcug cing rgyab nas drangs te slar yang bcug cing drangs nas /
translated: Then, with the five strings that have been thus twisted, a single string is made. The string is inserted between the index fingers of the left hands of the master and the student, and is drawn out from behind. Again, it is inserted and drawn out.

original: de dag rdo rje khu tshur du byas pa nyid dag gis mdzub mo'i rgyab kyis la sbyar te mnan pa'i bar gyi lhag pa ma gtogs pa ji srid du dkyil 'khor gyi nyis 'gyur du ring ba dang / sbom du nas kyi nyi shu chas lhag pa'i slob dpon gyis nas kyi tshad du 'gyur ba de ltar bya'o //
analyzed: de dag rdo rje khu tshur du byas pa nyid dag gis mdzub mo'i rgyab kyis la sbyar te mnan pa'i bar gyi lhag pa ma gtogs pa ji srid du dkyil 'khor gyi nyis 'gyur du ring ba dang / sbom du nas kyi nyi shu chas lhag pa'i slob dpon gyis nas kyi tshad du 'gyur ba de ltar bya'o //
translated: Those are made into vajra fists, and the backs of the index fingers are joined and pressed together, except for the tip, which is left out. The length is twice the size of the mandala, and the thickness is one twenty-fourth of a barley grain. The master should make it that size.

original: nas bdun gyis sor gyi tshigs gcig ces mngon pa nas bshad do //
analyzed: nas bdun gyis sor gyi tshigs gcig ces mngon pa nas bshad do //
translated: Seven barley grains make one finger joint. This is explained in the Abhidharma.

original: sbom du 'khor lo'i brgyad cha'i nyi shu char bshad pa ni sor nyi shu rtsa bzhi'i bdag nyid khru gang ba'i dkyil 'khor kho na'i yin no //
analyzed: sbom du 'khor lo'i brgyad cha'i nyi shu char bshad pa ni sor nyi shu rtsa bzhi'i bdag nyid khru gang ba'i dkyil 'khor kho na'i yin no //
translated: The explanation of the thickness as one twenty-fourth of a wheel is for a mandala that is one cubit in size, which is twenty-four fingerbreadths.

original: khru gnyis pa la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi tshad kyang des mtshon nas rig bar bya'o //
analyzed: khru gnyis pa la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi tshad kyang des mtshon nas rig bar bya'o //
translated: The size of mandalas that are two cubits and so forth should be understood by analogy.

original: kun dga' snying po la sogs pas ni khru drug pa'i dkyil 'khor du thig skud sbom du mthe'u chung gi tshad du bya zhing gzhan rjes su mthun par bya'o zhes so //
analyzed: kun dga' snying po la sogs pas ni khru drug pa'i dkyil 'khor du thig skud sbom du mthe'u chung gi tshad du bya zhing gzhan rjes su mthun par bya'o zhes so //
translated: Anangavajra and so forth say, In a mandala of six cubits, the width of the chalk line should be the size of the small finger, and the rest should be in proportion.

original: bsgril ba'i rjes la sngar gyi sa gzhi dris byugs pa'i gser la sogs pa'i snod gtsang mar dri'i chu dang / bdud rtsi lnga dang / ba'i rnam ldas spangs shing yi ge gsum nang du chud pa bzhag la /
analyzed: bsgril ba'i rjes la sngar gyi sa gzhi dris byugs pa'i gser la sogs pa'i snod gtsang mar dri'i chu dang / bdud rtsi lnga dang / ba'i rnam ldas spangs shing yi ge gsum nang du chud pa bzhag la /
translated: After winding it, place it in a clean vessel of gold and so forth, anointed with the previously mentioned scented water, with the five nectars and the five cow products, and with the three syllables inside.

original: dri dang me tog dang / spos rnams kyis mchod de /
analyzed: dri dang me tog dang / spos rnams kyis mchod de /
translated: Make offerings with scent, flowers, and incense.

original: lag pas reg cing 'khyil pa bzlas pas bsrung bar bya'o //
analyzed: lag pas reg cing 'khyil pa bzlas pas bsrung bar bya'o //
translated: Protect it by touching it with your hand and reciting the protection mantra.

original: de nas g-yas pa dang cig shos kyi mig dag la ma dang ta'i yi ge dag las nyi ma dang zla ba de dag bltas te /
analyzed: de nas g-yas pa dang cig shos kyi mig dag la ma dang ta'i yi ge dag las nyi ma dang zla ba de dag bltas te /
translated: Then, in your right and left eyes, from the syllables ma and ta, are the sun and moon.

original: sngar bzhin badzra drishti ma ta zhes pas brtan par byas la /
analyzed: sngar bzhin badzra drishti ma ta zhes pas brtan par byas la /
translated: As before, with vajra-netra-manopad, stabilize them.

original: las thams cad pa bzlas pa'i bdud rtsi'i chu dang / yungs kar dang dri'i chus gtor te /
analyzed: las thams cad pa bzlas pa'i bdud rtsi'i chu dang / yungs kar dang dri'i chus gtor te /
translated: Sprinkle the water of the mantra of all activities, the mustard seeds, and the scented water.

original: rdo rje @20b dang bcas pa'i lag ba g-yas pas reg la /
analyzed: rdo rje @20b dang bcas pa'i lag ba g-yas pas reg la /
translated: Touch it with your right hand holding a vajra.🔽Recite this:

original: aom badzra sa ma ya s'u tra m'a ti kra ma h'um zhes pa 'di bzlas nas /
analyzed: aom badzra sa ma ya s'u tra m'a ti kra ma h'um zhes pa 'di bzlas nas /
translated: Oṃ vajra samājaḥ sutrāmātrikrama hūṃ.

original: yi ge gsum gyis brgya rtsa brgyad du bzlas pas lhag par gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: yi ge gsum gyis brgya rtsa brgyad du bzlas pas lhag par gnas par bya'o //
translated: Then, consecrate it with the three syllables repeated one hundred and eight times.

original: yang dkyil 'khor gyis la /
analyzed: yang dkyil 'khor gyis la /
translated: Again, for the maṇḍala,

original: aom sarba sam sho dha ni h'um phat ces pa'i sngags kyis bum pa thams cad kyi chus bsang gtor byas pas gtsang ma'i dri chus byugs nas /
analyzed: aom sarba sam sho dha ni h'um phat ces pa'i sngags kyis bum pa thams cad kyi chus bsang gtor byas pas gtsang ma'i dri chus byugs nas /
translated: recite the mantra oṃ sarva śodhani hūṃ phaṭ and sprinkle all the vases with water. Having anointed it with scented water,

original: phyi rol du me tog gcal du bkram la /
analyzed: phyi rol du me tog gcal du bkram la /
translated: outside, scatter flowers.

original: nam mkha' la bri bar bya ba'i dkyil 'khor bzhugs par dmigs te /
analyzed: nam mkha' la bri bar bya ba'i dkyil 'khor bzhugs par dmigs te /
translated: Visualize the maṇḍala to be drawn in the sky.

original: mchod yon dbul ba sngon du 'gro bas mchod cing bstod nas /
analyzed: mchod yon dbul ba sngon du 'gro bas mchod cing bstod nas /
translated: Having made an offering of water for welcoming, make offerings and praises.

original: rang nyid de'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pas sgrub pa'i grogs po rnam par snang mdzad dam 'khyil pa'i gzugs su bsams nas /
analyzed: rang nyid de'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pas sgrub pa'i grogs po rnam par snang mdzad dam 'khyil pa'i gzugs su bsams nas /
translated: Having become endowed with the yoga of that, one should imagine the assistant of the rite in the form of Vairocana or Akṣobhya.

original: rang dang de'i g-yon pa dang cig shos kyi mig dag la dza: las skyes pa'i nyi ma dang / zla ba 'od zer ser po can bsgoms te /
analyzed: rang dang de'i g-yon pa dang cig shos kyi mig dag la dza: las skyes pa'i nyi ma dang / zla ba 'od zer ser po can bsgoms te /
translated: One should visualize the sun arisen from jraṃ in the right eye and the moon arisen from jraṃ in the left eye, both having yellow light rays.

original: rdo rje'i rkang pas thig skud de rdo rje'i khu tshur g-yon pas gzung ba lte bar bzung zhing /
analyzed: rdo rje'i rkang pas thig skud de rdo rje'i khu tshur g-yon pas gzung ba lte bar bzung zhing /
translated: With the vajra-step, one should hold the thread at the navel with the left vajra fist.

original: sgrub pa'i grogs pos de ltar thig skud bzung la /
analyzed: sgrub pa'i grogs pos de ltar thig skud bzung la /
translated: The assistant of the rite should hold the thread in that way.

original: dzdza: dzdza: dzdza: zhes pa'i yi ge dzdza: gsum gyis kyang ba skul lo //
analyzed: dzdza: dzdza: dzdza: zhes pa'i yi ge dzdza: gsum gyis kyang ba skul lo //
translated: One should encourage him with the three syllables jraṃ jraṃ jraṃ.

original: sgrub pa'i grogs pos kyang dzdza: dzdza: dzdza: zhes pa'i yi ge dzdza: gsum gyis drangs nas /
analyzed: sgrub pa'i grogs pos kyang dzdza: dzdza: dzdza: zhes pa'i yi ge dzdza: gsum gyis drangs nas /
translated: The assistant of the rite should also encourage him with the three syllables jraṃ jraṃ jraṃ.

original: de kho na bzhin du mngon du blta zhing gnas pas nub phyogs su gnas te shar du kha bltas pa dang / lhor gnas te byang du kha bltas pas /
analyzed: de kho na bzhin du mngon du blta zhing gnas pas nub phyogs su gnas te shar du kha bltas pa dang / lhor gnas te byang du kha bltas pas /
translated: In the same way, one should stand in the west facing east and in the south facing north.

original: tshangs thig gnyis lte ba dang mnyam pa'i bar snang la brkyang nas /
analyzed: tshangs thig gnyis lte ba dang mnyam pa'i bar snang la brkyang nas /
translated: The two Brahmā lines extend into space, equal to the navel.

original: rdo rje dang bcas pa'i lag pa g-yas pa'i mthe bo dang mdzub mo dag gis thig skud bzung bas 'debs shing se gol gyi sgra bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje dang bcas pa'i lag pa g-yas pa'i mthe bo dang mdzub mo dag gis thig skud bzung bas 'debs shing se gol gyi sgra bya'o //
translated: With the right hand, which holds a vajra, one should hold the chalk line with the thumb and index finger, and snap it, making the sound of a finger snap.

original: thig gdab pa thams cad du yang /
analyzed: thig gdab pa thams cad du yang /
translated: In all the line-drawing,

original: aom badzra sa ma ya s'u tram m'a ti kra m'a h'um /
analyzed: aom badzra sa ma ya s'u tram m'a ti kra m'a h'um /
translated: one should say, “Oṃ vajra samaya sūtra mātrikrama hūṃ.

original: h'um aom sv'a aa ha zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: h'um aom sv'a aa ha zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: Hūṃ oṃ svā hā.”

original: thig gi sgra des kyang nam mkha' kun khyab pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams bskul bar bya'o //
analyzed: thig gi sgra des kyang nam mkha' kun khyab pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams bskul bar bya'o //
translated: By that sound of the line, one should summon all the tathāgatas who pervade space.

original: de rnams kyang byon nas thig skud rnams la thim par bsgom mo //
analyzed: de rnams kyang byon nas thig skud rnams la thim par bsgom mo //
translated: Also, they should be imagined as arriving and dissolving into the chalk line.

original: sgra 'di'i don ni /
analyzed: sgra 'di'i don ni /
translated: The meaning of this sound is

original: sems can don du khyed rnams kyi //
analyzed: sems can don du khyed rnams kyi //
translated: “For the sake of sentient beings,

original: dus yin de phyir 'dir spyon cig / ces pa'i brda'o //
analyzed: dus yin de phyir 'dir spyon cig / ces pa'i brda'o //
translated: this is your time, so come here.”

original: thams cad du yang slob dpon dang sgrub pa'i grogs po g-yas skor du 'gro zhing phyogs thams cad mnyam pa nyid du mos par bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad du yang slob dpon dang sgrub pa'i grogs po g-yas skor du 'gro zhing phyogs thams cad mnyam pa nyid du mos par bya'o //
translated: Everywhere, the master and the assistant should move clockwise, and one should imagine that all directions are the same.

original: nam mkha'i thig gnyis bzhin du sa la yang tshangs thig gnyis ka'i lag pa thig skud dang bcas pas mnyam por smad pas gdab bar bya'o //🔽'on kyang dang por khru'i tshad kyi mandala gyi dbus su mtho gang gi tshad kyi shing bu bkod pa'i grib ma 'jug pa @21a * //
analyzed: nam mkha'i thig gnyis bzhin du sa la yang tshangs thig gnyis ka'i lag pa thig skud dang bcas pas mnyam por smad pas gdab bar bya'o // 'on kyang dang por khru'i tshad kyi mandala gyi dbus su mtho gang gi tshad kyi shing bu bkod pa'i grib ma 'jug pa @21a * //
translated: Just as in the case of the two threads in space, on the ground also, the two threads of Brahmā are to be laid down by the two hands together with the thread, and so on.🔽However, first, in the center of the maṇḍala of the measure of a cubit, a piece of wood of the measure of a cubit is placed, and the shadow of the hole and the tip of the rising [sun] are marked with two drops in the center of the maṇḍala line.

original: dang ; 'byung ba'i rtse mo mandala gyi re kh'a'i dbus gang dag tu gnas pa de gnyis su thig le gnyis byas pa ni nub dang shar ro //
analyzed: dang ; 'byung ba'i rtse mo mandala gyi re kh'a'i dbus gang dag tu gnas pa de gnyis su thig le gnyis byas pa ni nub dang shar ro //
translated: Those two are west and east.

original: de'i steng du thig skud bzung nas mandala gnyis byas pas nyar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i steng du thig skud bzung nas mandala gnyis byas pas nyar 'gyur ro //
translated: Having held the thread above that, two maṇḍalas are made, and [the thread] becomes the south.

original: de nas de'i mgo dang mjug ma'i mthar thig le byas pa ni lho dang byang ngo//
analyzed: de nas de'i mgo dang mjug ma'i mthar thig le byas pa ni lho dang byang ngo//
translated: Then, having made a drop at the end of the head and tail, those two are north and south.

original: de'i steng du thig skud bzung nas mandala gzhan gnyis bya'o //
analyzed: de'i steng du thig skud bzung nas mandala gzhan gnyis bya'o //
translated: Having held the thread on that, one should make the other two mandalas.

original: phub pa'i gnas su ni phyogs rnams su thig le bzhi byas pa'i steng du zlum po bzhi bskor bar bya'o //
analyzed: phub pa'i gnas su ni phyogs rnams su thig le bzhi byas pa'i steng du zlum po bzhi bskor bar bya'o //
translated: In the place of the cloth, one should make four circles on the four directions, having made four dots.

original: de nas phyogs rnams su nya'i mgo mjug dag gi dbus su thig skud bzung nas /
analyzed: de nas phyogs rnams su nya'i mgo mjug dag gi dbus su thig skud bzung nas /
translated: Then, having held the thread in the middle of the head and tail of the fish on the four directions,

original: 'od zer gyi phreng ba'i bar du tshangs thig gnyis rkang pa g-yon pa skyil krung phyed par byas nas rkang pa g-yas pa sa la btsugs te /
analyzed: 'od zer gyi phreng ba'i bar du tshangs thig gnyis rkang pa g-yon pa skyil krung phyed par byas nas rkang pa g-yas pa sa la btsugs te /
translated: one should draw two Brahmā lines between the garlands of light, having sat in half-lotus posture with the right foot placed on the ground.

original: de las bzlog nas 'dug cing ji ltar rigs par rgyab kyis 'gro ba'i slob ma dang lhan cig tu g-yon pa'i rdo rje khu tshur gyis thig skud bzung nas nam mkha' la thig gdab pa'i mos pas gdab par bya'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog nas 'dug cing ji ltar rigs par rgyab kyis 'gro ba'i slob ma dang lhan cig tu g-yon pa'i rdo rje khu tshur gyis thig skud bzung nas nam mkha' la thig gdab pa'i mos pas gdab par bya'o //
translated: Having sat in the opposite position, one should hold the thread with the left vajra fist together with the disciple who is going behind, as is appropriate, and one should imagine that one is casting the thread in space.

original: de ltar thig gdab pa gzhan rnams la yang ngo //
analyzed: de ltar thig gdab pa gzhan rnams la yang ngo //
translated: One should do that for the other thread-crossings as well.

original: thig gdab pa na /
analyzed: thig gdab pa na /
translated: When casting the thread,

original: mtshan ma min pas 'grub mi 'gyur //
analyzed: mtshan ma min pas 'grub mi 'gyur //
translated: one will not be successful if it is not auspicious.

original: thig skud chad na bla ma 'chi //
analyzed: thig skud chad na bla ma 'chi //
translated: If the thread breaks, the guru will die.

original: dman dang lhag pa las ni nang //
analyzed: dman dang lhag pa las ni nang //
translated: The inferior and superior are from the inside.

original: phyogs rmongs na ni slob ma 'khrul //
analyzed: phyogs rmongs na ni slob ma 'khrul //
translated: If one is confused about the directions, the disciple is confused.

original: zhes shes par byas la /
analyzed: zhes shes par byas la /
translated: Having understood this,

original: bcos pa'i cho ga yang bya'o //🔽gal te thig ni gdab pa la //
analyzed: bcos pa'i cho ga yang bya'o // gal te thig ni gdab pa la //
translated: one should also perform the rite of correction.

original: 'ga' yang nus ldan ma gyur cing //
analyzed: 'ga' yang nus ldan ma gyur cing //
translated: If no one is capable of casting the lines,

original: de bzhin g-yog po dang bral na //
analyzed: de bzhin g-yog po dang bral na //
translated: and likewise one is without servants,

original: phur pa la bcings rang nyid gdab //
analyzed: phur pa la bcings rang nyid gdab //
translated: one should bind the stakes and cast them oneself.

original: me'i mtshams su gnas pas rlung gi mtshams kyi thig dang // bden bral gyi mtshams su gnas te dbang ldan gyi mtshams kyi thig go //
analyzed: me'i mtshams su gnas pas rlung gi mtshams kyi thig dang // bden bral gyi mtshams su gnas te dbang ldan gyi mtshams kyi thig go //
translated: One who is in the fire direction casts the line of the wind direction, and one who is in the rakshasa direction casts the line of the Indra direction.

original: 'di gnyis re re zhing sgo'i tshad bcu bdun no //
analyzed: 'di gnyis re re zhing sgo'i tshad bcu bdun no //
translated: Each of these two has seventeen door measures.

original: de nas mandala lnga bri'o //
analyzed: de nas mandala lnga bri'o //
translated: Then one should draw five mandalas.

original: tshangs thig kho na gdab pa'i don du thig skud dkyil 'khor nyis 'gyur du ring par gsungs la /
analyzed: tshangs thig kho na gdab pa'i don du thig skud dkyil 'khor nyis 'gyur du ring par gsungs la /
translated: For the purpose of casting only the Brahma line, the line string is said to be twice the size of the mandala.

original: dkyil 'khor yang 'dir sna tshogs rdo rje'i lte bar chud pa'i rtsa ba'i dkyil 'khor 'khor dang bcas pa rtsa ba'i thig las phyir cha chung brgyad pa'i bar du ste /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor yang 'dir sna tshogs rdo rje'i lte bar chud pa'i rtsa ba'i dkyil 'khor 'khor dang bcas pa rtsa ba'i thig las phyir cha chung brgyad pa'i bar du ste /
translated: Also, the mandala is the basic mandala together with the retinue, which is contained in the center of a crossed vajra. It is drawn eight small units outside of the basic lines.

original: cha chung bzhi bcu rtsa brgyad do //
analyzed: cha chung bzhi bcu rtsa brgyad do //
translated: That is forty-eight small units.

original: de'i phyi rol du cha chung bcu gnyis dang / gnyis dang / gnyis dang / gnyis dang / bzhi nyid de go rims bzhin du rta babs dang / chos kyi 'khor lo dang ra dang padma'i 'dab ma dang rdo rje'i phreng ba dang 'od kyi phreng ba rnams te /
analyzed: de'i phyi rol du cha chung bcu gnyis dang / gnyis dang / gnyis dang / gnyis dang / bzhi nyid de go rims bzhin du rta babs dang / chos kyi 'khor lo dang ra dang padma'i 'dab ma dang rdo rje'i phreng ba dang 'od kyi phreng ba rnams te /
translated: Outside of that, there are twelve small units for the pediment, two for the dharma wheel, two for the archways, two for the lotus petals, four for the vajra fence, and four for the ring of fire.

original: logs gcig la ni cha chung nyi shu rtsa bzhi'o //
analyzed: logs gcig la ni cha chung nyi shu rtsa bzhi'o //
translated: On one side there are twenty-four small units.

original: logs gnyis par yang de ltar ro //
analyzed: logs gnyis par yang de ltar ro //
translated: On the second side there are also that many.

original: de bas cha chung bzhi bcu rtsa brgyad do //
analyzed: de bas cha chung bzhi bcu rtsa brgyad do //
translated: Thus, there are forty-eight small units.

original: de'i phyir @21b thig skud cha chung dgu bcu rtsa drug tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir @21b thig skud cha chung dgu bcu rtsa drug tu 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the thread for the lines becomes ninety-six small units.🔽And that is said:

original: de yang / phyogs cha mnyam par shes nas ni //
analyzed: de yang / phyogs cha mnyam par shes nas ni //
translated: Knowing the equal parts,

original: dkyil 'khor las ni nyis 'gyur srid //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor las ni nyis 'gyur srid //
translated: the mandala is twice that.

original: shar dang nub tu ring ba yis //
analyzed: shar dang nub tu ring ba yis //
translated: The east-west distance is twice that.

original: tshangs thig yang dag gdab par bya //
analyzed: tshangs thig yang dag gdab par bya //
translated: The thread of Brahmā should be correctly drawn.

original: zhes pa dang / gzhan du yang /
analyzed: zhes pa dang / gzhan du yang /
translated: And also:

original: des par 'di ni dkyil 'khor las //
analyzed: des par 'di ni dkyil 'khor las //
translated: This is certainly the mandala

original: dkyil 'khor sa gzhi nyis 'gyur bzung //🔽dbang po chu yi phyogs ring ba'i //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor sa gzhi nyis 'gyur bzung // dbang po chu yi phyogs ring ba'i //
translated: from the mandala ground.🔽The thread should be drawn

original: thig ni cha chung rjes 'gro gdab //🔽ces gsungs so //
analyzed: thig ni cha chung rjes 'gro gdab // ces gsungs so //
translated: following the distance of the directions of Indra and water.

original: ra dang 'od zer dag la cha chung gcig dang gsum nyid dam /
analyzed: ra dang 'od zer dag la cha chung gcig dang gsum nyid dam /
translated: If the distance from the ra and the light is one or three small units,

original: cha chung gnyis gnyis nyid na thig skud cha chung dgu bcu rtsa gnyis su 'gyur te /
analyzed: cha chung gnyis gnyis nyid na thig skud cha chung dgu bcu rtsa gnyis su 'gyur te /
translated: or two small units, the thread will be 92 small units.

original: de'i tshe dkyil 'khor gyi 'od kyi mtha' las thig skud cha chung bzhis lhag par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: 'khor lo'i phyi rol gyi cha chung gnyis la sna tshogs rdo rje'i ra'i rtse mo ste /

analyzed: 'khor lo'i rtsibs kyi bar rnams su yang mthong pa'o //

analyzed: ldan pa'o zhes par mi 'gyur te /
